sections.text: TO 07/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW.  THE X-RAY BACKGROUND HAS BEEN ENHANCED WELL ABOVE C CLASS LEVEL SINCE YESTERDAY. THIS ENHANCEMENT IS MOSTLY DUE TO THE RAPID DEVELOPMENT IN REGION 6442 (S11W45).  THIS REGION HAS BEEN FLARE BRIGHT FOR MOST OF THE DAY.  SPOT GROWTH IS CONTINUING AND A DELTA CONFIGURATION APPEARS TO BE FORMING IN THE TRAILER SPOTS. NEW REGION 6444 (N13E73) IS THE RETURN OF OLD REGION 6415. IT HAS PRODUCED ONLY A FEW SUBFLARES SINCE ITS ARRIVAL AT THE EAST LIMB.  REGION 6445 (S17W16) WAS ALSO NUMBERED.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 07/2100Z
sections.text: TO 08/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 6442 (S11W59) PRODUCED THREE M-CLASS FLARES SINCE YESTERDAY, AN M1/1N AT 08/0434Z, AN M1/SF AT 08/0656Z, AND AN M1/1N AT 08/1127Z. THE FLARE AT 08/0434Z WAS ASSOCIATED WITH A 2695 MHZ RADIO BURST OF 640 SFU.  THIS REGION CONTINUES TO DEVELOP BUT AT A SLOWER RATE THAN YESTERDAY. ADDITIONAL SPOTS HAVE ROTATED INTO VIEW BEHIND REGION 6444 (N14E65). THESE SPOTS COULD BE TRAILERS TO 6444 OR A SEPARATE GROUP ASSOCIATED WITH OLD REGION 6412. THIS QUESTION WILL BE RESOLVED AS THE REGION ROTATES FARTHER ONTO THE DISK. AN ERUPTIVE PROMINENCE FROM BEYOND THE EAST LIMB WAS OBSEVED NEAR S16E90 AT 08/1825Z. THIS EPL WAS ASSOCIATED WITH A LONG DURATION C7 X-RAY BURST, WHICH REACHED A MAXIMUM AT 08/1848Z, AND A STRONG TYPE II SWEEP.

sections.text: MODERATE. M-CLASS FLARES ARE POSSIBLE IN REGIONS 6442 AND 6444.

sections.text: TO 21/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION 6455 (S13W63) PRODUCED AN M6/2N FLARE AT 0028Z ACCOMPANIED BY A MODEST RADIO RESPONSE. THE ONLY OTHER M-CLASS EVENT WAS AN UNSEEN M2 AT 0643Z. ANALYSIS HAS BEEN HAMPERED BY COMMUNICATIONS PROBLEMS AT BOULDER THE LATTER HALF OF THE PERIOD, BUT EARLY REPORTS SUGGEST REGION 6455 IS STILL CAPABLE OF ENERGETIC ACTIVITY. REPORTS OF STRONG CALCIUM XV (YELLOW LINE) EMISSION OFF THE SOUTHEAST LIMB WERE RECEIVED, POSSIBLY HERALDING THE APPEARANCE OF A HOT ACTIVE REGION SOON TO BE VISIBLE. THREE NEW REGIONS WERE ASSIGNED, 6463 (S06E58), 6464 (N27E55), AND 6465 (N09E62).

REGION 6462 (S17E55) PRODUCED AN M3/SN EVENT AT 22/1527Z AND NUMEROUS SUBFLARES THROUGHOUT THE PERIOD. GROWTH IN THIS REGION, COUPLED WITH ITS INTERACTION WITH REGION 6466 (S09E64) TO THE NORTH, SHOULD PROVIDE A GOOD SOURCE FOR CONTINUED M-FLARE PRODUCTION. STRONG CALCIUM XV EMISSIONS CONTINUED TO BE OBSERVED ON THE SOUTHEAST LIMB AND MAY BE HAILING THE RETURN OF OLD REGION 6442 (S11 L-146) WHICH IS DUE TO RETURN NEAR THAT AREA ON THE 24TH. sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 22/2100Z
sections.text: TO 23/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. REGION 6455 (S13W90) WAS THE DAYS MOST ACTIVE, PRODUCING SEVERAL C-CLASS FLARES, INCLUDING THE LARGEST EVENT OF THE DAY, A C7/1B AT 0136Z. ADDITIONAL C-CLASS FLARING AND SUBFLARES WERE OBSERVED FROM REGIONS 6462 (S16E44) AND 6466 (S10E52). CONTINUED GROWTH AND POSSIBLE INTERACTION BETWEEN THESE TWO REGIONS SHOULD PROVIDE THE INGREDIENTS NECESSARY FOR M-CLASS FLARE PRODUCTION. TWO NEW REGIONS WERE NUMBERED TODAY, REGION 6468 AT (S19E05) AND 6469 AT (S11E67), WHICH MAY BE THE LEADING EDGE OF OLD REGION 6442 (S11, L-146), BELIEVED RESPONSIBLE FOR THE STRONG CALCIUM XV EMISSIONS THE PAST FEW DAYS.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE. THE POSSIBLE INTERACTION BETWEEN REGIONS 6462 AND 6466 SHOULD PROVIDE THE BEST POSSIBILITY OF M-CLASS FLARE PRODUCTION. REGION 6455 IS STILL CLOSE ENOUGH TO THE LIMB FOR AN ISOLATED M FLARE TO BE OBSERVED. CALCIUM XV EMISSIONS SUGGEST THAT THE NEW REGION IN THE SOUTHEAST IS HOT AND MAY HAVE POTENTIAL FOR M-CLASS ACTIVITY.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 23/2100Z
sections.text: TO 24/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. A COMBINED EFFORT FROM REGIONS 6462 (S15E32) AND 6466 (S08E38) PRODUCED A LONG DURATION M3/SN TENFLARE AT 0355Z. THESE WERE SIMULTANEOUS FLARES OBSERVED IN EACH REGION. THE FLARES WERE NEARLY EQUAL IN SIZE AND BRIGHTNESS, (A SN OF 83 MILLIONTHS IN 6462 AND A SF OF 65 MILLIONTHS IN 6466) AND BOTH OBTAINED AN OPTICAL MAXIMUM AT 0337Z. SIGNIFICANT RADIO BURSTS AND TYPE II AND TYPE IV RADIO SWEEPS WERE ALSO RECORDED. BOTH OF THESE REGIONS HAVE MAINTAINED GROWTH IN BOTH SPOT COUNT AND SIZE OVER THE LAST 24 HOURS. REGION 6466 HAS DEVELOPED A STRONG DELTA CONFIGURATION AND A FAIRLY STEEP MAGNETIC GRADIENT. THE SOUTHEAST LIMB WAS ALSO ACTIVE TODAY. LOOPS AND AN ASSOCIATED FLARE WERE OBSERVED BETWEEN 0739 AND 1013Z AT S14E90. A BRIGHT SURGE, TO .19 SOLAR RADII, WAS OBSERVED AT S13E90 BETWEEN 1353 AND 1418Z. AN ERUPTIVE PROMINCE WAS REPORTED AT S27E90 BETWEEN 1035 AND 1056Z. NEW REGION 6470 (S07W62) WAS NUMBERED TODAY.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE. THE GROWING COMPLEXITY OF THE 6462/6466 COMPLEX WILL LIKELY PRODUCE M-CLASS ACTIVITY FOR THE NEXT SEVERAL DAYS. THERE IS ALSO A CHANCE OF MAJOR FLARE ACTIVITY FROM THIS COMPLEX. THE ACTIVITY ON THE SOUTHEAST LIMB INDICATES THAT ANOTHER REGION WILL LIKELY ROTATE ONTO THE DISK THERE IN THE NEXT DAY OR TWO.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 23/2100Z TO 24/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT QUIET TO ACTIVE LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS. MIDDLE LATITUDES HAVE REPORTED SEVERAL PERIODS OF ACTIVE CONDITIONS AND SOME REPORTING STATIONS AT HIGH LATITUDES HAVE EXPERIENCED PERIODS OF MINOR STORM CONDITIONS. THE CAUSE OF THIS ACTIVITY IS MOST LIKELY THE DISAPPEARING FILAMENTS AND M-CLASS FLARES THAT HAVE BEEN OBSERVED THE PAST SEVERAL DAYS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE MOSTLY UNSETTLED TO BEGIN THE PERIOD. EFFECTS FROM TODAYS LONG DURATION M3 ARE EXPECTED LATE ON DAY TWO THROUGH DAY THREE OF THE FORECAST PERIOD. VERY UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE CONDITIONS ARE POSSIBLE DURING THIS TIME.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 24/2100Z
sections.text: TO 25/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION 6471 (S10E74) PRODUCED AN X10/SF TENFLARE AT 0635Z. ASSOCIATED WITH THIS EVENT WERE TYPE II AND IV SWEEPS WITH STRONG DISCRETE RADIO BURSTS. REGION DISPLAYS SPOT COMPLEXITY AS IT ROTATES OVER THE EAST LIMB. TWO M1 FLARES (NO OPTICAL CORRELATIONS) WERE OBSERVED AT 0150Z AND 0256Z. LOOPS WERE OBSERVED AT 0316Z ON THE EAST LIMB AT S14E90, SO THERE IS A GOOD POSSIBILITY THAT REGION 6471 PRODUCED THE M1 FLARES. REGION 6466 (S08E23) GENERATED AN M1/SN AT 1112Z AND AN M2/2N AT 1332Z. THIS REGION DISPLAYS A BETA-GAMMA-DELTA MAGNETIC CONFIGURATION. REGION 6462 (S16E21) HAS PRODUCED NUMEROUS SUBFLARES AND CONTAINS A BETA-GAMMA MAGNETIC CONFIGURATION.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE TO HIGH. REGIONS 6462, 6466 AND 6471 HAVE THE COMPLEXITY TO PRODUCE M-CLASS FLARES AND ISOLATED X-CLASS FLARES.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 24/2100Z TO 25/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT MOSTLY QUIET TO UNSETTLED LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS. THERE WAS ONE ACTIVE PERIOD FROM 15-18Z AT MID LATITUDES AND ANOTHER ACTIVE PERIOD FROM 24/18-21Z AT HIGH LATITUDES. THE CAUSE OF THESE ACTIVE CONDITIONS AT MID LATITUDES MAY BE FROM THE M3/SN FLARE ON 24 JAN AT 0355Z.

sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE ACTIVE ON THE FIRST AND THIRD DAYS WITH UNSETTLED CONDITIONS ON THE SECOND. EFFECTS FROM THE M3/SN SHOULD GIVE US THE ACTIVE CONDITIONS ON JAN 26 WHILE THE EFFECTS OF THE X10/SF MAY CAUSE ACTIVE CONDITIONS ON 28 JAN.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 25/2100Z
sections.text: TO 26/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. TODAY'S ACTIVITY WAS CHAR- ACTERIZED BY FREQUENT C-CLASS SUBFLARES SUPERPOSED ON AN EN- HANCED BACKGROUND. NEARLY ALL OF THE FLARES WERE PRODUCED BY THE DOMINANT REGIONS ON THE DISK: 6462 (S18E07), 6466 (S09E11), AND 6471 (S11E63). 6462 IS THE LARGEST AT 1220 MILLIONTHS. IT APPEARS TO BE FORMING TWO DELTAS: ONE JUST NORTH OF THE LARGE LEADER SPOT, AND ANOTHER JUST WEST OF THE TRAILER SPOT. OF THE THREE GROUPS THIS ONE FLARED MOST FREQUENTLY. REGION 6466, WHILE PRODUCING ONLY OCCASIONAL FLARES, SHOWS A CLEAR DELTA CONFIGURA- TION AS THE LEADER SPOT IS JOINED WITH THE MAIN TRAILER SPOT. THERE APPEARS TO BE A SLIGHT DECAY IN THE GROUP. REGION 6471 HAS ROTATED MORE FULLY INTO VIEW AS AN EKI AT 960 MILLIONTHS. THE GROUP DISPLAYED BRIGHT POINTS OF PLAGE, WITH OCCASIONAL SUBFLARES. ITS NEARNESS TO THE LIMB HINDERED MAGNETIC ANALYSIS. GRADUAL GROWTH WAS NOTED ELSEWHERE ON THE DISK, PRIMARILY FROM 6464 (N26W11), 6465 (N11W01), AND NEW REGION 6472 (N13E23).

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MOSTLY MODERATE, BUT WITH A FAIR CHANCE FOR HIGH LEVELS AS A RESULT OF AN ISOLATED MAJOR FLARE. THE MOST LIKELY SOURCES FOR ACTIVITY ARE REGIONS 6462, 6466 AND 6471.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 25/2100Z TO 26/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS QUIET TO UNSETTLED. A SMALL ENHANCE- MENT WAS OBSERVED IN THE GREATER THAN 10 MEV PROTONS, BEGIN- NING AT ABOUT 25/2100Z AND LASTING THROUGH THE DAY. THE GREATER THAN 10 MEV FLUX LEVEL STAYED AROUND 0.5 PFU DURING THE DAY. THE ENHANCEMENT IS PROBABLY FROM THE X10 FLARE OF 25 JANUARY.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE MOSTLY UNSETTLED TOMORROW. AN INCREASE TO ACTIVE CONDITIONS IS EXPECTED LATE TOMORROW, CONTINUING ON THROUGH THE SECOND DAY AND LASTING PARTWAY THROUGH THE THIRD DAY IN RE- SPONSE TO THE X10 FLARE OF 25 JANUARY. CONDITIONS SHOULD DECLINE TO MOSTLY UNSETTLED LEVELS THEREAFTER.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 26/2100Z
sections.text: TO 27/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION 6471 (S11E53) PRO- DUCED AN X1/1B FLARE AT 1550Z. THE EVENT WAS OF LONG DURATION, STARTING AT 1439Z AND LASTING 85 MINUTES, AND IT WAS ACCOMPANIED BY STRONG RADIO BURSTS, A WEAK TYPE IV, AND FLARE LOOPS. THE SIGNATURE WAS UNUSUAL IN THAT A PRELIMINARY MAXIMUM OF M5 WAS ATTAINED AT 1454Z BEFORE THE EVENT REACHED ITS FINAL PEAK AT X1. THE REMAINDER OF TODAY'S EVENTS WERE LESS THAN M-LEVEL SUB- FLARES.  REGION 6471 NOW DOMINATES THE DISK IN SIZE (1660 MILLIONTHS),  AND FLARE PRODUCTIVITY.  IT APPEARS TO HAVE A DELTA WITH A STRONG GRADIENT IN THE TRAILER SPOT.  REGIONS 6462 (S17W05) AND 6466 (S08W00) ARE STILL IMPRESSIVE IN SIZE AND MAGNETIC COMPLEXITY,  ALTHOUGH THEY PRODUCED ONLY A FEW SMALL SUBFLARES.  A NEW REGION 6473 (S14E75) ROTATED INTO VIEW TODAY, ACCOMPANIED BY SURGING ON THE EAST LIMB.  ADDITIONAL SURGING WAS OBSERVED AT N15, APPARENTLY ASSOCIATED WITH ANOTHER REGION THAT IS ABOUT TO ROTATE INTO VIEW. TODAY'S 10.7 FLUX HAD TO BE ESTIMATED DUE TO INTERFERENCE FROM A STRONG RADIO BURST IN PROGRESS AT 17Z.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE TO HIGH. REGIONS 6462, 6466, AND 6471 ALL SHOW CON- TINUED POTENTIAL FOR MODERATE OR MAJOR FLARES. REGION 6471 IN PARTICULAR SHOWS THE MOST POTENTIAL, GIVEN ITS HISTORY, ITS STRONG MAGNETIC GRADIENTS AND ITS POTENTIAL FOR DEVELOPING SHEAR IN THE LARGE TRAILER PORTION OF THE GROUP.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 26/2100Z TO 27/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS QUIET TO UNSETTLED. THE GREATER THAN 10 MEV PROTONS WERE ENHANCED ABOVE BACKGROUND LEVEL DURING THE DAY. THE FLUX WAS AN ORDER OF MAGNITUDE BELOW EVENT LEVEL, STAYING MOSTY AROUND 1 PFU.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE ACTIVE FOR THE NEXT THREE DAYS. THE INCREASE IS EXPECTED AS A RESULT OF THE COMBINED EFFECTS OF THE X10 FLARE OF 25 JANUARY, A FAVORABLY POSITIONED CORONAL HOLE, AND TODAY'S X1 FLARE. A WEAK PROTON EVENT IS EXPECTED TO BEGIN EARLY ON THE 28TH IN RESPONSE TO TODAY'S MAJOR FLARE. THE PEAK FLUX IS EX- PECTED TO BE ABOUT 20 PFU AT GREATER THAN 10 MEV AT ABOUT 1800Z ON THE 28TH.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 27/2100Z
sections.text: TO 28/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. FOUR M-CLASS EVENTS WERE OBSERVED DURING THE PERIOD. ONE OF THESE WAS FROM 6466 (S09W14): AN M1/1N AT 0154Z. THE OTHER THREE WERE FROM 6471 (S10E41) AS FOLLOWS: M1/SF AT 1249Z, M1/1N AT 1759Z, AND M1/1N AT 1955Z. AN ADDITIONAL M1/SF OCCURRED JUST AFTER THE END OF THE PERIOD AT 2101Z, APPARENTLY FROM A NEW REGION ROTATING OVER THE EAST LIMB AT N03E80. REGION 6471 DOMINATES THE DISK IN SIZE (1660  MILLIONTHS) AND FLARE PRODUCTIVITY. THE REGION SHOWS A STRONG DELTA IN THE LARGE TRAILING PORTION OF THE GROUP. RE- GION 6462 (S18W14) IS ALSO LARGE, BUT SHOWED A MORE RELAXED MAG- NETIC CONFIGURATION AND PRODUCED ONLY A FEW SUBFLARES. REGION 6466 SHOWS SOME DECAY AND RECONFIGURATION AS ITS MAIN SPOT SPLIT UP TODAY, BUT IT CONTINUES TO POSSESS A CLEAR DELTA AND REMAINS POTENT. OTHER REGIONS ON THE DISK ARE SHOWING GROWTH: IN PARTI- CULAR,  6476  (N23E66) IS A  370 MILLIONTHS EAO PRODUCING OCCASIONAL SUBFLARES, REGION 6469 (S12E03) PRODUCED AN UPPER LEVEL C-FLARE, AND REGION 6465 (N09W30) ALSO PRODUCED AN UPPER LEVEL C-FLARE. TODAY'S 10.7 CM FLUX LEVEL WAS AT 327, A NEW HIGH FOR THE CURRENT SOLAR CYCLE.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE TO HIGH. THE PRIMARY THREAT FOR MAJOR FLARE ACTIVITY IS FROM REGION 6471, ALTHOUGH A CONTRIBUTION FROM 6466 IS ALSO POSSIBLE. THESE TWO REGIONS, TOGETHER WITH 6462 ARE EXPECTED TO KEEP ACTIVITY TO AT LEAST MODERATE LEVELS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 27/2100Z TO 28/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS MOSTLY QUIET. THE GREATER THAN 10 MEV PROTONS CONTINUED TO BE ENHANCED ABOUT AN ORDER OF MAG- NITUDE ABOVE BACKGROUND BUT DID NOT REACH EVENT LEVEL. THE PEAK FLUX DURING THE DAY WAS 4 PFU AT 0850Z.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE OVER THE NEXT THREE DAYS. AN ENHANCEMENT IS EXPECTED LATE TOMORROW IN RESPONSE TO THE X1 FLARE OF 27 JANUARY, LASTING THROUGH MOST OF THE SECOND DAY. CONDITIONS SHOULD GRADUALLY DECLINE TO UNSETTLED THERE- AFTER.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 28/2100Z
sections.text: TO 29/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 6479 (N07E61) PRODUCED AN M1/SF AT 28/2101Z AND REGION 6471 (S10E28) PRODUCED AN M1/SN AT 1018Z. SURPRISINGLY, REGION 6479 APPEARS TO BE A SIMPLE BXO GROUP AND HAS BEEN QUIET SINCE THE M-FLARE. REGION 6471 IN CONTRAST, CONTINUES TO BE THE LARGEST ON THE DISK AT 1590 MILLIONTHS. THE SPOTS HAVE COMBINED INTO A SINGLE COMPACT PENUMBRAL CONFIGURATION WHICH SHOWS STRONG MAGNETIC FIELDS AND GRADIENTS ACROSS A FAIRLY SIMPLE NORTH-SOUTH INVERSION LINE, FORMING A DELTA CONFIGURATION. REGION 6469 (S13W10) WAS ALSO FLARE PRODUCTIVE AND SHOWED STEADY GROWTH DURING THE PERIOD. REGIONS 6462 (S18E31) AND 6466 (S09W26) SHOWED SOME SLIGHT DECAY AND RELAXATION. REGION 6462'S CONFIGURATION, HOWEVER, SHOWS SOME POTENTIAL FOR DEVELOPING SHEAR ON THE SOUTHWEST CORNER OF THE BIG TRAILER SPOT, AND THIS COULD INITIATE A NEW SERIES OF FLARE ACTIVITY. REGION 6476 (N07E61) SHOWED NEARLY FLARE BRIGHT PLAGE FOR MUCH OF THE DAY, AND ACCOUNTS FOR SOME OF TODAY'S ENHANCED BACKGROUND LEVELS. TODAY'S 10.7 FLUX SHOT UP AGAIN TO 353, THE HIGHEST LEVEL OBSERVED SINCE DECEMBER 23, 1957.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE TO HIGH. REGION 6471 CONTINUES TO BE THE MOST LIKELY SOURCE FOR ENERGETIC FLARES. REGION 6462 ALSO SHOWS SOME PRO- MISE AS A SOURCE OF M-FLARES AND POSSIBLY MAJOR FLARES. REGIONS 6466, 6465, 6469, AND 6476 ARE POSSIBLE CANDIDATES FOR ISOLATED M-FLARES, AND PROBABLY WILL PRODUCE OCCASIONAL SUBFLARES.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 28/2100Z TO 29/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS QUIET. THE GREATER THAN 10 MEV PROTONS REMAINED ENHANCED WITH A MAXIMUM OF 5 PFU AT 28/2335Z. FLUX JEVELS ARE DECLINING TO BACKGROUND LEVELS AT THIS TIME.

sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE GENERALLY UNSETTLED. EFFECTS FROM THE SOLAR FLARE OF 27 JANUARY DID NOT MATERIALIZE AND ARE NO LONGER EXPECTED.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 29/2100Z
sections.text: TO 30/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION 6466 (S09W38) PRO- DUCED AN X1/2B FLARE AT 0904Z. THE EVENT WAS ACCOMPANIED BY MOD- EST RADIO BURSTS WHICH TENDED TO BE STRONGER AT THE HIGHER FRE- QUENCIES. THE GROUP ALSO PRODUCED AN M1/SN AT 1446Z. THE GROUP CONTINUES TO DECAY, AND ITS DELTA CONFIGURATION APPEARED TO BE BREAKING UP NEAR THE END OF THE PERIOD. REGION 6471 (S12E15) GREW DRAMATICALLY TODAY TO 2230 MILLIONTHS (UP FROM 1590 YES- TERDAY), AND PRODUCED AN M1/SN AT 1432Z AS WELL AS NUMEROUS SUBFLARES. THIS GROUP CONTINUES TO BE A COMPACT, DELTA CONFI- GURATION WITH STRONG MAGNETIC FIELDS AND GRADIENTS. REGION 6469 (S13W25) ALSO SHOWED REMARKABLE GROWTH TODAY AND IS NOW A MATURE EKI GROUP AT 500 MILLIONTHS (UP FROM 230). THIS REGION PRODUCED AN M1/SN AT 1758Z AS WELL AS NUMEROUS SUBFLARES. REGION 6462 (S18W45) CONTINUES TO BE A LARGE GROUP AT 1140 BUT IS SOMEWHAT SIMPLER MAGNETICALLY AND PRODUCED FREQUENT SUB- FLARES. A 33 DEGREE FILAMENT NEAR S30W72 DISAPPEARED SOMETIME BETWEEN 29/2055 AND 29/2220Z. TODAY'S SOLAR FLUX JUMPED UP AGAIN TO 367. A MORE CAREFUL INVESTIGATION SHOWS THAT THIS IS THE LARGEST FLUX LEVEL SINCE NOVEMBER 10, 1979 WHEN THE VALUE WAS ALSO AT 367. (NOTE: THIS IS A CORRECTION TO THE STATEMENT MADE YESTERDAY).

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: HIGH. REGION 6471 IS THE MAIN THREAT FOR A MAJOR FLARE, ALTHOUGH A CONTRIBUTION FROM REGION 6466 OR 6462 IS ALSO POSSIBLE. M-CLASS FLARES MAY ALSO COME FROM REGION 6469, GIVEN THE RECENT REMARKABLE GROWTH IN THIS GROUP.

sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE MOSTLY UNSETTLED FOR THE NEXT THREE DAYS. A SMALL INCREASE TO SLIGHTLY ACTIVE CONDITIONS IS POSSIBLE ON THE SECOND DAY IN RESPONSE TO TODAY'S X1 FLARE.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 30/2100Z
sections.text: TO 31/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH.  AN X1/2B FLARE OCCURRED AT 31/0153UT.  THIS FLARE WAS SHARED BETWEEN REGIONS 6462 (S18W57) AND 6469 (S14W40), HOWEVER, THERE WERE ALSO FLARE BRIGHTENINGS IN REGIONS 6466 (S09W53) AND 6476 (N20E30) DURING THIS TIME AS WELL.  THE X1 FLARE WAS ACCOMPANIED BY TYPE II AND IV SWEEPS AS WELL AS MODERATE RADIO AT DISCRETE FREQUENCIES. OTHER EVENTS OF THE DAY INCLUDED TWO SMALL M FLARES, AN M1/1N AT 30/2214UT FROM REGION 6469 AND AN OPTICALLY UNCORRELATED M1 AT 31/1147UT.  OF THE LARGE REGIONS IN THE SOUTHWEST, ONLY REGION 6462 APPEARS TO BE IN DECLINE.  REGIONS 6469 AND 6466 CONTINUE TO SLOWLY EVOLVE.  THE LARGEST REGION ON THE DISK, REGION 6471 (S12E02) RETAINS ITS DELTA CONFIGURATION, BUT HAS BEEN QUIET.  THERE IS EVIDENCE OF INCREASED SHEAR IN REGIONS 6471, 6466 AND 6469.  THERE IS STRONG CA XV EMISSION ON THE SOUTHEAST LIMB.  THE 10.7CM RADIO FLUX DECLINED TODAY, THE FIRST DROP SINCE 21 JAN.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: HIGH.  THE 6462/6466/6469 COMPLEX OF REGIONS IN THE SOUTHWEST AS WELL AS REGION 6471 HAVE THE POTENTIAL FOR MAJOR EVENTS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 30/2100Z TO 31/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT QUIET TO UNSETTLED LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS.  A PROTON EVENT BEGAN AT 31/1130UT.  THE PEAK FLUX TO DATE IS 220PFU AT 31/1615UT. THE X1 FLARE DESCRIBED IN PART IA IS THOUGHT TO BE THE SOURCE OF THIS EVENT.  A PCA EVENT IS IN PROGRESS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO START THE PERIOD AT UNSETTLED LEVELS.  THE FIELD IS EXPECTED TO BECOME MORE ACTIVE LATE ON 1 FEB REACHING STORM LEVELS ON 2 FEB.  THE PROTON EVENT AND ACCOMPANYING PCA IS EXPECTED TO SLOWLY DECLINE OVER THE NEXT 24 HOURS.

THIS REGION ALSO PRODUCED FOUR OTHER M-CLASS FLARES SINCE THIS TIME YESTERDAY, AN M1/1F AT 03/2256Z, AN M2/SN AT 04/0152Z, AN M1/1F AT 04/1613Z, AND AN M3/1N AT 04/1844Z. ONLY A FEW SUBFLARES HAVE OCCURRED IN THIS REGION DURING THE PAST 24 HOURS.  A RATHER SLOW RISE AND FALL IN THE X-RAYS REACHED A MAXIMUM OF M1 AT 04/1728Z AND COULD BE ASSOCIATED WITH ACTIVITY TO THE SOUTHEAST OF REGION 6484 (N15 E62), ALTHOUGH THIS CONNECTION IS NOT CERTAIN.

sections.text: TO 08/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGIONS 6471 (NOW MORE THAN A DAY BEYOND THE SOUTHWEST LIMB) AND 6487 (N15E28) CONTRIBUTED TO TWO MAJOR FLARES. THE FIRST WAS AN M5/SN AT 07/2123Z WHICH WAS ASSOCIATED WITH A 1900 SFU TENFLARE. A COINCIDENT ERUPTIVE PROMINENCE WAS NOTED AT SW10 FROM OLD 6471. THE SECOND WAS AN M7/SF AT 08/1607Z WITH A COINCIDENT EVENT OCCURRING AT SW12. A LACK OF RADIO COVERAGE PREVENTED A RADIO BURST OR SWEEP ASSESSMENT OF THIS FLARE. REGION 6487 DISPLAYED MINOR GROWTH DURING THE PERIOD. A DELTA MAGNETIC CONFIGURATION MAY HAVE DEVELOPED IN THE NORTHWESTERN PORTION OF THIS REGION. REGION 6471 WAS ALSO RESPONSIBLE FOR AN M2 X-RAY BURST WHICH OCCURRED AT 08/0249Z. AN OPTICALLY UNCORRELATED LONG DURATION M4 X-RAY BURST OCCURRED AT 08/0748Z ACCOMPANIED BY A 200 SFU TENFLARE. REGION 6480 (S10W28) PRODUCED TWO C-CLASS FLARES EARLY IN THE PERIOD. NEW REGION 6489 (S11E68) WAS NUMBERED.

sections.text: TO 17/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. AN M1 X RAY EVENT WITH TYPE II, ASSOCIATED WITH SURGING ON THE SOUTHEAST LIMB, OCCURRED AT 0622Z. THIS WAS THE SOLE M-CLASS EVENT OF THE PERIOD AND SEEMS TO HAVE BEEN PRODUCED BY NEW REGION 6509 (S19E81). THIS IS THE LIKELY RETURN OF OLD REGION 6462 THAT GENERATED M-CLASS ACTIVITY LAST ROTATION. FOUR OTHER NEW REGIONS WERE ASSIGNED: 6505 (S13E28), 6506 (N29E48), 6507 (S03E58), AND 6508 (S12E81). ELSEWHERE, SURGING WAS OBSERVED ON BOTH EAST AND WEST LIMBS AS ACTIVE COMPLEXES ARE COMING AND GOING.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE. NEW REGION 6509 SEEMS TO POSSESS THE ABILITY TO PRODUCE M-CLASS ACTIVITY AND, TO A LESSER EXTENT, REGION 6504 (S16E51) DOES AS WELL. THE ARRIVAL OF THE NEW REGIONS AT EAST LIMB MAY MARK THE BEGINNING OF A PERIOD OF HEIGHTENED ACTIVITY SIMILAR TO THIS POINT LAST ROTATION. X RAY BACK- GROUND LEVELS ARE ELEVATED AND THE 10.7 CM. FLUX IS STEADILY INCREASING.

sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN QUIET.

sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE MOSTLY UNSETTLED THE NEXT THREE DAYS.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 17/2100Z
sections.text: TO 18/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. THREE M-CLASS EVENTS OCCURRED DURING THE PERIOD, BUT JUST ONE HAD A CLEAR OPTICAL COUNTERPART. REGION 6504 (S16E36) PRODUCED AN M2/1N AT 0730Z. THE LAST TWO EVENTS, AN M1 AT 1729Z AND ANOTHER AT 2057Z, WERE WITHOUT A SIGNIFICANT PARENT H-ALPHA FLARE. IT SEEMS LIKELY THAT THEY COULD HAVE COME FROM BEYOND EAST LIMB, BUT THAT IS MERELY SPECULATION AT THIS WRITING. A BAND OF PREVIOUSLY ACTIVE LONGITUDES IS NOW COMING ONTO THE VISIBLE DISK, AS TODAY'S INCREASE OF 53 FLUX UNITS IN THE 10.7 CM. FLUX WILL ATTEST. REGION 6509 (S20E70) IS ONE OF THE EASTERN ACTIVE CENTERS AND IS CURRENTLY THE LARGEST REGION OF THE SIXTEEN NOW VISIBLE. NEWLY ASSIGNED REGION 6511 (S23W79) WAS BORN ON THE DISK.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE. M-CLASS IS LIKELY TO CONTINUE FROM EITHER ONE OF THE SPOT GROUPS NOW NEAR THE EAST LIMB - 6509 OR AN AS YET UNNUMBERED REGION NEARBY - OR FROM REGION 6504. THERE IS A DISTINCT CHANCE OF AN ISOLATED X-CLASS FLARE OCCURRING DURING THE INTERVAL.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 18/2100Z
sections.text: TO 19/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. FOUR M-CLASS EVENTS OCCURRED: AN M1/0F AT 18/2207Z FROM REGION 6504 (S15E23), AN M1/0F AT 1021Z FROM REGION 6501 (S10W95), AND TWO UNCORRELATED M1 FLARES, AT 1229Z AND 1815Z. REGIONS 6508 (S14E60) AND NEARBY 6509 (S21E56) ARE THE MOST DOMINANT OF THE FIFTEEN REGIONS ON THE DISK. THE AREA OF BOTH OF THESE REGIONS HAS DOUBLED IN THE LAST DAY, TO APPROXIMATELY 510 AND 1350 MILLIONTHS, RESPECTIVELY. REGION 6509 IS MAGNETICALLY COMPLEX AND BRIGHT. TWO NEW REGIONS WERE ASSIGNED: 6512 (S08W48) AND 6513 (N12E66).

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE TO HIGH. CONTINUED M-CLASS EVENTS ARE LIKELY THROUGHOUT THE FORECAST PERIOD. X-CLASS ACTIVITY MAY OCCUR AS WELL. REGION 6509 IS THE MOST OMINOUS SPOT GROUP, ALTHOUGH REGION 6504 (S15E23) MAY ALSO PARTICIPATE IN THE ENERGETIC FLARING.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 19/2100Z
sections.text: TO 20/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE DUE TO AN M1/SF AT 1328Z, TODAY'S ONLY M-CLASS EVENT. THE SOURCE, SURPRISINGLY, WAS REGION 6495 (S03W83), ONE OF THE SIMPLEST GROUPS ON THE DISK (AREA 20 MILLIONTHS, CLASS BXO). REGION 6509 (S21E44) NOW DOMINATES THE DISK IN SIZE AT 1320 MILLIONTHS BUT ONLY PRODUCED A COUPLE FLARES, THE LARGEST A C7/1F AT 2207Z. REGION 6508 (S13E49) WHICH IS STACKED ON TOP OF 6509 IS ALSO QUITE IMPRESSIVE LOOKING BUT COULD ONLY PRODUCE A SUB- FLARE. SURGING AND INTENSE CALCIUM EMISSION WERE OBSERVED ON THE EAST LIMB TODAY AT S11, INDICATING THE IMMINENT RETURN OF OLD REGION 6471 WHICH PRODUCED 2 X-CLASS FLARES AND 10 M-CLASS FLARES ON ITS PREVIOUS TRANSIT.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE. THE MAIN THREATS FOR ACTIVITY ARE REGIONS 6508 AND 6509. THERE IS A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR MAJOR FLARE ACTIVITY. A MARKED UPWARD TREND IN BACKGROUND LEVELS IS EXPECTED AS OLD REGION 6471 ROTATES INTO VIEW OVER THE NEXT FEW DAYS.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 20/2100Z
sections.text: TO 21/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. TODAY'S LARGEST EVENT WAS A C4/1N AT 2329Z FROM REGION 6508 (S13E37). THE GROUP CONTINUES TO HAVE LARGE SPOTS BUT THEIR MAGNETIC POLARITIES ALL APPEAR TO BE THE SAME, FORMING AN APPARENT UNIPOLAR REGION. REGION 6509 (S20E33) IS STILL THE LARGEST GROUP ON THE DISK AND SHOWED SOME GROWTH BUT COULD ONLY PRODUCE A COUPLE OF C-CLASS FLARES. THIS REGION SHOWS STRONG MAGNETIC FIELDS BUT WEAK GRADIENTS AND LITTLE POTENTIAL TO DEVELOP SIGNIFICANT SHEAR. TWO NEW REGIONS WERE ASSIGNED TODAY: 6516 AT S11E77 AND 6517 AT S13E23. THERE CONTINUED TO BE SURGING ON THE EAST LIMB AROUND S10, SUGGESTING THAT ANOTHER REGION OR MORE PLAGE WILL BE ROTATING INTO VIEW OVER THE NEXT 24 HOURS. THIS AREA CORRESPONDS WELL TO THE LOCATION OF OLD REGION 6471.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE. THE MAIN THREATS FOR FLARE ACTIVITY ARE REGIONS 6509, 6508, 6504 AND 6497 (S13W36). REGION 6497 MAY START PRODUCING FLARES DUE TO THE POSSIBLE DEVELOPMENT OF A DELTA CONFIGURATION IN THE GROUP.

THE LARGEST GROUP ON THE DISK CONTINUES TO BE 6509 (S20E07) AT 1430 MILLIONTHS. THE REGION SHOWED SOME GROWTH BUT COULD ONLY PRODUCE SMALL SUBFLARES. REGION 6508 (S13E14) WAS ALSO IMPRESSIVE LOOKING AT 690 MILLIONTHS BUT WAS FLARE QUIET. AN EPL WAS NOTED ON EAST LIMB AT N08.

sections.text: TO 24/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. REGION 6509 (S20W08) PRO- DUCED TODAY'S LARGEST EVENT, A C8/1N AT 0333Z. THIS GROUP SHOWED SOME INDICATION OF DECAY. IT CONTINUES TO POSSES STRONG MAGNETIC FIELDS WITH LARGE (1340 MILLIONTHS) SPOTS IN A GAMMA CONFIGURA- TION. THERE MAY BE A DELTA FORMING IN THE LARGE CENTRAL SPOT. REGION 6504 (S15W40) SHOWED NEW GROWTH TODAY WITH A POSSIBLE DELTA FORMATION. THE GROUP PRODUCED A C6/SN AT 1610Z. REGION 6516 (S09E35) ALSO SHOWED GROWTH AND PRODUCED A C5/1N AT 1651Z. REGION 6508 (S13W00) GREW SLIGHTLY TO 0740 MILLIONTHS, SHOWING SOME NEW TRAILER SPOTS, BUT DID NOT PRODUCE ANY FLARES.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MOSTLY LOW BUT WITH A CONTINUED FAIR CHANCE FOR AN ISOLATED M- CLASS EVENT. THE MAIN THREATS FOR AN M-CLASS FLARE APPEAR TO BE REGIONS 6509, 6508, AND POSSIBLY REGION 6516.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 24/2100Z
sections.text: TO 25/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH.  REGION 6497 (S11W90) PRODUCED AN X1/2N FLARE AT 0806UT.  THIS EVENT WAS ACCOMPANIED BY TYPE II AND IV SWEEPS AND LOOPS WERE OBSERVED UNTIL AFTER 1600UT.  THE REGION IS MOSTLY BEYOND THE WEST LIMB AND IS NOW RELATIVELY QUIET.  SEVERAL SMALL M CLASS AND HIGH C CLASS FLARES WERE ALSO OBSERVED FROM A VARIETY OF OTHER REGIONS.  REGION 6504 (S16W53) PRODUCED AN IMPULSIVE M2/1F AT 1558UT FOLLOWED BY LONG DURATION M1 FLARE THAT APPEARED COINCIDENT WITH FLARES IN REGIONS 6509 (S19W22), 6516 (SO8E22), 6517 (S11W25) AND AND 6504.  REGION 6516 HAS BEEN SPLIT INTO TWO REGIONS, REGION 6424 HAS BEEN ASSIGNED TO THE SOUTHEASTERN PORTION OF THE GROUP.  REGIONS 6521 (S12E01), 6522 (N28W01), AND 6523 (N04E53) HAVE ALSO BEEN ASSIGNED.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE.  M FLARE ACTIVITY IS POSSIBLE FROM SEVERAL REGIONS, THE MOST LIKELY SOURCES ARE THE REGIONS IN THE SOUTHWEST, ESPECIALLY REGIONS 6508 (S12W14), 6509, AND 6504.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 24/2100Z TO 25/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT QUIET TO UNSETTLED LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS.  A SMALL PROTON EVENT BEGAN AT 25/1210UT, REACHED A MAX OF 13PFU AT 1305UT, AND ENDED AT 1335UT.  THE SOURCE OF THIS EVENT IS MOST LIKELY THE X1 FLARE FROM REGION 6497 MENTIONED IN PART IA.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE GENERALLY UNSETTLED.  THERE IS A CHANCE FOR INCREASED ACTIVITY LATE IN THE PERIOD FROM THE X1/2N FLARE AT 25/0806UT.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 01/2100Z
sections.text: TO 02/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. A LONG DURATION, OPTICALLY UNCORRELATED X-RAY EVENT OCCURRED AT 02/1457Z. ITS VERY GRADUAL RISE AND DECLINE WAS CHARACTERISTIC OF LIMB EVENTS, BUT NO ACTIVITY WAS OBSERVED FROM EITHER LIMB. THE EVENT WAS ACCOMPANIED BY A 850 SFU TENFLARE AND A TYPE II SWEEP. REGION 6509 (S22W82) PRODUCED THREE C-CLASS FLARES THE LARGEST OF WHICH WAS A C7/1N AT 02/0130Z. REGION 6508 (S14W80) PRODUCED SYMPATHETIC FLARES IN RESPONSE TO THE ACTIVITY IN 6509, BUT THIS WAS NOT SURPRISING INASMUCH AS THEY ARE IN CLOSE PROXIMITY AND SHARE A COMMON NEUTRAL LINE. NEW REGIONS 6528 (S11W59), 6529 (N10W14), AND 6530 (N11E73) WERE ASSIGNED.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW TO MODERATE. THERE IS A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR AN M-CLASS FLARE FROM THE 6508/6509 COMPLEX.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 02/2100Z
sections.text: TO 03/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 6508 (S14W93) PRODUCED AN M2/SF FLARE AT 03/1322Z WHILE CROSSING THE LIMB. REGION 6509 (S22W93) ALSO PRODUCED SUBFLARE ACTIVITY AS IT CROSSED THE LIMB. A LONG DURATION M1 X-RAY EVENT OCCURRED AT 03/1907Z AND MAY HAVE BEEN ASSOCIATED WITH SURGING WHICH WAS OBSERVED ON THE NORTHEAST LIMB NEAR N17. THIS SURGING IS PROBABLY ASSOCIATED WITH THE RETURN OF OLD 6487 (N14, L-011, CLASS/AREA DKI/770 ON 10 FEB) WHICH PRODUCED MODERATE LEVELS OF ACTIVITY DURING ITS PREVIOUS TRANSIT. THREE ERUPTIVE PROMINENCES WERE OBSERVED. THE FIRST OCCURRED AT 03/0033Z NEAR N43W90. THE SECOND OCCURRED AT 03/0158Z NEAR S25E90 AND WAS ASSOCIATED WITH A TYPE II RADIO SWEEP BURST. THE THIRD AND LARGEST OF THE THREE OCCURRED AT 03/0220Z NEAR N26E90 AND EXTENDED OUT TO 0.44 RV. NEW REGIONS 6531 (S23W24) AND 6532 (N14E68) WERE NUMBERED.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW TO MODERATE. THERE IS A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR AN M-CLASS FLARE FROM BEHIND THE SOUTHWEST LIMB WHERE REGIONS 6508 AND 6509 CONTINUE THEIR DEPARTURE. THERE IS ALSO A CHANCE FOR AN M-CLASS FLARE FROM THE NORTHEAST LIMB AS OLD 6487 ROTATES INTO VIEW.

sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT QUIET LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS.

sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE UNSETTLED THE FIRST TWO DAYS AND QUIET TO UNSETTLED DURING THE FINAL DAY.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 03/2100Z
sections.text: TO 04/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. A LONG DURATION X7 X-RAY BURST OCCURRED AT 04/1403Z. IT PROBABLY ORIGINATED FROM BEHIND THE SOUTHEAST LIMB NEAR SE22 WHERE STRONG SURGING AND LOOP PROMINENCES OCCURRED DURING THE COURSE OF THE EVENT. A STRONG TYPE II SWEEP AND 5500 SFU TENFLARE WERE ALSO OBSERVED DURING THE BURST. ALSO, THREE OTHER LONG DURATION M-CLASS X-RAY BURSTS ARE LIKELY TO HAVE ORIGINATED FROM THIS SITE: AN M2 AT 04/0533Z, AN M1 AT 04/1140Z, AND AN M2 AT 04/1934Z WHICH WAS ASSOCIATED WITH A SIGNIFICANT TYPE II SWEEP BURST.  ALL THIS ACTIVITY PROBABLY PORTENDS THE RETURN OF OLD REGION 6511 (S23, L-346, CLASS/AREA CAO/100 ON 18 FEB) WHICH APPEARED TO BE IN A GROWTH PHASE AS IT CROSSED THE WEST LIMB ON 19 FEBRUARY. REGION 6536 (N16E76) PRODUCED AN M2/2F FLARE AT 04/1557Z. REGION 6529 (N08W39) PRODUCED AN M1/1N FLARE AT 04/1750Z. FIVE NEW REGIONS WERE ASSIGNED: 6533 (S20W71), 6534 (S02W55), 6535 (S17E29), 6536 (N16E76), AND 6537 (S09E80).

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE TO HIGH. THERE IS A GOOD CHANCE FOR M-CLASS AND A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR X-CLASS EVENTS FROM THE SOUTHEAST LIMB GIVEN ITS PRESENT LEVEL OF ACTIVITY. REGION 6536 MAY ALSO PRODUCE AN ISOLATED M-CLASS FLARE.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 04/2100Z
sections.text: TO 05/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS VERY HIGH. NEW REGION 6538 (S23E77) PRODUCED AN M6/2B AT 05/0009Z, AN X1/3N AT 05/0312Z, AND AN X2/3B AT 05/0914Z. MODEST RADIO EMISSIONS ACCOMPANIED THESE FLARES. BRIGHT SURGING AND LOOP PROMINENCE SYSTEMS WERE OBSERVED IN THE REGION THROUGHOUT THE PERIOD AS IT CONTINUED TO ROTATE INTO VIEW. ITS LIMB PROXIMITY PREVENTED AN ACCURATE ASSESSMENT OF ITS SIZE AND MAGNETIC COMPLEXITY. AN OPTICALLY UNCORRELATED M9 X-RAY BURST OCCURRED AT 05/0506Z AND WAS ASSOCIATED WITH A 720 SFU TENFLARE. REGION 6537 (S09E66) PRODUCED AN X1/2B AT 05/1721Z ACCOMPANIED BY BRIGHT SURGING AND MINOR RADIO EMISSIONS. NEW REGION 6539 (N20E45) WAS ALSO NUMBERED TODAY.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: HIGH. MAJOR FLARES ARE EXPECTED FROM REGION 6538. THERE IS ALSO A FAIR CHANCE FOR AN ISOLATED MAJOR FLARE FROM REGION 6537.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 04/2100Z TO 05/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT QUIET TO ACTIVE LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS. PERIODS OF MINOR TO MAJOR STORMING OCCURRED AT HIGH LATITUDES DURING THE SECOND HALF OF THE PERIOD. THE CAUSE OF THE ACTIVITY IS UNKOWN AT THIS TIME.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE AT UNSETTLED LEVELS AT MIDDLE LATITUDES AND AT UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE LEVELS AT HIGH LATITUDES. THE ACTIVE LEVELS ARE EXPECTED IN RESPONSE TO CORONAL HOLE EFFECTS.

sections.text: TO 06/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION 6538 (S23E68) PRODUCED AN M6/SF FLARE AT 05/2329Z ASSOCIATED WITH A 1600 SFU TENFLARE. THE REGION ALSO PRODUCED AN M1/SB AT 06/0749Z (WHICH WAS ACCOMPANIED BY A 630 SFU TENFLARE) ALONG WITH SEVERAL C-CLASS FLARES. THE LEVEL OF ACTIVITY DECLINED IN THE REGION DURING THE PERIOD ALTHOUGH STRONG SURGING AND LOOP PROMINENCES PERSISTED. TWO OPTICALLY UNCORRELATED M-CLASS X-RAY BURSTS WERE OBSERVED: AN M1 AT 06/1040Z AND ANOTHER M1 AT 06/1056Z. REGION 6537 (S09E55) WHICH PRODUCED AN X1 YESTERDAY WAS ONLY ABLE TO PRODUCE A FEW ISOLATED SUBFLARES. REGION 6536 (N18E53) PRODUCED SEVERAL C-CLASS SUBFLARES. NEW REGION 6540 (N13E63) WAS NUMBERED.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 06/2100Z
sections.text: TO 07/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. THE PREMIER EVENT OF THE DAY WAS AN X5/3B FLARE FROM REGION 6538 (S25E61) AT 0755Z. A 3000 FLUX UNIT TENFLARE, TYPE II AND IV SWEEPS, AND A LARGE LOOP PROMINENCE SYSTEM ACCOMPANIED THIS ACTIVITY. FIVE OPTICALLY CORRELATED M-FLARES WERE ALSO ATTRIBUTED TO THIS AREA, THE LARGEST OF WHICH WAS AN M5/SF EVENT AT 1405Z. CALCIUM XV EMISSIONS FROM THIS AREA CONTINUED TO INCREASE SIGNIFICANTLY IN INTENSITY TODAY. REGION 6537 (S08E42) SHOWED SLIGHT SPOT GROWTH WHILE CONTRIBUTING AN M2/1N FLARE AT 0930Z AND AN M2/1B EVENT AT 1721Z. AN ERUPTIVE PROMINENCE FROM DEPARTED REGION 6533 (S23, L-150) MAY HAVE BEEN THE SOURCE OF THE UNCORRELATED M3 X-RAY ENHANCEMENT GENERATED AT 1259Z. REGION 6536 (N18E42) REMAINED STABLE THROUGHOUT THE PERIOD. NEW REGIONS 6541 (N18E07) AND 6542 (S11E67) WERE ASSIGNED.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE TO HIGH. MORE M-CLASS FLARES ARE LIKELY FROM REGION 6538 WHICH MAY ALSO PRODUCE AN ISOLATED X-CLASS EVENT. M-CLASS FLARING IS ALSO POSSIBLE FROM REGIONS 6536 AND 6537.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 06/2100Z TO 07/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT MOSTLY ACTIVE LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS WITH PERIODS OF MINOR STORMING NOTED AT HIGH LATITUDES.

sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE ACTIVE IN RESPONSE TO CORONAL HOLE EFFECTS AT THE START OF THE PERIOD WITH THE TREND TOWARDS UNSETTLED TO SLIGHTLY ACTIVE LEVELS THEREAFTER.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 07/2100Z
sections.text: TO 08/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION 6538 (S25E47) DISPLAYED SIGNIFICANT SPOT DEVELOPMENT DURING THE PERIOD AND WAS THE SOLE SOURCE FOR THE DAY'S MAJOR FLARING. AN X2/2B TENFLARE ERUPTED FROM THIS AREA AT 07/2318Z. THREE M-CLASS EVENTS WERE ALSO ATTRIBUTED TO THIS AREA, THE LARGEST OF WHICH WAS AN M1/1B FLARE WITH ASSOCIATED LOOP PROMINENCE SYSTEM OBSERVED AT 08/0233Z. AN IMPRESSIVE X1/2B TENFLARE FROM THIS AREA AT 08/2033Z CLOSED OUT THE PERIOD'S ACTIVITY. REGION 6537 (S08E28) REMAINED GENERALLY STABLE WITH ONLY ISOLATED SUBFLARING NOTED. AN ERUPTIVE PROMINENCE WAS OBSERVED ON THE SOUTHEAST LIMB AT 1937Z. NEW REGION 6543 (N12W03) WAS ASSIGNED.

sections.text: MODERATE TO HIGH. REGION 6538 REMAINS THE PRIME SOURCE FOR M-CLASS FLARES AND ISOLATED MAJOR EVENTS.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 08/2100Z
sections.text: TO 09/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. THE SPOT AREA ASSOCIATED WITH REGION 6538 (S23E32) HAS BECOME MORE COMPACT WITH A SIGNIFICANT INCREASE IN INTERIOR SPOTS AND CONTINUES TO POSSESS A SLIGHTLY COMPLEX MAGNETIC STRUCTURE. EVENTS NOTED FROM THIS REGION INCLUDE AN M1/SF FLARE AT 1245Z AND AN M1/SN FLARE AT 1422Z. REGION 6537 (S08E16) REMAINS MAGNETICALLY SIMPLE AND IS SHOWING SIGNS OF GRADUAL DECAY. AN M1/2F FLARE WAS ATTRIBUTED TO THIS AREA AT 0655Z. OTHER ACTIVITY OF NOTE INCLUDES ISOLATED SUBFLARING FR0M REGIONS 6539 (N19W01) AND 6542 (S11E41). AN ERUPTIVE PROMINENCE WAS OBSERVED ON THE SOUTHEAST LIMB AT 0200Z, POSSIBLY HAILING THE RETURN OF ACTIVITY ASSOCIATED WITH OLD REGION 6497 (S12, L-265) DUE BACK ON 11 MARCH. A DENSE 14 DEGREE LONG FILAMENT, LOCATED NEAR S29W22, DISAPPEARED BETWEEN 08/2355Z AND 09/1344Z. NEW REGION 6544 (S32W06) WAS ASSIGNED.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE TO HIGH. M-CLASS FLARE PRODUCTION AND ISOLATED MAJOR EVENTS ARE POSSIBLE FROM REGION 6538.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 11/2100Z
sections.text: TO 12/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION 6545 (S09E51) PRODUCED AN X1/2B TENFLARE WITH ASSOCIATED TYPE II SWEEP AT 1246Z. THE REGION IS BRIGHT IN H-ALPHA AND CARRIES A BETA- GAMMA DELTA MAGNETIC CLASSIFICATION. REGION 6538 (S23W05) IS THE OTHER SPOT GROUP THAT IMPRESSES IN WHITE LIGHT AND H-ALPHA. IT TOO IS A BETA-GAMMA DELTA. OTHER DISK REGIONS HAVE BEEN MOSTLY STABLE AND QUIET.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE TO HIGH. M-CLASS ACTIVITY IS LIKELY FROM REGIONS 6538 AND 6545, WHILE AN ISOLATED X-CLASS FLARE MAY ALSO OCCUR.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 11/2100Z TO 12/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN QUIET TO UNSETTLED.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE UNSETTLED THROUGHOUT THE FORECAST PERIOD. A GEOPHYSICAL RESPONSE TO TODAY'S X-CLASS FLARE IS NOT ANTICIPATED.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 12/2100Z
sections.text: TO 13/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION 6545 (S08E38) GENERATED TWO X-CLASS FLARES; AN X1/2B TENFLARE AT 0808Z, AND AN X3/2N TENFLARE AT 1548Z. IT MAY ALSO HAVE BEEN RESPONSIBLE FOR AN M9 FLARE WITH BOTH TYPE II AND IV SWEEPS AT 0305Z, BUT COMMUNICATIONS DIFFICULTIES PROHIBITED A POSITIVE IDENTIFICA- TION OF THE FLARE SITE. THE X1/2B EVENT WAS ALSO NOTEWORTHY IN THE SENSE THAT THE PLAGE WAS FLARE BRIGHT FOR ALMOST 6 HOURS. LIMITED DATA WERE AVAILABLE TODAY BUT THE REGION SEEMS TO RETAIN A HIGH DEGREE OF MAGNETIC COMPLEXITY. ELSEWHERE, REGION 6538 (S23W17) STILL DOMINATES THE CENTER DISK BUT HAS BEEN QUIET LATELY AND IN SLOW DECAY.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO
sections.text: PERSIST AT THE HIGH LEVEL. EXPECT MORE X-CLASS FLARES FROM REGION 6545 DURING THE INTERVAL. ALSO, REGION 6538 MAY CONTRIBUTE AN M-CLASS EVENT.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 12/2100Z TO 13/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN MOSTLY ACTIVE THE PAST 24 HOURS. A BRIEF EPISODE OF MAJOR STORM CONDITIONS OCCURRED AT MID AND HIGH LATITUDES FROM 0000-0300Z. THE CAUSE OF THIS SHORT-LIVED DISTURBANCE IS NOT WELL ESTABLISHED. THE THULE NEUTRON MONITOR REGISTERS A SMALL FORBUSH DECREASE WHICH BEGAN ABOUT 0600Z. AN ENHANCEMENT IN THE GREATER THAN 10 MEV PROTON FLUX COMMENCED AROUND 12/1800Z AND ATTAINED VALUES JUST UNDER 10 PFU EARLIER TODAY. THIS INCREASE IS LIKELY DUE TO A CORONAL MASS EJECTION RELATED TO ACTIVITY IN REGION 6545 RATHER THAN A SPECIFIC H-ALPHA FLARE.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE AT MINOR TO MAJOR STORM LEVELS THE MAJORITY OF THE FORECAST PERIOD. TODAY'S MAJOR FLARES ARE LIKELY TO ELICIT A STRONG GEOMAGNETIC RESPONSE. IN ADDITION, A PROTON EVENT AT GREATER THAN 10 MEV IS VERY POSSIBLE IF A FLARE- INDUCED SHOCK IMPACTS THE ALREADY ENHANCED PARTICLE FLUXES NOW SEEN AT GEOSYNCHRONOUS ORBIT.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 13/2100Z
sections.text: TO 14/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY REMAINED AT THE HIGH LEVEL. REGION 6545 (S09E23), STILL THE DOMINANT ACTIVE CENTER, YIELDED AN X1/1B TENFLARE WITH IMPORTANCE 3 TYPE IV AT 1816Z. PARALLEL RIBBONS AND UMBRAL COVERAGE WERE OTHER CHARACTERISTICS OF THE EVENT. THIS FLARE WAS IMMEDIATELY PRECEDED BY AN M2/SN AT 1741Z. THE REGION'S FLARE RATE HAS FALLEN FROM ITS OUTPUT OF YESTERDAY, BUT IT STILL REMAINS OMINOUS IN WHITE LIGHT AND H-ALPHA. REGION 6538 (S23W31) IS STILL LARGE AND DISORGANIZED, BUT IT GENERATED JUST TWO SUBFLARES.TWO NEW REGIONS WERE ASSIGNED: 6547 (S08E45) AND 6548 (S12E68).

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: HIGH. REGION 6545 STILL HAS THE POTENTIAL FOR CONTINUED X-CLASS FLARES.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 13/2100Z TO 14/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN MOSTLY QUIET TO UNSETTLED. BOTH THE FORBUSH DECREASE AND THE GREATER THAN 10 MEV PROTON ENHANCEMENT CONTINUE, ALTHOUGH THE PROTON FLUX HAS DECLINED SLIGHTLY FROM YESTERDAY'S VALUES.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE AT MINOR TO MAJOR STORM LEVELS FOR THE NEXT FEW DAYS. THIS FLARE-INDUCED DISTURBANCE IS LIKELY TO EVENTUATE DUE TO RECENT MAJOR FLARES FROM REGION 6545. THE PROSPECTS OF AN INTERPLANETARY SHOCK BOOSTING THE GREATER THAN 10 MEV PROTON FLUX TO EVENT LEVELS ARE GOOD.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 14/2100Z
sections.text: TO 15/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 6545 (S09E12) PRODUCED AN M1/0F AT 0330Z, AN M1/1B AT 0406Z, AND ANOTHER M1/1B AT 0743Z. IT ALSO HAD NUMEROUS C-CLASS SUBFLARES. ALTHOUGH LESS EXPLOSIVE THAN PREVIOUS DAYS, THE REGION MAY BE DISSIPATING STORED ENERGY BY MORE FREQUENT BUT LESS INTENSE FLARE ACTIVITY. IT IS STILL SEEN TO BE A BETA-GAMMA DELTA MAGNETIC TYPE. REGION 6538 (S23W43) GENERATED C-CLASS SUBFLARES AT A QUICKER CADENCE THAN YESTERDAY. TWO NEW REGIONS WERE ASSIGNED, 6549 (S03E66) AND 6550 (S18E70).

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE TO HIGH. REGION 6545 SHOULD BE CONSIDERED A THREAT FOR ADDITIONAL X-CLASS EVENTS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 14/2100Z TO 15/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT QUIET TO UNSETTLED LEVELS THE PAST 24 HOURS. THE FLARE-RELATED DISTURBANCE ANTICIPATED TO BEGIN TODAY HAS NOT OCCURRED. THE GREATER THAN 10 MEV PROTON ENHANCEMENT AND THE FORBUSH DECREASE ARE ONGOING.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE AT MINOR TO MAJOR STORM LEVELS THE NEXT 24 HOURS. AN INTERPLANETARY SHOCK MAY STILL IMPACT THE GEOMAG- NETIC FIELD IN THE NEAR FUTURE, ALTHOUGH THE PROBABILITY OF THAT OCCURRENCE IS DECREASED.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 15/2100Z
sections.text: TO 16/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION 6545 (S08W00), STILL THE DOMINANT ACTIVE REGION, PRODUCED A NUMBER OF ENERGETIC FLARES. THEY WERE AN X1/2B TENFLARE WITH TYPES II AND IV SWEEPS AT 0052Z; AN M4/1B TENFLARE AT 1054Z; AN M2/0N AT 15/2234Z; AND AN M1/1B AT 1807Z. THE REGION HAS GROWN SLIGHTLY IN WHITE LIGHT WHILE RETAINING A MODERATE DEGREE OF MAGNETIC COMPLEXITY. REGION 6538 (S23W54) REEMERGED AS A FLARE PRODUCER WITH A C8/0F AT 2010Z, FOLLOWED SHORTLY BY AN M1/1N AT 2054Z. TWO NEW REGIONS WERE ASSIGNED, 6551 (N21E25) AND 6552 (S20W33). BRIGHT SURGING WAS SEEN AT EAST LIMB NEAR S20 WHERE OLD REGION 6509 (S22, L-194) IS DUE. THIS REGION HAD NUMEROUS SMALL FLARES LAST ROTATION, BUT IS SITUATED IN AN AREA THAT HAS BEEN ACTIVE THE PAST 4 ROTATIONS.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE TO HIGH. REGION 6545 SHOULD CONTINUE TO YIELD PERIODIC X-CLASS ACTIVITY, AND NEWLY RESURGENT REGION 6538 MAY CONTRIBUTE SOME M-CLASS FLARES OF ITS OWN.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 15/2100Z TO 16/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS MOSTLY QUIET. RECENT FLARES HAVE HAD LITTLE EFFECT ON THE MAGNETOSPHERE. THE SMALL FORBUSH DECREASE AND THE GREATER THAN 10 MEV PROTON ENHANCEMENT CONTINUE.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE UNSETTLED AT MIDDLE LATITUDES. HIGH LATITUDES ARE FORECAST TO BE AT MINOR STORM CONDITIONS. THERE IS A SMALL BUT FINITE CHANCE OF A FLARE-INDUCED DISTURBANCE AT SOME POINT IN THE NEXT 3 DAYS.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 16/2100Z
sections.text: TO 17/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION 6545 (S08W14) PRO- DUCED TODAY'S ONLY MAJOR FLARE, AN IMPULSIVE M6/2B AT 2158Z WHICH WAS ACCOMPANIED BY STRONG RADIO BURSTS ACROSS THE SPECTRUM THE GROUP ALSO PRODUCED AN M2/SB AT 1754Z. THIS REGION SHOWED SLIGHT DECAY AND POSSIBLE MAGNETIC SIMPLIFICATION, ALTHOUGH THERE WAS STILL SOME EVIDENCE OF A SMALL DELTA IN THE BOTTOM PART OF THE LEADER SPOT. A HOT NEW REGION 6555 (S23E77) ROTATED INTO VIEW TODAY AND PRODUCED FOUR M-CLASS EVENTS: AN M1/1B AT 0219Z, M1/SN AT 0507Z, M2/2B AT 0933Z, AND M2/2B AT 1441Z. THE REGION DISPLAYED SURGING ON THE LIMB, INCLUDING A BRIGHT SURGE OUT TO .15 RADII FROM 1855-2016Z. THE OTHER PRIMARY REGION ON THE DISK, 6538 (S23W66) SHOWED ABOUT 40% DECAY IN SIZE BUT STILL PRODUCED TWO ENERGETIC FLARES AS FOLLOWS: AN M1/SN AT 0147Z AND AN M1/SN AT 0543Z.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE TO HIGH. ADDITIONAL M-FLARES ARE EXPECTED FROM REGIONS 6538, 6545 AND 6555. ISOLATED MAJOR FLARES ARE ALSO LIKELY FROM REGION 6545 OVER THE NEXT THREE DAYS AS IT CONTINUES TO HAVE STRONG MAGNETIC GRADIENTS IN A HIGHLY CONTORTED CONFIGURATION.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 16/2100Z TO 17/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS MOSTLY QUIET TO UNSETTLED. A SUDDEN IMPULSE WAS OBSERVED AT ABOUT 17/2035Z. IT MEASURED 12 NT IN BOULDER. THE GREATER THAN 10 MEV PROTONS REMAINED ENHANCED SLIGHTLY ABOVE BACKGROUND THROUGHOUT THE DAY.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE AT UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE LEVELS AT MIDDLE LATI- TUDES AND AT ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS AT HIGH LATITUDES. THE INCREASE IS EXPECTED AS A RESPONSE TO THE MAJOR FLARE OF 16 MARCH. CORONAL HOLE EFFECTS MAY ALSO CONTRIBUTE SOME TO ACTIVITY ON THE THIRD DAY.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 17/2100Z
sections.text: TO 18/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION 6545 (S09W28) PRO- DUCED TWO MAJOR FLARES TODAY. THE FIRST ONE WAS AN X1/2B AT 2126Z WHICH WAS ACCOMPANIED BY VERY STRONG RADIO BURSTS. THE EVENT WAS NONETHELESS FAIRLY IMPULSIVE. THE SECOND WAS AN M5/1B AT 1734Z, ALSO FAIRLY IMPULSIVE AND ACCOMPANIED BY MODEST RADIO BURSTS. THE REGION CONTINUES TO SHOW SLIGHT DECAY BUT IS STILL MAGNETICALLY COMPLEX AND FLARE POTENT. REGION 6555 (S22E67) HAS ROTATED MORE FULLY INTO VIEW AS A VERY LARGE FKI GROUP. THE REGION PRODUCED FREQUENT SMALL FLARES, THE LARGEST OF WHICH WAS A C8/1N AT 17/2330Z. AN ADDITIONAL ENERGETIC M1 FLARE OCCURRED AT 1301Z BUT WAS NOT OPTICALLY CORRELATED. REGION 6538 (S24W73) CONTINUED TO DECAY WITH OCCASIONAL SUBFLARES. REGION 6551 (N21W02) SHOWED SOME GROWTH TODAY AND PRODUCED A FEW SUBFLARES.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE TO HIGH. ADDITIONAL M-CLASS FLARES ARE EXPECTED CER- TAINLY FROM REGION 6545 AND PROBABLY FROM REGION 6555. REGION 6545 IS EXPECTED TO PRODUCE AN ADDITIONAL ISOLATED MAJOR FLARE DURING THE PERIOD.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 17/2100Z TO 18/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS QUIET TO UNSETTLED.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE GENERALLY UNSETTLED FOR THE NEXT THREE DAYS.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 18/2100Z
sections.text: TO 19/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION 6545 (S09W42) PRO- DUCED TODAY'S ONLY MAJOR FLARE, AN M6/2B AT 0200Z WHICH WAS AC- COMPANIED BY VERY STRONG RADIO BURSTS AND A MODERATE TYPE II. THE FLARE AND BURSTS WERE OF SHORT DURATION AND SMALL INTEGRATED FLUX. THIS EVENT WAS PRECEDED BY AN M3 AT 0122Z WHICH HAD WEAK RADIO BURSTS AND A STRONG TYPE II BUT WAS NOT OBSERVED OPTI- CALLY. REGION 6545 PRODUCED ADDITIONAL M-CLASS EVENTS: AN M1/SB AT 2142Z, AN M1/2B AT 2310Z, AND AN M1/SF AT 0614Z. THIS REGION CONTINUES TO SHOW DECAY AND SIMPLIFICATION AND ITS FLARE ACTIVITY HAS BECOME LESS FREQUENT AND LESS INTENSE. REGION 6555 (S22E55) PRODUCED OCCASIONAL FLARES DURING THE PERIOD. THE LARGEST WERE AN M1/SF AT 2237Z AND A C9/SF AT 0833Z. THIS GROUP IS NOW THE LARGEST ON THE DISK WITH AN AREA OF ABOUT 1500 MILLIONTHS, MOST OF WHICH IS CONTAINED IN A LARGE PENUMBRAL MASS WITH A NORTH-SOUTH EXTENT OF ABOUT 8 DEGREES.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MOSTLY MODERATE, WITH A CONTINUED CHANCE FOR AN ISOLATED MAJOR FLARE. REGIONS 6545 AND 6555 SHOULD PRODUCE OCCASIONAL M-EVENTS, AND REGION 6545 IS STILL CONSIDERED TO BE THE MAIN THREAT FOR A MAJOR FLARE.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 18/2100Z TO 19/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS MOSLTY QUIET TO UNSETTLED. SOME ACTIVE LEVEL CONDITIONS WERE OBSERVED AT HIGH LATITUDES DURING THE LATTER PART OF THE DAY.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE GENERALLY UNSETTLED FOR THE NEXT THREE DAYS.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 19/2100Z
sections.text: TO 20/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION 6555 (S24E41) PRO- DUCED TODAY'S ONLY MAJOR FLARE, AN M7/1N AT 0617Z WHICH WAS IMPULSIVE AND WAS ACCOMPANIED BY WEAK RADIO BURSTS. THIS REGION PRODUCED ADDITIONAL ENERGETIC ACTIVITY AS FOLLOWS: AN M2/2N AT 0016Z AND AN M1/SN AT 1821Z. THE GROUP HAS ROTATED MORE FULLY INTO VIEW AND IS A LARGE 2270 MILLIONTHS FKI GROUP WITH AN EAST- WEST INVERSION LINE IN A MAGNETIC BETA CONFIGURATION. REGION 6545 (S08W57) ALSO PRODUCED AN M-CLASS EVENT, AN M2/1N AT 0358Z. THIS GROUP CONTINUES TO DECAY AND SIMPLIFY. A REMARKABLE BRIGHT SURGE WAS OBSERVED ON WEST LIMB AT S12 FROM 0340-0512Z AND WAS ASSOCIATED WITH AN M1 X-RAY EVENT AND A MODERATE TYPE II SWEEP. ADDITIONAL OPTICALLY UNCORRELATED M-CLASS FLARES OCCURRED AT 1043Z AND AT 1102Z. A NEW REGION 6557 ROTATED INTO VIEW AT S21E70 AS A SIMPLE H-TYPE AND WAS ASSOCIATED WITH SURGING ON THE EAST LIMB.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MOSTLY MODERATE WITH A CONTINUED CHANCE FOR AN ISOLATED MAJOR FLARE. REGIONS 6555 AND 6545 ARE EXPECTED TO PRODUCE ADDITIONAL M-CLASS EVENTS, AND REGION 6555 IS THE MOST LIKELY SOURCE FOR A MAJOR FLARE.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 19/2100Z TO 20/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS GENERALLY UNSETTLED. ACTIVE PERIODS WERE OBSERVED AT HIGH LATITUDES FROM 2100-2400Z AND FROM 0430- 1200Z.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE MOSTLY UNSETTLED FOR THE NEXT TWO DAYS, WITH OCCASIONAL BRIEF, ISOLATED ACTIVE PERIODS AT HIGH LATITUDES. QUIET TO UNSETTLED CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED ON THE THIRD DAY.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 20/2100Z
sections.text: TO 21/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION 6555 (S24E30) PRO- DUCED TODAY'S ONLY MAJOR FLARE: AN X1/1N AT 2026Z WHICH WAS AC- COMPANIED BY MODERATE TO WEAK RADIO BURSTS. THE EVENT HAD SMALL INTEGRATED FLUX AND WAS FAIRLY IMPULSIVE. THIS GROUP NOW DOMIN- ATES THE DISK AND SIZE, COMPLEXITY AND FLARE PRODUCTION. AD- DITIONAL M-CLASS EVENTS FROM THIS GROUP WERE AN M1/2B AT 0055Z, AN M1/SN AT 0553Z, AN M2/2B AT 1041Z, AN M1/SN AT 1247Z, AND AN M1/1N AT 1516Z. REGION 6545 (S08W73) PRODUCED ONE M-CLASS EVENT, AN M2/1B AT 0817Z AS IT APPROACHED WEST LIMB. IT SHOULD BE NOTED, HOWEVER THAT REGION 6555 WAS ALSO FLARING AT THE TIME BUT DID NOT REACH ITS PEAK OF 2B UNTIL 0825Z, HENCE THE PRI- MARY ASSOCIATION WITH 6545. THE OTHER ACTIVE REGIONS WERE QUIET.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MOSTLY MODERATE WITH A CONTINUED CHANCE FOR ISOLATED MAJOR FLARE ACTIVITY. REGIONS 6555 IS EXPECTED TO DOMINATE MOST OF THE FLARE PRODUCTION, BUT 6545 COULD STILL PRODUCE AN ISOLATED M-CLASS EVENT.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 20/2100Z TO 21/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD RANGED FROM QUIET TO STORM LEVELS OVER THE PAST 24 HOURS. THE FIELD WAS INTIALLY QUIET UNTIL A SUD- DEN IMPULSE OCCURRED AT 06Z. THE IMPULSE MEASURED 25 GAMMA IN BOULDER. THE FIELD WAS UNSETTLED FROM 06-12Z BUT WAS FOLLOWED BY A THREE HOUR STORM PERIOD FROM 12-16Z, WITH MID-LATITUDES AT MINOR STORM LEVELS, AND HIGH LATITUDES AT MAJOR TO SEVERE STORM LEVELS. CONDITIONS RETURNED TO GENERALLY UNSETTLED LEVELS FOR THE REST OF THE DAY. THE DISTRUBANCE COULD HAVE ORIGINATED FROM A NUMBER OF SOURCES, BUT THE M6 FLARE OF 19 MARCH AT 0200Z SEEMS TO BE THE MOST LIKELY CAUSE.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE GENERALLY UNSETTLED WITH SOME ISOLATED ACTIVE PERIODS TOMORROW, AND IS EXPECTED TO GRADUALLY DECLINE TO MOSTLY UNSETTLED ON THE SECOND DAY, AND QUIET TO UNSETTLED BY THE THIRD DAY.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 21/2100Z
sections.text: TO 22/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION 6555 (S23E17) WAS RESPONSIBLE FOR TWO MAJOR FLARES AND THREE OTHER LOW LEVEL M-CLASS EVENTS DURING THE PERIOD. THE FIRST MAJOR FLARE WAS AN M5/2B TENFLARE AT 21/2344Z. MODERATE RADIO BURSTS AND A UNIQUE TYPE IV RADIO SWEEP WERE ASSOCIATED WITH THIS FLARE. THE TYPE IV SWEEP WAS OF AN INTENSITY AND DURATION RARELY SEEN. THE SECOND MAJOR FLARE WAS AN M6/1B TENFLARE AT 22/0840Z. REGION 6555 ALSO PRODUCED A LONG DURATION M2 WHICH REMAINS IN PROGRESS AT THIS TIME. REGION 6545 (S07W85) CONTINUED ITS DECAY TODAY BUT DID MANAGE TO PRODUCE A LONG DURATION M3/SB AT 22/0606Z. SURGING, SUBFLARES, AND GROWTH WERE OBSERVED IN REGION 6558 (S14E61) AS IT ROTATED FARTHER INTO VIEW.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE TO HIGH. REGION 6555 WILL CONTINUE AS THE THREAT FOR HIGH ACTIVITY. REGIONS 6445 AND 6558 MAY ADD AN ISOLATED M-CLASS EVENT.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 21/2100Z TO 22/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN MOSTLY UNSETTLED THE PAST 24 HOURS. SEVERAL PERIODS OF MAJOR STORM CONDITIONS WERE REPORTED AT HIGH LATITUDES AT 0900-1200Z. ACTIVITY HAS RETURNED TO MOSTLY UNSETTLED AT ALL LATITUDES.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE MOSTLY UNSETTLED. THE UNIQUE TYPE IV RADIO SWEEP OBSERVED TODAY IS NOT BELIEVED TO BE ASSOCIATED WITH A CORONAL MASS EJECTION WHICH WOULD CAUSE GEOMAGNETIC ACTIVITY.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 22/2100Z
sections.text: TO 23/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH.  REGION 6555 (S24E06) PRODUCED A NUMBER OF MAJOR FLARES SINCE YESTERDAY.  THE TWO MOST SIGNIFICANT WERE A X9/3B AT 22/2247Z AND AN M6/2B AT 23/0429Z.  THE X9 FLARE WAS ASSOCIATED WITH A 36000 SFU RADIO BURST AT 2695 MHZ AND A STRONG TYPE II SWEEP.  THE M6 FLARE WAS LONG DURATION, OVER THREE HOURS FROM START TO HALF POWER, AND WAS MOST LIKELY ASSOCIATED WITH A CORONAL MASS EJECTION.  THIS REGION REMAINS QUITE LARGE (OVER 2000 MILLIONTHS OF THE SOLAR HEMISPHERE) AND MAGNETICALLY COMPLEX.  REGION 6558 (S14E52) PRODUCED A FEW SMALL FLARES OVER THE PAST 24 HOURS. NEW REGION 6559 (N13E16) WAS NUMBERED.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: HIGH.  MAJOR FLARES ARE POSSIBLE IN REGION 6555.  ISOLATED M-CLASS ACTIVITY IS POSSIBLE IN REGION 6558.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 22/2100Z TO 23/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS QUIET TO UNSETTLED.  A PROTON EVENT AT SATELLITE ALTITUDES BEGAN AT 23/0820Z.  THE FLUX AT 23/2100Z WAS 5300 PFU AT GREATER THAN 10 MEV, 17 PFU AT GREATER THAN 100 MEV, AND CONTINUES TO INCREASE.  A POLAR CAP ABSORPTION EVENT BEGAN AT ABOUT 23/0931Z AND WAS 24.5 DB AT 23/2100Z. THIS ACTIVITY IS PRESUMED TO BE ASSOCIATED WITH EITHER THE X9 OR M6 FLARE MENTIONED ABOVE.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE AT STORM LEVELS IN RESPONSE TO THE FLARE ACTIVITY OUTLINED ABOVE.  MAJOR TO SEVERE STORM CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED FOR ABOUT 48 HOURS FOLLOWING THE ARRIVAL OF A SSC SOMETIME TOMORROW.  THE PROTON AND PCA EVENTS ARE EXPECTED TO CONTINUE.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 23/2100Z
sections.text: TO 24/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH.  REGION 6555 (S21W09) PRODUCED AN M5/2B FLARE AT 23/2220Z, AS WELL AS A NUMBER OF SMALLER M-CLASS FLARES.  THIS REGION REMAINS COMPLEX, AND HAS INCREASED ITS SUNSPOT PENUMBRAL AREA SINCE YESTERDAY.  REGION 6558 (S14E40) ALSO PRODUCED M-CLASS ACTIVITY, THE LARGEST FLARE BEING AN M3/2B AT 24/0249Z.  NEW REGION 6560 (S08E12) WAS NUMBERED.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: HIGH.  MAJOR FLARES ARE EXPECTED IN REGION 6555.  M-CLASS ACTIVITY IS POSSIBLE IN REGION 6558.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 23/2100Z TO 24/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD RANGED FROM QUIET TO STORM LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS.  STORM CONDITIONS FOLLOWED THE ARRIVAL OF A SSC (184 NANOTESLA AT BOULDER) AT 24/0342Z.  SEVERE STORM CONDITIONS WERE OBSERVED AT MOST STATIONS FOR THE THREE HOUR PERIOD ENDING AT 24/0600Z, FOLLOWING THE SSC.  CONDITIONS WERE MOSTLY AT MAJOR STORM LEVELS THEREAFTER.  A SECOND SHOCK ARRIVAL WAS OBSERVED AT ABOUT 24/1930Z, AFTERWHICH THE MAGNETOPAUSE WAS COMPRESSED TO WITHIN THE GOES SATELLITE GEOSYNCHRNOUS ALTITUDE FOR ABOUT 90 MINUTES.  A FORBUSH DECREASE EXCEEDED 10 PERCENT DEVIATION AT ABOUT 24/0900Z AND CONTINUES IN PROGRESS.  THE PROTON EVENT AT GREATER THAN 10 MEV AND POLAR CAP ABSORPTION EVENT CONTINUE IN PROGRESS.  THE PEAK FLUX AT GREATER THAN 10 MEV WAS 43000 AT 24/0350Z, COINCIDENT WITH THE SSC SHOCK ARRIVAL.  THE PEAK ABSORPTION AT THE POLAR CAP WAS 38 DB AT 24/0255Z.  ANALYSIS OF THE ENERGETIC PARTICLE PROFILE SUGGESTS THAT THE SOURCE OF THE PROTON EVENT, AND SUBSEQUENT SHOCK ARRIVAL, WAS THE X9/3B FLARE AT 22/2247Z. THE LONG DURATION M6/2B AT 24/0429Z MAY BE RESPONSIBLE FOR THE SECOND SHOCK ARRIVAL AT 24/1930Z.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE AT STORM LEVELS FOR THE NEXT 24 HOURS.  ACTIVE TO UNSETTLED CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED THEREAFTER.  THE PROTON EVENT AND POLAR CAP ABSORPTION EVENT ARE EXPECTED TO CONTINUE FOR AT LEAST ONE MORE DAY.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 01/2100Z
sections.text: TO 02/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. SEVERAL OPTICALLY UNCORRELATED X-RAY EVENTS WERE NOTED TODAY, THE LARGEST OF WHICH WAS AN M1 EVENT AT 01/2134Z. A C2 X-RAY EVENT OBSERVED AT 02/1050Z WAS ACCOMPANIED BY A STRONG TYPE II SWEEP AND A 400 FLUX UNIT TENFLARE. ONLY ISOLATED SUBFLARING WAS NOTED FROM REGIONS 6562 (N14E02) AND 6565 (N10E31). REGION 6563 (S10E05) REMAINED STABLE. A 14 DEGREE LONG SEGMENT OF DARK FILAMENT DISAPPEARED NEAR S34W48 BETWEEN 01/1530Z AND 01/2120Z. NEW REGION 6566 (S25E71) WAS ASSIGNED. IT CURRENTLY CONTAINS ONLY A SIMPLE SPOT GROUP HOWEVER STRONG CALCIUM XV EMISSIONS FROM THIS LOCATION SUGGEST MORE MAY FOLLOW. THIS GROUP APPEARS TO BE THE REMAINS OF OLD REGION 6538 (S23, L-343) WHICH PRODUCED NUMEROUS MAJOR FLARES DURING ITS LAST ROTATION.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW. ONLY A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR AN M-CLASS FLARE EXISTS FROM THE REGIONS CURRENTLY ON THE DISK.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 01/2100Z TO 02/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD CONTINUED TO RUN AT UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE LEVELS TODAY WITH SOME MINOR STORMING AT HIGH LATITUDES. A SATELLITE LEVEL PROTON ENHANCEMENT AT GREATER THAN 10 MEV RESULTED IN A TENTATIVE PEAK OF 3 PFU AT 02/1030Z. THE SOURCE OF THIS ENHANCEMENT WAS NOT DETERMINED.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO CONTINUE AT UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE LEVELS AT THE START OF THE PERIOD IN RESPONSE TO RESIDUAL EFFECTS FROM THE MAJOR FLARING NOTED ON THE 29TH. PERIODS OF ACTIVE CONDITIONS SHOULD CONTINUE THROUGH THE 4TH AS A WELL POSITIONED CORONAL HOLE BEGINS TO AFFECT THE FIELD.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 02/2100Z
sections.text: TO 03/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION 6562 (N15W10) PRODUCED AN M6/3B FLARE WITH SIGNIFICANT TYPE IV SWEEP AT 02/2327Z. THE OPTICAL FLARE EXHIBITED PARALLEL RIBBONS AND AN IMPRESSIVE LOOP PROMINENCE SYSTEM. THE VERY LONG DURATION OF THE EVENT SUGGESTS A SIGNIFICANT CORONAL MASS EJECTION MAY HAVE OCCURRED. THIS REGION IS CURRENTLY THE MOST MAGNETICALLY COMPLEX SPOT AREA ON THE DISK BUT HAS SHOWN NO SIGNIFICANT GROWTH IN THE PAST 48 HOURS. REGION 6565 (N10E18) HAS INCREASED SOMEWHAT IN COMPLEXITY WITH A FEW ISOLATED SUBFLARES TO ITS CREDIT TODAY. NEW REGIONS 6567 (S13E52) AND 6568 (S08E60) WERE ASSIGNED. BOTH CURRENTLY CONSIST OF SIMPLE BIPOLAR SPOT GROUPS.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW TO MODERATE. REGION 6562 OR 6565 MAY PRODUCE ISOLATED M-CLASS FLARING.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 02/2100Z TO 03/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE LEVELS AT MIDDLE LATITUDES WITH PERIODS OF MAJOR STORMING EVIDENT AT HIGH LATITUDE STATIONS. A WELL POSITIONED CORONAL HOLE APPEARS TO BE THE SOURCE FOR THE ACTIVITY AT PRESENT. A SATELLITE LEVEL PROTON EVENT AT GREATER THAN 10 MEV BEGAN AT 03/0815Z, REACHED A TENTATIVE PEAK OF 25 PFU AT 03/0910Z, AND CONTINUED IN PROGRESS THROUGH THE END OF THE PERIOD. THE PROTON FLUX HAD ALREADY BEEN ENHANCED PRIOR TO THIS EVENT WITH THE MAJOR EVENT NOTED IN SECTION 1A. ABOVE RESPONSIBLE FOR ELEVATING IT TO EVENT LEVELS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE GENERALLY ACTIVE AT THE START OF THE PERIOD IN RESPONSE TO EFFECTS FROM A CORONAL HOLE. STORM CONDITIONS ARE POSSIBLE BY THE 5TH IN RESPONSE TO THE MAJOR FLARE NOTED ABOVE. THE SATELLITE LEVEL PROTON EVENT IS EXPECTED TO CONTINUE FOR THE NEXT 24 HOURS.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 03/2100Z
sections.text: TO 04/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. REGION 6562 (N15W23) CONTINUED TO PRODUCE A FEW ISOLATED SUBFLARES, NONE OF WHICH WERE ASSOCIATED WITH SIGNIFICANT X-RAY ACTIVITY. A C3/1F FLARE AT 03/2219Z FROM REGION 6567 (S13E38) WAS THE HIGHLIGHT OF THE PERIOD. ISOLATED SUBFLARING WAS NOTED IN REGIONS 6565 (N10E04), 6563 (S10W21), AND 6566 (S24E46). NUMEROUS SMALL SPOT AREAS HAVE BEEN FORMING ON THE SOUTHEAST PORTION OF THE DISK. ALL OF WHICH HAVE BEEN VERY SIMPLE IN STRUCTURE. NEW REGION 6570 (S07E63) WAS ASSIGNED.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW TO MODERATE. ISOLATED M-CLASS ACTIVITY IS POSSIBLE FROM REGION 6562.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 03/2100Z TO 04/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD RANGED FROM QUIET TO MAJOR STORM LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS. STORM CONDITIONS FOLLOWED THE ARRIVAL OF A SI (70 NANOTESLAS AT BOULDER) AT 04/1121Z. MINOR STORM CONDITIONS HAVE BEEN OBSERVED AT MIDDLE LATITUDES WITH MAJOR STORMING EVIDENT AT HIGH LATITUDE SITES. THE SATELLITE LEVEL PROTON EVENT WHICH BEGAN 03/0815Z CONTINUED IN PROGRESS THROUGH THE END OF THE PERIOD. A TENTATIVE PEAK OF 52 PFU AT GREATER THAN 10 MEV WAS OBSERVED AT 04/1000Z. A PCA EVENT BEGAN AT 04/0845Z, REACHED A MAXIMUM OF 2.2 DB AT 04/1000Z (COINCIDENT WITH THE TENTATIVE PROTON FLUX PEAK), AND ENDED AT 04/1750Z.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE AT ACTIVE TO STORM LEVELS FOR THE NEXT 24 HOURS WITH GENERALLY ACTIVE TO UNSETTLED CONDITIONS LIKELY THE REMAINDER OF THE PERIOD. THE PROTON EVENT IS EXPECTED TO CONTINUE FOR AT LEAST ONE MORE DAY.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 04/2100Z
sections.text: TO 05/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. SIX LOW-LEVEL C-CLASS EVENTS WERE DETECTED. FOUR WERE UNCORRELATED. THE OTHER TWO WERE ATTRIBUTED TO REGIONS 6562 (N16W37) AND 6563 (S11W35). REGION 6562 HAS BECOME SLIGHTLY MORE COMPLEX MAGNETICALLY WHILE SHOWING SOME SPOT AREA GROWTH. CALCIUM XV EMISSIONS FROM THE SOUTHEAST LIMB HAVE CONTINUED TO DECLINE IN INTENSITY SINCE THE FIRST OF APRIL. THIS SUGGESTS THAT OLD REGION 6545 (S08, L-289) WHICH PRODUCED NUMEROUS MAJOR EVENTS DURING ITS LAST ROTATION AND IS DUE TO RETURN ON THE 6TH, LIKELY HAS DECAYED CONSIDERABLY. NEW REGIONS ASSIGNED TODAY INCLUDE REGIONS 6571 (S11W07), 6572 (S19W04), 6573 (S49W05), AND 6574 (N27E54). MAGNETIC ANALYSIS OF REGION 6573 INDICATES THE LEADING SPOT(S) OF THIS REGION, THOUGH FORMING IN THE EXTREME SOUTH, ARE OF POSITIVE POLARITY, HENCE THE CURRENT SOLAR CYCLE.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: GENERALLY LOW. ONLY AN ISOLATED CHANCE FOR M-CLASS FLARING IS EXPECTED.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 04/2100Z TO 05/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT MOSTLY UNSETTLED LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS. ACTIVE CONDITIONS WERE OBSERVED AT THE START OF THE PERIOD AND BETWEEN 0900-1500Z AT HIGH LATITUDES. THE SATELLITE LEVEL PROTON EVENT AT GREATER THAN 10 MEV APPEARS TO HAVE PEAKED AT 52 PFU ON 04/1000Z. FLUX LEVELS HAVE CONTINUED TO DECLINE SINCE AND WERE RUNNING AT 10 PFU AT THE END OF THE PERIOD.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE UNSETTLED TO SLIGHTLY ACTIVE. THE SATELLITE LEVEL PROTON FLUX AT GREATER THAN 10 MEV SHOULD CONTINUE TO DECLINE.

sections.text: TO 06/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. A C7/1N FLARE FROM REGION 6562 (N15W50) WAS THE LARGEST EVENT OF THE DAY. ALTHOUGH FEW FLARES OCCURRED, FOUR NEW ACTIVE REGIONS WERE BORN ON THE DISK. THEY ARE REGIONS 6575 (S10W04), 6576 (N23E18), 6577 (N09E30), AND 6578 (S19E61). sections.text: TO 10/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 6583 (N10E73) PRODUCED TWO M-CLASS EVENTS, AN M1/1N AT 0344Z AND AN M1/0F AT 2030Z. BOTH OF THESE FLARES HAD A DOUBLE MAXIMUM IN SOFT X-RAYS. THE REGION HAD A PART IN THE OTHER M-CLASS EVENT, AN M1 AT 1513Z, WHEN IT FLARED CONCURRENT WITH A FLARE IN REGION 6580 (N29E28). NEWLY ASSIGNED REGIONS ARE THE PREVIOUSLY CITED 6583, 6584 (S13W55), AND 6585 (S26E45).

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 10/2100Z
sections.text: TO 11/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. AN IMPULSIVE M9 XRAY FLARE WAS OBSERVED AT 1117Z WHICH WAS ACCOMPANIED BY MODERATE TO STRONG RADIO BURSTS. THE EVENT WAS NOT OBSERVED OPTICALLY, ALTHOUGH ONE SITE OBTAINED SEEING AFTER THE EVENT AND NOTED THAT REGION 6583 (N09E60) HAD A BRIGHT SURGE IN PROGRESS, SUGGESTING IT AS A LIKELY CANDIDATE. THE GROUP SHOWED GROWTH DURING THE DAY AND PRODUCED ADDITIONAL M-FLARES: AN M4/1B AT 0618Z AND AN M2/1N AT 0843Z. REGION 6580 (N29E16) ALSO PRODUCED AN M-FLARE: AN M1/SF AT 0315Z. THIS GROUP IS ALSO SHOWING STEADY GROWTH. REGION 6566 (S21W49) IS ALSO GROWING AND PRODUCED AN M1/SN AT 0342Z. SURGING WAS OBSERVED ON EAST LIMB TODAY AT N13.

sections.text: MODERATE. THE PRINCIPAL THREATS FOR M-CLASS FLARES ARE REGIONS 6566, 6580, AND 6583. OLD REGION 6555 (S23, L-186), WHICH PRO- DUCED 7 X-CLASS FLARES AND 29 M-CLASS FLARES ON ITS PREVIOUS TRANSIT IS DUE TO RETURN ON THE SECOND DAY AND MAY INCREASE ACTIVITY AND BACKGROUND LEVELS OVER THE NEXT FEW DAYS.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 12/2100Z
sections.text: TO 13/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE DUE TO AN M3 X-RAY EVENT AT 0852Z. THE EVENT WAS NOT OBSERVED OPTICALLY. REGION 6583 (N09E34) IS CURRENTLY THE LARGEST, MOST COMPLEX GROUP ON THE DISK AND CONTINUES TO GROW. IT APPEARS TO HAVE A DELTA CONFIGURATION AND IT PRODUCED A C8/SN AT 0153Z AND A C9/SB AT 0532Z. THE SPOTS IN REGION 6580 (N29W10) HAVE MERGED INTO A DELTA CONFIGURATION WITH AN EAST-WEST INVERSION LINE. THIS GROUP PRODUCED FREQUENT SUBFLARE ACTIVITY THROUGHOUT THE DAY. SURGING WAS OBSERVED ON EAST LIMB AT S12 AND AT S28 DURING THE LATTER PART OF THE DAY.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE. REGIONS 6583 AND 6580 ARE THE MOST LIKELY SOURCES FOR M-CLASS OR LARGER EVENTS. NEW REGIONS ARE EXPECTED TO ROTATE ONTO THE DISK AT THE LATITUDES WHERE SURGING WAS OBSERVED TODAY. THIS SHOULD INCREASE BACKGROUND FLUX LEVELS. IN PARTICULAR THE REMNANTS OF OLD REGION 6555 (S24, L-186) SHOULD BE CLEARLY VIS- IBLE TOMORROW.

sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS QUIET TO UNSETTLED.

sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE QUIET TO UNSETTLED FOR THE NEXT 24 HOURS, BE- COMING MOSTLY UNSETTLED FOR THE SECOND AND THIRD DAYS.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 13/2100Z
sections.text: TO 14/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. NEW REGION 6593 (S11E70) ROTATED INTO VIEW WITH STRONG SURGING ON THE LIMB AND PRODUCED AN M1/SF AT 1303Z. REGION 6582 (S25E03) PRODUCED TODAY'S OTHER M-FLARE: AN M1/2N AT 0400Z. THIS REGION SHOWED SOME GROWTH AND HAS A BETA-GAMMA CONFIGURATION. REGION 6583 (N09E21) IS THE LARGEST (910 MILLIONTHS), MOST COMPLICATED GROUP ON THE DISK WITH A BETA-GAMMA-DELTA CONFIGURATION. THE REGION SHOWED CONTINUED GROWTH DURING THE DAY BUT ONLY PRODUCED A COUPLE SUBFLARES. REGION 6580 (N28W22), ANOTHER MAGNETIC DELTA GROUP, APPEARED TO BE RELAXING IN INTENSITY AND WAS FLARE QUIET. REGIONS 6570 (N06W48) AND 6592 (N13E47) BOTH SHOWED MODEST GROWTH TODAY. NEW REGION 6594 (S19E21) WAS ALSO NUMBERED.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE. REGION 6583 IS THE MOST LIKELY SOURCE FOR M-CLASS OR GREATER ACTIVITY AS IT APPEARS TO HAVE THE POTENTIAL FOR DEVELOPING MAGNETIC SHEAR. REGION 6593 MIGHT ALSO MAKE A CONTRIBUTION. THERE IS A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR AN ISOLATED MAJOR FLARE.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 14/2100Z
sections.text: TO 15/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION 6593 (S10E60) PRO- DUCED AN M9/2F FLARE AT 0942Z WHICH WAS ACCOMPANIED BY WEAK TO MODERATE RADIO BURSTS. THIS REGION HAS ROTATED MORE FULLY INTO VIEW AS A 470 MILLIONTHS DKO BETA-DELTA GROUP AND PRODUCED MOST OF TODAY'S M-CLASS EVENTS: AN M2/2B AT 1438Z AND AN M4/1B AT 1557Z. STRONG CALCIUM EMISSION WAS OBSERVED ON THE LIMB IN ASSOCIATION WITH THIS GROUP. THE FINAL M-CLASS EVENT OF THE DAY WAS AN M3/1N AT 1908Z FROM REGION 6583 (N08E08). THIS REGION REMAINS THE LARGEST GROUP ON THE DISK AND MAINTAINS ITS MAGNETIC COMPLEXITY BUT SHOWED SOME DECAY DURING THE DAY. MODEST GROWTH WAS NOTED IN REGIONS 6580 (N29W36) AND 6582 (S25W11). SURGING AND STRONG CALCIUM EMISSION WERE NOTED ON WEST LIMB AT ABOUT S10 ASSOCIATED WITH THE DEPARTURE OF REGION 6570 (S10W85). NEW REGIONS 6595 (S31E60) AND 6596 (S21E67) WERE ASSIGNED.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MOSTLY MODERATE. REGION 6593 IS THE MOST LIKELY SOURCE FOR AC- TIVITY, ALTHOUGH REGION 6583 CERTAINLY REMAINS POTENT AND COULD CONTRIBUTE TO ACTIVITY. THERE IS A FAIR CHANCE FOR AN ISOLATED MAJOR FLARE SOMETIME OVER THE NEXT THREE DAYS. FLUX LEVELS SHOULD DROP GRADUALLY AS REGION 6583 DECAYS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 14/2100Z TO 15/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS QUIET TO UNSETTLED.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE UNSETTLED TOMORROW, BECOMING MOSTLY ACTIVE ON THE SECOND AND THIRD DAYS. THE INCREASE IS FORECAST BECAUSE A CORONAL HOLE WILL BE FAVORABLY POSITIONED ON THOSE DAYS.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 15/2100Z
sections.text: TO 16/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. SEVEN M-CLASS FLARES WERE OBSERVED. REGION 6593 (S10E47) PRODUCED THREE OF THESE M-CLASS FLARES. THE LARGEST WAS AN M2/SN AT 0413Z. REGION 6593 SHOWS SOME SPOT GROWTH AND DISPLAYS A BETA-GAMMA-DELTA MAGNETIC CONFIGURATION. REGION 6583 (N08W06) PRODUCED THE LARGEST FLARE OF THE DAY. IT WAS AN M3/1B AT 1602Z. REGION 6583 ALSO DISPLAYS A BETA-GAMMA-DELTA MAGNETIC CONFIGURATION. THE REMAINING M-CLASS FLARES WERE OPTICALLY UNCORRELATED. THE LARGEST OF THESE FLARES WAS AN M2 AT 0140Z. REGION 6580 (N29W47) HAS ONLY PRODUCED C- CLASS FLARES DURING THIS REPORTING PERIOD, BUT IT DOES DISPLAY A BETA-GAMMA-DELTA MAGNETIC CONFIGURATION. BRIGHT SURGING ON THE LIMB (BSL) WAS OBSERVED AT S21W90 THROUGHOUT THE DAY. THREE DISAPPEARING FILAMENTS WERE REPORTED MISSING IN THE NORTHWEST QUADRANT. THE LARGEST WAS 19 DEGREES LONG AND CENTERED AT N47W10. NEW REGION 6597 (S22E58) WAS ASSIGNED TODAY. REGION 6597 LOOKS LIKE IT HAS REVERSED POLARITY.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE TO HIGH. REGIONS 6580, 6583 AND 6593 HAVE THE POTENTIAL TO PRODUCE M-CLASS FLARES. AN X-CLASS FLARE IS STILL POSSIBLE FROM REGIONS 6583 AND 6593 IF MAGNETIC COMPLEXITY CONTINUES.

sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS QUIET TO UNSETTLED.

sections.text: EXPECTED TO REACH ACTIVE LEVELS THE NEXT TWO DAYS, THEN RETURN TO UNSETTLED CONDITIONS ON THE THIRD DAY. THE ACTIVE LEVELS ARE FORCASTED DUE TO A FAVORABLY POSITIONED CORONAL HOLE.

sections.text: TO 05/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 6615 (S10W02) CONTINUED TO GROW IN WHITE LIGHT- SUNSPOT AREA DOUBLED- AND TO TAKE ON A MORE CONTORTED MAGNETIC TOPOLOGY. THIS EVOLUTION CULMINATED IN THE FIRST M-CLASS EVENT IN A WEEK, AN M1/1N THAT ATTAINED AN APPARENT MAXIMUM AT 05/2100Z. THE FLARE IS STILL IN PROGRESS AT THIS WRITING. A DELTA IS APPARENT IN THE SOUTH- CENTRAL PART OF THE LEADER SPOTS. OTHER ACTIVITY OF NOTE IS THE RETURN OF OLD REGION 6580 TO THE DISK, NOW ASSIGNED AS REGION 6619 (N28E69). THIS SPOT GROUP YIELDED FOUR M-CLASS FLARES LAST TIME AND NOW SEEMS TO BE A FEW LARGE SPOTS WITH A SMALL AMOUNT OF PLAGE.

sections.text: TO 06/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE DUE TO THE CONTINU- ATION OF YESTERDAY'S M1/1N FLARE INTO TODAY'S PERIOD: THE EVENT STARTED AT 05/2018Z, ATTAINED MAXIMUM AT 05/2100Z, AND ENDED AT 2128Z. THE EVENT WAS PRODUCED BY REGION 6615 (S10W16), A REGION WHICH IS SHOWING REMARKABLE CONTINUED GROWTH AND MAGNETIC COMPLEXITY IN AN EAST-WEST INVERSION LINE DELTA CONFIGURATION. THE REGION PRODUCED MOST OF THE REST OF TODAY'S C-CLASS LEVEL ACTIVITY. ALSO CONTRIBUTING SOME C-FLARE ACTIVITY TODAY WERE REGION 6619 (N28E58), A LARGE 880 MILLIONTHS D-TYPE BETA-DELTA GROUP AND REGION 6621 (N07E68).

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 07/2100Z
sections.text: TO 08/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 6621 (N09E43) PRODUCED TODAY'S ONLY M-CLASS EVENT: AN M1/SF AT 1607Z. THE REGION SHOWED MODEST GROWTH AND IS CURRENTLY AN EAO BETA GROUP. REGION 6619 (N30E33) PRODUCED SEVERAL SMALL FLARES TODAY. THE MOST INTERESTING OF THESE WAS A C6/SF AT 1841Z WHICH WAS ASSOCIATED WITH A MODERATE TYPE II SWEEP. THE REGION DOESN'T APPEAR TO BE GROWING BUT DID SHOW SOME SPOT ROTATION AND IS MAINTAINING A DELTA CONFIGURATION IN A LARGE (1010 MILLIONTHS) PENUMBRAL MASS. REGION 6615 (S09W45), CONTINUED TO GROW AND IS THE LARGEST GROUP (1640 MILLTIOTHS) ON THE DISK. IT IS ALSO MAINTAINING ITS DELTA BUT HAD RELATIVELY COOL PLAGE AND COULD ONLY PRODUCE SMALL C-CLASS EVENTS TODAY.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE. REGION 6615 CONTINUES TO BE A GOOD THREAT FOR MOD- ERATE LEVELS OF ACTIVITY, AND REGIONS 6619 AND 6621 MIGHT CON- TRIBUTE AS WELL. THERE CONTINUES TO BE A CHANCE FOR AN ISOLATED MAJOR FLARE SOMETIME OVER THE NEXT FEW DAYS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 07/2100Z TO 08/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS MOSTLY QUIET TO UNSETTLED. SOME ISOLATED PERIODS OF ACTIVE CONDITIONS WERE OBSERVED DURING THE DAY.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE UNSETTLED TO SLIGHTLY ACTIVE TOMORROW IN RE- SPONSE TO YESTERDAY'S M2 FLARE. CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED TO BE QUIET TO UNSETTLED FOR THE SECOND AND THIRD DAYS.
