sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 08/2100Z
sections.text: TO 09/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. REGION 6615 (S08W58) PRO- DUCED THE MAJORITY OF TODAY'S FREQUENT C-FLARE LEVEL ACTIVITY INCLUDING THE LARGEST EVENT: A C8/SF AT 1237Z. THE REGION CONTINUES TO BE A LARGE, COMPACT DELTA GROUP, ALTHOUGH THERE WAS SOME INDICATION OF SLIGHT DECAY NEAR THE END OF THE DAY. REGION 6625 (N12E61) PRODUCED MOST OF THE REST OF TODAY'S FLARES AND SHOWED STEADY GROWTH DURING THE PERIOD. A BUSHY, 10 DEGREE FILAMENT JUST WEST OF REGION 6619 (N29E22) DISAPPEARED BETWEEN 0600-0650Z. REGION 6619 CONTINUES TO BE A LARGE COMPACT DELTA GROUP BUT PRODUCED ONLY A COUPLE OF SUBFLARES. REGION 6621 (N09E31) SHOWED SOME GROWTH DURING THE DAY.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE. REGION 6615 IS CONSIDERED THE MOST LIKELY SOURCE FOR M-CLASS EVENTS, ESPECIALLY IF IT SHOULD SUDDENLY ENTER A RAPID DECAY PHASE. REGIONS 6619 AND 6621 ARE ALSO RESPECTABLE AND COULD PRODUCE M-CLASS LEVEL ACTIVITY. THERE CONTINUES TO BE A CHANCE FOR AN ISOLATED MAJOR FLARE OVER THE NEXT FEW DAYS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 08/2100Z TO 09/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS QUIET TO UNSETTLED FROM THE START OF THE DAY UNTIL ABOUT 1500Z WHEN CONDITIONS BECAME UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE. THE INCREASE APPEARS TO BE A RESULT OF THE M2 SOLAR FLARE OF 07 MAY.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO PERSIST AT UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE LEVELS FOR THE NEXT TWELVE HOURS. AFTER THAT CONDITIONS SHOULD RETURN TO QUIET TO UNSETTLED LEVELS THROUGH THE END OF THE SECOND DAY. ACTIVE CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED ON THE THIRD DAY IN RESPONSE TO TODAY'S DISAPPEARING FILAMENT AND POSSIBLY IN RESPONSE TO THE ARRIVAL OF A SHOCK FROM YESTERDAY'S TYPE II RADIO SWEEP EVENT.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 09/2100Z
sections.text: TO 10/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. AN M1/SF FROM REGION 6615 (S10W71) AT 1949UT WAS THE LARGEST EVENT OF THE DAY. REGION 6619 (N29E11) HAS BEEN THE BUSIEST OF THE DAY PRODUCING NUMEROUS C-CLASS AND SUBFLARES, INCLUDING AN INTERESTING THREE PEAKED FLARE WHICH CULMINATED AT C7/SF AT 0338UT. NEW REGION 6627 (S18W64) EMERGED JUST SOUTHEAST OF REGION 6615.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE. THE INTERACTION BETWEEN REGION 6615 AND NEW REGION 6627 SHOULD PROVIDE THE GREATEST CHANCE OF MODERATE ACTIVITY AND ISOLATED MAJOR FLARING. SEVERAL OTHER REGIONS, INCLUDING 6619 AND 6621 (N10E19) REMAIN RESPECTABLE AND APPEAR CAPABLE OF ADDING ADDITIONAL M-CLASS ACTIVITY.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 09/2100Z TO 10/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT MOSTLY QUIET TO UNSETTLED LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS. THERE WERE SEVERAL PERIODS OF ACTIVE CONDITIONS AT HIGH LATITUDES FROM 0900-1500UT. A SATELLITE LEVEL PROTON ENHANCEMENT BEGAN AROUND 0200UT AND CONTINUES IN PROGRESS AT ABOUT 4 PFU. THE SOURCE OF THIS ENHANCEMENT IS NOT READILY APPARENT.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE MOSTLY UNSETTLED. PERIODS OF ACTIVE CONDITIONS ARE POSSIBLE THE NEXT 24-36 HOURS IN RESPONSE TO YESTERDAY'S DISAPPEARING FILAMENT. CONDITIONS SHOULD RETURN TO MOSTLY UNSETTLED THEREAFTER. SINCE THE SOURCE OF THE PROTON ENHANCEMENT IS NOT DETERMINED, IT IS DIFFICULT TO PREDICT WHETHER IT WILL REACH EVENT CRITERIA. HOWEVER, FROM ITS PRESENT RATE OF INCREASE IT DOES NOT APPEAR THAT IT WILL, OR WILL BE A VERY SMALL EVENT.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 10/2100Z
sections.text: TO 11/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE.  REGION 6615 (S08W85) PRODUCED THREE SMALL M-CLASS FLARES, AN M1/SF AT 11/0814Z, AN M3/SN AT 11/1325Z, AND AN M1/SF AT 11/1523Z.  THIS REGION REMAINS LARGE AND APPEARS TO STILL HAVE A DELTA CONFIGURATION. REGION 6619 (N29W03) PRODUCED A LONG DURATION M1/SN BEGINNING AT ABOUT 11/1950Z.  THIS FLARE IS ASSOCIATED WITH A 2695 MHZ BURST OF 20000 SFU AND REMAINS IN PROGRESS AT THIS TIME. REGION 6621 (N11E05) PRODUCED A FEW SUBFLARES BUT NONE OF THEM HAD SIGNIFICANT X-RAY OUTPUT.  REGION 6624 (S17E30) IS EMERGING RAPIDLY.  NEW REGIONS NUMBERED INCLUDE 6628 (N08W73), 6629 (S16W49), AND 6630 (S11E69).

sections.text: MODERATE.  REGION 6615 MAY PRODUCE ANOTHER M-CLASS FLARE BEFORE IT ROTATES BEYOND THE WEST LIMB.  ADDITIONAL M-CLASS FLARES ARE EXPECTED IN REGION 6619.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 11/2100Z
sections.text: TO 12/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE.  REGION 6624 (S16E17) PRODUCED AN M1/2B AT 12/1736Z.  THIS REGION HAS CONTINUED TO EMERGE RAPIDLY DURING THE PAST 24 HOURS.  SUNSPOT AREA HAS MORE THAN DOUBLED SINCE YESTERDAY WITH PENUMBRA FORMING ON THE INTERMEDIATE SPOTS.  THIS REGION ALSO PRODUCED SEVERAL SMALL SUBFLARES AND FREQUENT PLAGE FLUCTUATIONS CHARACTERISTIC OF RAPIDLY EMERGING REGIONS.  REGION 6619 (N29W16) HAS SHOWN LITTLE ACTIVITY SINCE YESTERDAY'S LONG DURATION M2/SN AT 11/2212Z.  THIS REGION HAS NOT CHANGED IN APPEARANCE, IT REMAINS LARGE AND STILL POSSESSES A DELTA CONFIGURATION.  NEW REGION 6631 (N14E11) WAS NUMBERED.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 12/2100Z
sections.text: TO 13/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH.  AN M8 FLARE OCCURRED 13/0144UT.  THIS EVENT WAS ACCOMPANIED BY SMALL RADIO BURSTS AND TYPE II AND IV SWEEPS.  LOOPS WERE OBSERVED OVER THE SOUTH WEST LIMB SEVERAL HOURS LATER.  THE SOURCE OF THIS EVENT IS THOUGHT TO BE REGION 6615 (S09 W110) WHICH CROSSED WEST LIMB ON 12 MAY.  IN ADDITION TO THE M8, SEVERAL SMALLER M CLASS FLARES WERE NOTED, HOWEVER, MOST WERE OPTICALLY UNCORRELATED. REGION 6619 (N30W28) REMAINS THE LARGEST SPOT GROUP ON THE DISK BUT HAS BEEN QUIET.  GROWTH IN REGION 6624 (S17E04) APPEARS TO HAVE SLOWED.  REGION 6632 (SO8E10) WAS ASSIGNED.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW TO MODERATE.  NO MAJOR ACTIVE REGIONS ARE DUE TO RETURN IN THE NEXT THREE DAYS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 12/2100Z TO 13/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT QUIET TO MINOR STORM LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS.  THE FIELD WAS QUIET UNTIL 0900UT WHEN A SUDDEN IMPULSE WAS OBSERVED (52 GAMMAS AT BOULDER).  THE FIELD HAS BEEN AT STORM LEVELS FOLLOWING THE SI.  THE SOURCE OF THIS ACTIVITY IS PROBABLY THE LONG DURATION M2 FLARE FROM REGION 6619 LATE ON 11 MAY.  A PROTON EVENT, MOST LIKELY FROM THE M8 FLARE MENTIONED IN PART IA, BEGAN AT 0300UT AND REACHED A PEAK OF 350PFU AT 0910UT.  A PCA IS ACCOMPANYING THIS EVENT.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE.  THERE MAY BE AN INCREASE IN ACTIVITY LATE IN THE PERIOD FROM A CORONAL HOLE NOW LOCATED AT CENTRAL MERIDIAN.

sections.text: TO 15/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. THE LARGEST EVENT OF THE DAY WAS A C6/SN FROM REGION 6624 (S17W24) AT 2043Z. THE REMAINDER OF TODAY'S ACTIVITY WAS CONFINED TO LOW LEVEL C-CLASS FLARES AND SUBFLARES MOSTLY FROM REGIONS 6624 AND 6633 (S12E64). A NINE DEGREE FILAMENT DISAPPEARED FROM NEAR S22W41 SOMETIME BETWEEN 0730 AND 1410Z.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW TO MODERATE. REGION 6619 (N30W53) STILL APPEARS TO HAVE THE MOST POTENTIAL FOR ISOLATED M-CLASS ACTIVITY, ALTHOUGH IT HAS BEEN STABLE TODAY. OTHER REGIONS WITH POTENTIAL INCLUDE 6624 AND 6633.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 14/2100Z TO 15/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT QUIET TO UNSETTLED LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS. THE SOURCE OF YESTERDAY'S GEOMAGNETIC ACTIVITY HAS NOT BEEN DETERMINED, HOWEVER, THERE WERE A NUMBER OF POSSIBLE SOURCES.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE MOSTLY UNSETTLED. PERIODS OF ACTIVE CONDITIONS ARE POSSIBLE THE NEXT TWO DAYS DUE TO THE EFFECTS OF A CORONAL HOLE. BY DAY THREE, CONDITIONS SHOULD BE MOSTLY QUIET.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 15/2100Z
sections.text: TO 16/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION 6619 (N30W67) PRODUCED AN M8/2B FLARE AT 16/0703Z. THE FLARE WAS ACCOMPANIED BY MAJOR TYPES II AND IV RADIO SWEEPS AND A 5000 SFU TENFLARE. THE REGION STABLIZED AFTER THE FLARE. REGION 6624 (S16W38) DISPLAYED MINOR GROWTH AND PRODUCED OCCASIONAL SUBFLARES. NEW REGION 6634 (N13W03) EMERGED EARLY IN THE PERIOD AND GREW AT A MODERATE PACE. NEW REGION 6635 (S24E13) WAS ALSO NUMBERED.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE. REGION 6619 MAY PRODUCE M-CLASS ACTIVITY AS IT BEGINS TO APPROACH THE LIMB. THIS REGION ALSO POSES A SLIGHT THREAT FOR ADDITIONAL MAJOR FLARE ACTIVITY.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 15/2100Z TO 16/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT QUIET TO UNSETTLED LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS. A SUDDEN IMPULSE OF 44 NANOTESLA WAS RECORDED BY THE BOULDER MAGNETOMETER AT 16/2040Z.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE MOSTLY UNSETTLED TOMORROW WITH ISOLATED PERIODS OF ACTIVE LEVELS POSSIBLE IN THE WAKE OF THE SUDDEN IMPULSE. ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO INCREASE TO ACTIVE LEVELS DURING THE REMAINDER OF THE PERIOD IN RESPONSE TO THE MAJOR FLARE MENTIONED ABOVE WITH PERIODS OF MINOR STORMING POSSIBLE AT HIGH LATITUDES.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 16/2100Z
sections.text: TO 17/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 6619 (N31W79) PRODUCED AN M3/SF AT 17/0909Z. AN ERUPTIVE PROMINENCE REACHING 0.20 RV WAS ASSOCIATED WITH THE FLARE, BUT DISCRETE RADIO EMISSIONS WERE MODEST. THIS REGION PRODUCED SUBFLARES THROUGHOUT THE PERIOD AND DISPLAYED NO SIGNIFICANT CHANGE IN SIZE OR COMPLEXITY. REGION 6624 (S15W49) SHOWED MINOR GROWTH AND PRODUCED A C7/1B FLARE AT 17/1344Z. REGION 6633 (S12E37) ALSO DISPLAYED MINOR GROWTH AND PRODUCED SEVERAL SUBFLARES DURING THE SECOND HALF OF THE PERIOD. A 16 DEGREE FILAMENT, FORMERLY POSITIONED AT N27W12, DISAPPEARED DURING THE SECOND HALF OF THE PERIOD. NEW REGION 6636 (N18E22) AND PLAGE REGION 6637 (S26E64) WERE NUMBERED.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE. REGION 6619 MAY PRODUCE M-CLASS ACTIVITY WHILE BEGINNING ITS PASSAGE ACROSS THE WEST LIMB. THERE IS ALSO A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR AN X-CLASS FLARE FROM THIS REGION. C-CLASS FLARES ARE EXPECTED FROM REGIONS 6624 AND 6633.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 16/2100Z TO 17/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT QUIET TO MINOR STORM LEVELS AT MIDDLE LATITUDES. THE HIGH LATITUDE FIELD RANGED FROM UNSETTLED TO MAJOR STORM LEVELS. THE STORMING OCCURRED FROM 17/0300-1200Z FOLLOWING A SUDDEN IMPULSE (44 NANOTESLA AT 16/2040Z AS MEASURED BY THE BOULDER USGS MAGNETOMETER).

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE AT ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS TOMORROW IN RESPONSE TO THE M8/2B FLARE THAT OCCURRED AT 16/0703Z. THE SHOCK IS EXPECTED TO ARRIVE NEAR MIDDAY. THE FIELD IS EXPECTED TO DECLINE TO MOSTLY ACTIVE LEVELS ON THE SECOND DAY AS FLARE EFFECTS SUBSIDE. UNSETTLED CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED ON THE FINAL DAY OF THE PERIOD.

sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT QUIET LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS. A SLIGHT ENHANCEMENT IN THE GREATER THAN 10 MEV PROTON FLUX BEGAN NEAR 18/1500Z IN THE WAKE OF THE X2/2B FLARE.

sections.text: TO 19/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 6633 (S12E11) PRODUCED A LONG DURATION M1/1B FLARE AT 19/1404Z WHICH WAS ASSOCIATED WITH A MINOR TYPE IV SWEEP BURST. sections.text: LOW TO MODERATE. REGION 6633 MAY PRODUCE ISOLATED M-CLASS ACTIVITY. OTHERWISE, OCCASIONAL C-CLASS SUBFLARES ARE EXPECTED.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 18/2100Z TO 19/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT QUIET LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS. THE GREATER THAN 10 MEV PROTON ENHANCEMENT WHICH BEGAN NEAR 18/1500Z REACHED A MAXIMUM FLUX OF 7.8 PFU AT 19/0310Z. THEREAFTER, THE FLUX GRADUALLY DECLINED.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE AT ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS ON DAY ONE IN RESPONSE TO THE X2/2B FLARE OF 18 MAY. THE FIELD IS EXPECTED TO BE AT UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE LEVELS ON THE SECOND DAY AS FLARE EFFECTS SUBSIDE. UNSETTLED LEVELS ARE EXPECTED ON THE FINAL DAY.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 21/2100Z
sections.text: TO 22/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. NEW REGION 6644 (N20E64) CONTINUED TO PRODUCE OCCASIONAL FLARING WITH A C3/1N EVENT AT 0555Z NOTED AS ITS LARGEST. THIS REGIONS COMPLETE SPOT GROUP HAS NOW ROTATED INTO VIEW AND APPEARS ONLY MODEST IN SIZE. REGION 6638 (N18W22) HAS SHOWN ONLY SLIGHT GROWTH WITH SEVERAL SMALL C-CLASS EVENTS TO ITS CREDIT. A C6/2N FLARE ERUPTED IN REGION 6637 (S26W04) AT 0029Z. THE FLARE EXHIBITED PARALLEL RIBBONS AND OCCURED IN A REGION THAT WAS VOID OF SPOTS AT THE TIME. A SIMPLE SPOT AREA HAS SINCE FORMED IN THIS REGION. NEW REGIONS ASSIGNED INCLUDE 6645 (N05E29), 6646 (S14W16), AND 6644 NOTED ABOVE.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW BUT WITH AN INCREASING CHANCE FOR AN ISOLATED M-CLASS FLARE.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 21/2100Z TO 22/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS. A SUDDEN IMPULSE, MEASURING 43 NANOTESLAS AT BOULDER, WAS OBSERVED AT 22/0018Z. ISOLATED PERIODS OF ACTIVE CONDITIONS FOLLOWED THIS EVENT WHICH MAY HAVE BEEN DUE TO EFFECTS FROM A MODEST SIZED FILAMENT THAT DISAPPEARED LATE ON THE 18TH. SATELLITE LEVEL PROTONS AT GREATER THAN 10 MEV REMAINED SLIGHTLY ENHANCED ABOVE BACKGROUND LEVELS THROUGHOUT THE PERIOD.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE UNSETTLED WITH PERIODS OF ACTIVE CONDITIONS.

sections.text: TO 25/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. REGION 6644 (N20E29) CONTINUED TO DISPLAY SIGNIFICANT GROWTH AND INCREASED COMPLEXITY WHILE CONTRIBUTING THE MAJORITY OF THE FLARE ACTIVITY ON THE DISK. SEVERAL C-CLASS EVENTS WERE ATTRIBUTED TO THIS AREA TODAY. REGIONS 6646 (S14W57) AND 6647 (N17W20) ALSO SHOWED NOTABLE GROWTH. sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 27/2100Z
sections.text: TO 28/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION 6654 (N06E54) SINGLEHANDEDLY CAUSED THE INCREASE, PRODUCING NO FEWER THAN NINE M-CLASS EVENTS IN THE PAST 24 HOURS. ITS DOCKET INCLUDED AN: M5/1B AT 1022Z, M3/2B AT 0730Z, M2/1F AT 0534Z, M2/1B AT 1314Z, M1/1N AT 27/2315Z, M1/2F AT 0123Z, M1/1F AT 0337Z, M1/1B AT 1521Z,AND, MOST RECENTLY, M1/1B AT 1624Z. LIMB PROX- IMITY INHIBITED EXTENSIVE ANALYSIS, BUT DATA INDICATE A COMPACT (300 MILLIONTHS) SPOT GROUP THAT IS MAGNETICALLY COMPLEX. IN FACT, THE TRAILER SPOTS MAY PROVE TO BE A DISTINCT BIPOLE WHEN THE REGION ROTATES FURTHER INTO VIEW. ELSEWHERE, REGION 6644 (N21W09) STILL DOMINATES CENTER DISK, BUT HAS DECAYED SLIGHTLY AND PRODUCED LITTLE. ONE NEW REGION WAS BORN ON THE DISK, 6656 (N13W11).

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE TO HIGH. REGION 6654 SHOULD CONTINUE M-CLASS EVENTS, ALTHOUGH AT NOT QUITE AS FRENETIC A PACE. REGION 6644 IS ALSO CAPABLE OF AN ISOLATED M-CLASS FLARE.

sections.text: TO 29/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION 6654 (N07E40) CONTINUED TO PRODUCE M-CLASS EVENTS. sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 30/2100Z
sections.text: TO 31/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 6654 (N04E13) PRODUCED 2 M-CLASS FLARES TODAY: AN M3/2B AT 0245Z AND AN M1/2B AT 0858Z. THE REGION IS SHOWING SLIGHT DECAY BUT CONTINUES TO POSSESS A DELTA CONFIGURATION ALONG AN EXTENDED EAST-WEST INVERSION LINE. REGION 6652 (S10E04) ALSO PRODUCED 2 M-CLASS FLARES: THESE WERE AN M2/2N AT 0408Z AND AN M2/SF AT 1657Z. THIS REGION SHOWS A COMPACT DELTA CONFIGURATION. REGION 6444 CONTINUES TO BE A LARGE (580 MILLIONTHS) GROUP BUT SHOWS A SIMPLE MAGNETIC CONFIGURATION AND DID NOT PRODUCE ANY FLARES. AN OPTICALLY UNCORRELATED RADIO EVENT OCCURRED AT ABOUT 0505Z WHICH PRODUCED MODEST DISCRETE BURSTS, A TYPE II AND A TYPE IV RADIO SWEEP. INTENSE CALCIUM EMISSION WAS OBSERVED TODAY ON EAST LIMB AT ABOUT N40 PROBABLY THE FIRST INDICATION OF THE RETURN OF OLD REGION 6619 (N30, L-266) WHICH PRODUCED 1 X-CLASS FLARE AND 3 M-CLASS FLARES ON ITS PREVIOUS DISK TRANSIT.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE, BUT WITH A FAIR CHANCE FOR HIGH LEVELS OF ACTIVITY AS WELL. THE MOST LIKELY SOURCES FOR M-CLASS EVENTS ARE REGIONS 6644, 6652, AND 6654, WITH 6652 AND 6654 POSSIBLE SOURCES FOR ISOLATED MAJOR FLARE ACTIVITY. A GRADUAL INCREASE IN BACKGROUND LEVELS IS EXPECTED OVER THE NEXT DAYS WITH THE RETURN OF OLD REGION 6619.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 30/2100Z TO 31/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS MOSTLY UNSETTLED FROM THE BEGINNING OF THE PERIOD UNTIL ABOUT 0300Z. SINCE THEN CONDITIONS HAVE BEEN AT ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS WITH SOME ISOLATED MAJ- OR STORMING AT HIGH LATITUDES. A SUDDEN IMPULSE WAS OBSERVED AT 1039Z. THIS EVENT WAS FOLLOWED BY A GRADUAL INCREASE IN GREATER THAN 10 MEV PARTICLES WHICH CROSSED EVENT THRESHOLD AT 1225Z, ATTAINED A MAXIMUM OF 20 PFU AT 1515UT AND CONTINUES IN PROGRESS JUST ABOVE EVENT LEVEL. A FORBUSH DECREASE ALSO GRADUALLY SET IN DURING THE SAME TIME PERIOD TO A MAXIMUM DEPRESSION OF ABOUT 5 PERCENT. THE MULTIPLICITY OF FLARES OVER THE LAST FEW DAYS MAKES THE CAUSE UNCERTAIN, ALTHOUGH THE LONG DURATION M2 FLARE OF 29 MAY IS A GOOD POSSIBILITY.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO PERSIST AT ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS FOR THE NEXT 12 TO 24 HOURS. CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED TO SUBSIDE TO MOSTLY UNSETTLED LEVELS THEREAFTER.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 31/2100Z
sections.text: TO 01/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. TODAY'S ACTIVITY WAS DOM- INATED BY AN IMPRESSIVE X12+ FLARE ON THE EAST LIMB (N25) WHICH BEGAN AT 1456Z, SATURATED THE SENSOR FROM 1507-1533Z, AND ENDED AT 1726Z. THE X-RAY BACKGROUND LEVEL REMAINED ABOVE M-LEVEL FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE DAY. THE EVENT WAS ACCOMPANIED BY INTENSE DISCRETE RADIO BURSTS, A STRONG TYPE II (ESTIMATED SHOCK VELO- CITY OF 1400 KM/S), AND A STRONG TYPE IV. OPTICAL OBSERVATIONS NOTED A SPECTACULAR SPRAY WITH MATERIAL VISIBLE OUT TO 0.5 SOLAR RADII. BRIGHT SURGING AND LOOPS WERE ALSO REPORTED FROM THIS LOCATION. THIS NEW REGION IS STILL NOT VISIBLE BUT HAS BEEN ASSIGNED SESC REGION NUMBER 6659. REGION 6654 (N08W01) PRODUCED TWO M-CLASS EVENTS TODAY: AN M1/1B AT 0253Z AND AN M2/1B AT 0404Z. REGION 6648 (S12W28) NEARLY DOUBLED IN AREA TODAY TO A 260 MILLIONTHS DAO GROUP AND PRODUCED AN M1/SF AT 1150Z. REGION 6652 (S09W09) SHOWED SLIGHT DECAY AND PRODUCED MINIMAL ACTIVITY. REGION 6644 (N22W61) WAS QUIET.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: HIGH. THE MAIN THREAT FOR MAJOR FLARES IS 6659, ALTHOUGH REGION 6654 REMAINS ACTIVE AND COULD PRODUCE AN ISOLATED MAJOR EVENT AS WELL. M-CLASS EVENTS ARE A POSSIBILITY FROM REGIONS 6652 AND 6648. AN INCREASE IN BACKGROUND FLUX LEVELS IS EXPECTED AS 6659 ROTATES INTO VIEW.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 31/2100Z TO 01/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS AT MOSTLY MINOR TO MAJOR STORM LEVELS DURING THE LAST 24 HOURS. THE MOST INTENSE PART OF THE DISTURBANCE TODAY WAS FROM ABOUT 0600-1800Z. THE GREATER THAN 10 MEV PROTON EVENT ATTAINED A SECONDARY MAXIMUM DURING THE PERIOD OF 22 PFU AT 0445Z AND APPEARS TO HAVE ENDED AS OF 01/1840Z, ALTHOUGH LEVELS REMAIN ENHANCED AT THIS WRITING.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE MOSTLY ACTIVE WITH MINOR STORM PERIODS OVER THE NEXT TWO DAYS BASED ON PERSISTENCE. A GRADUAL DECLINE TO UN- SETTLED TO ACTIVE LEVELS IS EXPECTED BY THE THIRD DAY.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 01/2100Z
sections.text: TO 02/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION 6659 (N26E85) PRO- DUCED AN M5 FLARE AT 0746Z WHICH WAS ACCOMPANIED BY MODEST DIS- CRETE RADIO BURSTS. THIS REGION HAS NOT YET FULLY ROTATED INTO VIEW, BUT CURRENT OBSERVATIONS REPORTED STRONG SURGING AND THAT A VERY LARGE PENUMBRAL MASS IS ROTATING INTO VIEW. REGION 6652 (S09W20) PRODUCED A LONG DURATION M2/2N WHICH PEAKED AT 1426Z. THE EVENT WAS ACCOMPANIED BY A GROUP OF MODERATE TO OUTSTANDING DISCRETE RADIO BURSTS AND A STRONG, LONG DURATION TYPE IV SWEEP. THE GROUP PRODUCED AN ADDITIONAL M1/1N AT 2033Z. THE REGION HAS A SIMPLE DELTA CONFIGURATION AND IS SHOWING SIGNS OF SLIGHT DECAY. AN ADDITIONAL UNCORRELATED M1 FLARE OCCURRED AT 0041Z. REGION 6654 (N07W15) SHOWED CONSIDERABLE DECAY AND SIMPLIFICA- TION TODAY AND WAS FLARE QUIET. REGION 6648 (S13W41) CONTINUES TO GROW STEADILY AS DOES REGION 6658 (N20E51).

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE TO HIGH. THE PRINCIPAL THREATS FOR MAJOR FLARES APPEAR AT THIS TIME TO BE REGIONS 6659 AND 6652. REGIONS 6648, 6654, AND 6658 MIGHT CONTRIBUTE M-CLASS LEVEL FLARE ACTIVITY AS WELL.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 01/2100Z TO 02/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD RANGED FROM ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS DURING THE PERIOD WITH SOME BRIEF PERIODS OF SEVERE STORM LEVELS AT HIGH LATITUDES. THE MOST DISTURBED PERIOD DURING THE DAY WAS FROM 0300-0900Z. A GREATER THAN 10 MEV PROTON EVENT CONTINUES IN PROGRESS, ALTHOUGH THE FLUX LEVELS DID DROP BELOW THRESHOLD OCCASIONALLY. THE PEAK LEVELS OBSERVED TODAY WERE AT 18 PFU AT 0715Z AND AT 2030Z.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE AT ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS FOR THE NEXT 24 HOURS AS THE CURRENT DISTURBANCE PERSISTS. CONDITIONS ARE EX- PECTED TO DECLINE GRADUALLY OVER THE NEXT FEW DAYS: UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE WITH HIGH LATITUDE MINOR STORMING IS EXPECTED ON DAY 2, AND UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE LEVELS BY DAY 3.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 02/2100Z
sections.text: TO 03/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 6648 (S13W53) PRODUCED TODAY'S ONLY M-CLASS EVENT: AN M1/SF AT 03/2102Z. THE REGION CONTINUES TO GROW BUT LESS SLOWLY THAN THE LAST TWO DAYS. REGION 6659 (N30E65) ROTATED MORE FULLY INTO VIEW TODAY AS AN APPARENT DKC DELTA GROUP WITH 770 MILLIONTHS IN AREA. THE REGION WAS SUPRISINGLY UNPRODUCTIVE TODAY, GENERATING ONLY ONE FLARE: A C9/1F AT 0208Z. REGIONS 6654 (N07W29) AND 6652 (S09W36) WERE BOTH ESSENTIALLY FLARE QUIET AND SHOWED STEADY DECAY. REGION 6644 (N22W84) WAS ALSO QUIET AND PRODUCED SURGE ACTIVITY AS IT BEGAN TO TRANSIT THE WEST LIMB.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE. THE MOST LIKELY SOURCES FOR M-FLARES ARE REGIONS 6659 AND 6652, WITH POSSIBLE CONTRIBUTIONS FROM 6648 AND 6654 AS WELL. THERE CONTINUES TO BE A FAIR CHANCE FOR MAJOR FLARE ACTIVITY FROM REGION 6659.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 02/2100Z TO 03/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD RANGED FROM QUIET TO MAJOR STORM LEVELS TODAY. THE FIELD WAS INITIALLY AT MINOR TO MAJOR STORM LEVELS FROM 02/2100Z-2400Z. CONDITIONS QUIETED THEREAFTER TO MOSTLY QUIET TO UNSETTLED UNTIL A SUBSTORM PERIOD OF ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM CONDITIONS OCCURRED FROM 0600-0900Z. SINCE THEN AC- TIVITY LEVELS HAVE BEEN MOSTLY QUIET TO UNSETTLED WITH OC- CASIONAL ACTIVE PERIODS AT HIGH LATITUDES. THE GREATER THAN 10 MEV PROTON EVENT ENDED TODAY AT 1235Z. THE MAXIMUM FLUX IN THE LAST 24 HOURS WAS 21 PFU AT 02/2135Z.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE FOR THE NEXT THREE DAYS, PRIMARILY BASED ON PERSISTENCE. SOME CONTRIBUTION TO ACTIVITY IS POSSIBLE ON THE 2ND DAY AS A RESPONSE TO YESTERDAY'S LONG DURATION M2 FLARE FROM REGION 6652.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 03/2100Z
sections.text: TO 04/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION 6659 (N31E55) PRO- DUCED ANOTHER GIANT FLARE: AN X12+/3B THAT SATURATED THE SENSORS FROM 0342-0401Z AND WAS OF LONG DURATION, ENDING AT 0800Z. THE EVENT HAD OUTSTANDING DISCRETE RADIO BURSTS AND A STRONG TYPE IV ASSOCIATED. THE GROUP ALSO PRODUCED AN M1 AT 2014Z. THE REGION CONSISTS OF A LARGE PRIMARY PENUMBRAL AREA OF ABOUT 1300 MIL- LIONTHS WITH A DELTA ON THE SOUTHEAST CORNER, THE APPARENT CAUSE OF THE DRAMATIC FLARES SEEN SO FAR. THE REMAINDER OF THE DAY'S EVENTS CONSISTED OF A FEW SMALL C-CLASS EVENTS. NOTABLE GROWTH WAS OBSERVED IN NEW REGION 6667 (N12E37) AND GROWTH CONTINUES IN 6648 (S14W65). REGION 6652 (S10W48) HAS LOST ITS DELTA AND CONTINUES TO DECAY.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: HIGH. REGION 6659 IS EXPECTED TO PRODUCE ADDITIONAL ISOLATED MAJOR FLARES OVER THE NEXT FEW DAYS. ADDITIONAL CONTRIBUTIONS TO M-CLASS LEVEL ACTIVITY ARE POSSIBLE FROM REGIONS 6652 AND 6648.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 03/2100Z TO 04/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD RANGED FROM QUIET TO SEVERE STORM LEVELS. CONDITIONS WERE INITIALLY QUIET TO UNSETTLED UNTIL ABOUT 1400Z. AT THAT TIME A SUDDEN COMMENCENT TYPE OF SHOCK WAS OBSERVED AT SEVERAL MAGNETIC OBSERVATORIES AND WAS FOLLOWED BY THE ONSET OF MINOR TO MAJOR STORM LEVELS AT MID-LATITUDES AND MAJOR TO SEVERE STORM LEVELS AT HIGH LATITUDES. THE DISTURBANCE WAS SUFFICIENTLY INTENSE TO CAUSE GOES-6 AND GOES-7 TO EXPERIENCE MAGNETOPAUSE CROSSINGS FROM ABOUT 1715-1800Z. A GREATER THAN 10 MEV PROTON EVENT BEGAN AT 04/0820Z. A CLEAR ENHANCEMENT OF THESE PARTICLES UP TO 94 PFU WAS OBSERVED AT 1535Z, COR- RESPONDING TO THE SHOCK EVENT MENTIONED PREVIOUSLY. THE MOST LIKELY SOURCE FOR THE SHOCK EVENT AND SUBSEQUENT MAGNETIC DISTURBANCE IS THE X12+ FLARE OF 01 JUNE. IT SHOULD BE NOTED ALSO THAT THE GREATER THAN 100 MEV PARTICLES BEGAN TO RISE AROUND 1630Z AND HAD REACHED ABOUT 0.5 PFU BY THE PERIOD'S END. THE TIME OF ARRIVAL AND THE STEADY SLOW RISE OF THESE PARTICLES SUGGEST THAT THEY ORIGINATED FROM TODAY'S MAJOR SOLAR FLARE.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO PERSIST AT MINOR TO MAJOR STORM LEVELS FOR THE NEXT 12-24 HOURS. CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED TO SUBSIDE THERE- AFTER UNTIL SOMETIME EARLY ON THE THIRD DAY. AN ADDITIONAL PERIOD OF MINOR STORM CONDITIONS IS EXPECTED AT THAT TIME AS A RESPONSE TO TODAY'S MAJOR SOLAR FLARE.

REGION 6659 (N32E44) PRODUCED AN M1/SF AND ONE OTHER UNCORRELATED M1 FLARE OCCURRED.  REGION 6659 IS GROWING SLOWLY, AND A MAG ANALYSIS INDICATES POSSIBLY TWO DELTA CONFIGURATIONS IN THE REGION.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE TO HIGH.  REGION 6659 IS STILL EXPECTED TO PRODUCE ISOLATED MAJOR FLARES OVER THE PERIOD.  REGION 6666 MAY PRODUCE ADDITIONAL M-FLARES.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 04/2100Z TO 05/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT MAJOR TO SEVERE STORM LEVELS. MAJOR STORM CONDITIONS BEGAN AROUND 0300UT AND SEVERE STORM LEVEL WAS REACHED BY 1030UT.  GOES EXPERIENCED ANOTHER MAGNETOPAUSE CROSSING BETWEEN 1523UT AND 1900UT, WITH AN ASSOCIATED SUBSTORM MEASURED AT SOME GROUND STATIONS.  THE GREATER THAN 10 MEV PROTON EVENT IS STILL IN PROGRESS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE AT MINOR TO MAJOR STORM LEVELS EARLY IN THE PERIOD, WITH ACTIVE CONDITIONS LATE IN THE PERIOD.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 05/2100Z
sections.text: TO 06/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS VERY HIGH. THE PREMIER EVENT OF THE PERIOD WAS AN X12 (PLUS)/3B TENFLARE FROM REGION 6659 (N32E32) AT 06/0108Z. THE EVENT SATURATED THE GOES X-RAY SENSOR AND WAS ACCOMPANIED BY STRONG TYPE II AND IV SWEEPS. THE TENFLARE WAS MEASURED AT 55,000 SFU. THIS REGION CONTINUED TO GROW IN SIZE AND COMPLEXITY DURING THE PERIOD. REGIONS 6666 (S17E46) AND 6667 (N12E11) CONTRIBUTED LOW LEVEL M-CLASS EVENTS DURING THE PERIOD. REGION 6666 DISPLAYED NOTABLE GROWTH AND COMPLEXITY. NO NEW REGIONS WERE ASSIGNED TODAY.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: HIGH. MORE M-CLASS EVENTS AND ISOLATED X-CLASS ACTIVITY IS POSSIBLE FROM REGION 6659. REGIONS 6666 AND 6667 MAY CONTRIBUTE ADDITIONAL M-CLASS FLARES.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 05/2100Z TO 06/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS AT MINOR TO SEVERE STORM LEVELS AT THE BEGINNING OF THE PERIOD UNTIL 1500Z WHEN UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE CONDITIONS BECAME PREVALENT. THE SEVERE STORM WHICH BEGAN NEAR 0600Z ON 5 JUNE PRODUCED MAGNETIC INDICES SECOND TO THOSE OBSERVED DURING THE ACTIVITY OF MARCH 1989. THE SATELLITE LEVEL PROTON EVENT AT GREATER THAN 10 MEV WHICH BEGAN 04/0820Z CONTINUED IN PROGRESS THROUGH THE END OF THE PERIOD.  A TENTATIVE PEAK OF 130 PFU WAS OBSERVED AT 06/1045Z. THE NEW ENHANCED PEAK WAS DUE TO EFFECTS FROM THE MAJOR FLARING NOTED ABOVE.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE EARLY IN THE PERIOD WITH EFFECTS FROM THE RECENT MAJOR FLARING POSSIBLY BEGINNING LATE ON THE 7TH. THE PROTON EVENT IS EXPECTED TO CONTINUE FOR THE NEXT 24-48 HOURS.

THIS REGION REMAINS LARGE AND RETAINS A DELTA MAGNETIC CONFIGURATION.  THE OTHER TWO M FLARES ORIGINATED IN REGIONS 6660 (N10W15) AND 6666 (S16E31).

sections.text: MODERATE TO HIGH.  M FLARES ARE EXPECTED FROM REGIONS 6659, 6660, AND 6666.  REGION 6659 IS LIKELY TO PRODUCE ADDITIONAL MAJOR FLARES BEFORE IT MAKES IS WEST LIMB TRANSIT ON 15 JUNE.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 07/2100Z
sections.text: TO 08/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW, THE LARGEST EVENT DURING THE PAST 24 HOURS WAS A C5/SF FROM REGION 6659 (N32E07).  GROWTH CONTINUES IN THIS REGION, THERE IS EVIDENCE OF INCREASED SHEAR, (ESPECIALLY ALONG ITS EASTERN MAGNETIC INVERSION LINE), AND SEVERAL DELTAS HAVE BEEN REPORTED IN THE REGION.  HOWEVER, THE REGION IS PRODUCING ONLY SMALL FLARES.  REGION 6666 (S16E15) IS SLOWLY DEVELOPING AND HAS SOME AREAS OF MIXED POLARITIES.  AN ERUPTIVE PROMINENCE WAS REPORTED ON THE EAST LIMB NEAR S28. REGIONS 6670 (S16E55) AND 6671 (N12E44) WERE NUMBERED.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE TO HIGH.  MAJOR EVENTS ARE EXPECTED FROM REGION 6659.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 07/2100Z TO 08/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS.  A SUDDEN IMPULSE (88 GAMMAS IN BOULDER) WAS OBSERVED AT 07/2225UT.  THIS IMPULSE IS THOUGHT TO BE FROM THE X12 FLARE ON 6 JUNE, HOWEVER, THE STORM THAT WAS EXPECTED TO FOLLOW, HAS NOT MATERIALIZED.  THE SATELLITE PROTON EVENT AND PCA CONTINUE.  THE THULE NEUTRON MONITOR IS SHOWING A SMALL FORBUSH DECREASE.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE. SOME PERIODS OF MINOR STORM ARE POSSIBLE IN NIGHT TIME SECTORS.  THE PROTON AND PCA EVENT ARE EXPECTED TO CONTINUE.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 08/2100Z
sections.text: TO 09/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH.  REGION 6659 (N31W06) PRODUCED ANOTHER MAJOR FLARE, AN X10/3B AT 0143UT.  THIS EVENT WAS ACCOMPAINED BY TYPE II AND IV SWEEPS AND RELATIVELY STRONG BURSTS AT HIGH FREQUENCIES, EG 26,000SFU AT 15400MHZ.  MATERIAL WAS REPORTED MOVING TO THE NW OF THE REGION AND LOOPS WERE SEEN. A LARGE DARK BUSHY FILAMENT IS PRESENT ALONG EASTERN SIDE OF REGION.  REGION 6659 IS SLOWLY ROTATING CCW RESULTING IN A CHANGING MAGNETIC CONFIGURATION.  DELTAS ARE STILL PRESENT. IN ADDITION TO THE X10, FOUR SMALL M FLARES WERE OBSERVED IN THE PAST 24 HOURS, ALL FROM REGION 6659.  REGION 6666 (S15E01) CONTINUES TO DEVELOP AND IS NOW AN EXTENDED BETA GAMMA GROUP. SMALL SURGES WERE OBSERVED NEAR SE20 WHERE A SMALL PLAGE HAS ROTATED ON TO THE DISK.  REGION 6672 (N15E44) WAS NUMBERED.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE TO HIGH.  ADDITIONAL MAJOR FLARES ARE EXPECTED FROM REGION 6659.  M FLARES ARE POSSIBLE FROM REGION 6666.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 08/2100Z TO 09/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT MINOR TO MAJOR STORM LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS.  A SUDDEN IMPULSE (114 GAMMAS AT BOULDER) WAS OBSERVED AT 0040UT, PROBABLY FROM THE M4 FLARE FROM REGION 6659 ON 7 JUNE.  ANOTHER SI (15 GAMMAS AT BOULDER) WAS OBSERVED AT 1615UT.  THE SATELLITE PROTON EVENT AND PCA CONTINUE WITH FLUXES SLOWLY DECREASING (CURRENT P10 FLUX IS 65PFU).  THE X10 FLARE MENTIONED IN PART IA DID NOT PRODUCE A SIGNIFICANT INCREASE IN ENERGETIC PARTICLES AT EARTH.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE AT STORM LEVELS EARLY IN THE PERIOD, DECLINING TO ACTIVE LEVELS LATE IN THE PERIOD.  THE EFFECTS FROM THE X10 FLARE MENTIONED IN PART IA SHOULD BE FELT SOMETIME ON 10 JUNE. THE SATELLITE PROTON EVENT AND PCA ARE EXPECTED TO CONTINUE.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 09/2100Z
sections.text: TO 10/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION 6659 (N31W18) PRODUCED AN M6/1N FLARE AT 10/1358Z. THE FLARE WAS ACCOMPANIED BY A 470 SFU TENFLARE AND A MAJOR TYPE II SWEEP. THIS REGION ALSO PRODUCED THREE OTHER M-CLASS FLARES: AN M4/1N AT 10/0230Z (ACCOMPANIED BY A 300 SFU TENFLARE), AN M1/1N AT 10/1105Z, AND AN M3/SN AT 10/1659Z. THERE WERE NO SIGNIFICANT CHANGES IN SPOT NUMBER OR SIZE IN THE REGION, BUT IT REMAINED VERY COMPLEX IN STRUCTURE. IT ALSO DISPLAYED CLOCKWISE ROTATION WHICH CONTRIBUTED TO INCREASED MAGNETIC SHEAR, PARTICULARLY IN THE LEADING PORTION OF THE REGION. AN OPTICALLY UNASSOCIATED M1 OCCURRED AT 10/0445Z. REGION 6666 (S14W15) CONTINUED TO GROW AT A GRADUAL RATE AND PRODUCED SEVERAL C-CLASS FLARES THE LARGEST OF WHICH WAS A C9/SF AT 10/0034Z. NO NEW REGIONS WERE ASSIGNED.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: HIGH. REGION 6659 IS EASILY CAPABLE OF PRODUCING OCCASIONAL MAJOR FLARES. REGION 6666 MAY PRODUCE ISOLATED M-CLASS FLARES.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 09/2100Z TO 10/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT ACTIVE TO MAJOR STORM LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS. ISOLATED PERIODS OF SEVERE STORM LEVELS WERE NOTED AT BOTH MIDDLE AND HIGH LATITUDES. THE DISTURBANCE BEGAN NEAR 10/0900Z AND WAS PROBABLY IN RESPONSE TO THE X10/3B FLARE OF 09 JUNE. THE SATELLITE LEVEL PROTON EVENT AT GREATER THAN 10 MEV CONTINUED.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE AT MINOR TO MAJOR STORM LEVELS DURING THE FIRST DAY DECLINING TO ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS ON THE SECOND DAY. UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE LEVELS ARE EXPECTED ON THE FINAL DAY. THE PROTON EVENT IS EXPECTED TO CONTINUE.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 10/2100Z
sections.text: TO 11/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION 6659 (N31W30) PRODUCED AN X12+/1B FLARE AT 11/0209Z. THE FLARE WAS ACCOMPANIED BY A 10000 SFU TENFLARE, MAJOR TYPES II AND IV SWEEPS, AND A LOOP PROMINENCE SYSTEM. THIS REGION ALSO PRODUCED AN M4 LONG DURATION X-RAY BURST WHICH WAS IN PROGRESS AT THE END OF THE PERIOD. A 260 SFU TENFLARE AND A TYPE IV SWEEP WERE ASSOCIATED WITH THIS FLARE. THE REGION ALSO PRODUCED AN M1/SF FLARE AT 11/1734Z. REGION 6666 (S15W30) PRODUCED SEVERAL FLARES INCLUDING AN M1/SF AT 11/1200Z. NEW REGION 6673 (S23E51) WAS ASSIGNED.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: HIGH. REGION 6659 IS LIKELY TO PRODUCE ADDITIONAL MAJOR FLARES. REGION 6666 MAY PRODUCE ISOLATED M-CLASS FLARES.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 10/2100Z TO 11/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT MINOR TO SEVERE STORM LEVELS. THE SEVERE STORMING OCCURRED DURING THE FIRST HALF OF THE PERIOD. THE GREATER THAN 10 MEV PROTON EVENT WAS FURTHER ENHANCED NEAR 11/0245Z IN THE WAKE OF THE X12 FLARE. A PEAK FLUX OF 3000 PFU WAS OBSERVED AT 11/1420Z. THE PROTON EVENT REMAINED IN PROGRESS AT THE END OF THE PERIOD.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE ACTIVE UNTIL NEAR 12/1500Z WHEN THE SHOCK FROM TODAY'S X12 IS EXPECTED TO ARRIVE. THEREAFTER, THE FIELD IS EXPECTED TO BE AT MAJOR TO SEVERE STORM LEVELS. THE FIELD IS EXPECTED TO DECLINE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS ON THE FINAL DAY WITH PERIODS OF MAJOR STORMING POSSIBLE AT HIGH LATITUDES. THE PROTON EVENT IS EXPECTED TO CONTINUE.

sections.text: TO 13/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION 6659 (N31W55) PRODUCED AN M5/1F FLARE AT 13/1804Z WHICH WAS ACCOMPANIED BY MINOR RADIO EMISSIONS. THE REGION SHOWED SIGNS OF MINOR DECAY, BUT REMAINED LARGE AND EXTREMELY COMPLEX. IT ALSO PRODUCED FOUR OTHER M-CLASS FLARES: AN M1/SN AT 12/2120Z, AN M3/SN AT 12/2350Z, AN M1/1F AT 13/0535Z, AND AN M1/SF AT 13/0940Z. REGION 6666 (S16W54) REMAINED MODERATELY COMPLEX AND MAY CONTAIN A MAGNETIC DELTA CONFIGURATION. IT PRODUCED ISOLATED SUBFLARES DURING THE PERIOD. NO NEW REGIONS WERE ASSIGNED.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE TO HIGH. AN ISOLATED MAJOR FLARE IS POSSIBLE FROM REGION 6659. REGION 6666 APPEARS CAPABLE OF ISOLATED M-CLASS FLARE ACTIVITY.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 12/2100Z TO 13/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT MINOR TO SEVERE STORM LEVELS. A SUDDEN IMPULSE OF 61 NANOTESLA OCCURRED AT 13/0652Z AS MEASURED BY THE BOULDER USGS MAGNETOMETER. THE GREATER THAN 10 MEV PROTON EVENT WHICH BEGAN AT 04/0820Z AND REACHED A PEAK FLUX OF 3000 PFU AT 11/1420Z REMAINED IN PROGRESS. THE ASSOCIATED PEAK POLAR CAP ABSORPTION WAS 16.5 DB (DAY) AND 4.1 DB (NIGHT) AND OCCURRED AT 11/1420Z. THE POLAR CAP ABSORPTION EVENT REMAINED IN PROGRESS AS WELL. A FORBUSH DECREASE WAS ALSO ASSOCIATED WITH THE ONGOING GEOMAGNETIC STORMING. IT REACHED A PEAK DECREASE OF APPROXIMATELY 18 PERCENT NEAR 13/0700Z.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE AT MINOR TO MAJOR STORM LEVELS TOMORROW. THE FIELD IS THEN EXPECTED TO DECLINE TO MOSTLY ACTIVE LEVELS ON THE SECOND AND THIRD DAYS AS FLARE EFFECTS SUBSIDE. THE PROTON AND POLAR CAP ABSORPTION EVENTS ARE EXPECTED TO CONTINUE.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 14/2100Z
sections.text: TO 15/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION 6659 (N31W79) PRODUCED AN X12/3B EVENT AT 15/0821Z. A 14000 FLUX UNIT TENFLARE, BRIGHT SURGING, LOOP PROMINENCE SYSTEM, AND MAJOR TYPE II AND IV SWEEPS ACCOMPANIED THIS ACTIVITY. THE REGION CONTINUED TO SHOW SLIGHT DECAY IN ITS INTERIOR BUT REMAINS VERY COMPLEX. NUMEROUS C-CLASS SUBFLARES WERE ALSO ATTRIBUTED TO THIS REGION THROUGHOUT THE PERIOD. REGION 6666 (S15W78) REMAINED STABLE UNTIL THE CLOSE OF THE PERIOD WHEN AN M5/2B FLARE ERUPTED AT 15/2100Z. MODEST RADIO EMISSIONS AND A TENFLARE OF 220 FLUX UNITS ACCOMPANIED THIS EVENT. NEW REGIONS 6680 (S15E20), 6681 (N09E74), AND 6682 (S12E29) WERE ASSIGNED.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE TO HIGH. REGION 6659 MAY PRODUCE M-CLASS ACTIVITY OR AN ISOLATED MAJOR FLARE AS IT ROUNDS THE WEST LIMB.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 14/2100Z TO 15/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN QUIET TO UNSETTLED WITH ISOLATED PERIODS OF ACTIVE CONDITIONS FOR THE LAST 24 HOURS. THE SATELLITE LEVEL PROTON EVENT AT GREATER THAN 10 MEV THAT BEGAN 14/2340Z, BECAME ENHANCED NEAR 0845Z IN RESPONSE TO EFFECTS FROM THE MAJOR FLARING NOTED IN PART IA. A TENTATIVE PEAK OF 1200 PFU WAS OBSERVED AT 1700Z. THE GREATER THAN 100 MEV PROTONS REACHED A PEAK OF 69 PFU AT 0955Z. A POLAR CAP ABSORPTION EVENT BEGAN NEAR 0900Z. A GROUND LEVEL EVENT OCCURRED BETWEEN 0900-1100Z WITH A PEAK INCREASE OF APPROXIMATELY 20 PERCENT OBSERVED NEAR 0930Z.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE AT THE START OF THE PERIOD. STORM CONDITIONS ARE POSSIBLE BEGINNING EARLY ON THE 17TH IN RESPONSE TO THE MAJOR FLARING. THE PROTON AND PCA EVENTS ARE EXPECTED TO CONTINUE.

sections.text: TO 16/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. AN M5/2B FLARE STARTED OFF THE PERIOD AT 15/2101Z.  REGION 6666 (S15W87) GENERATED THIS EVENT AS IT APPROACHED THE LIMB AND HAS SINCE BECOME STABLE AGAIN. REGION 6659 (N32W90) CONTINUED TO SHOW SIGNS OF DECAY AS IT ROTATED OUT OF VIEW. RAPID GROWTH WAS OBSERVED IN REGION 6694 (N05E22), WHICH IS NOW THE LARGEST REGION ON THE DISK AT 400 MILLIONTHS. REGION 6697 (S05E12) SHOWED MODEST GROWTH. SURGING WAS OBSERVED ON EAST LIMB AT N11 AND WAS ASSOCIATED WITH MODERATED CALCIUM XV EMISSION. A C2 FLARE WHICH OCCURRED AT 2014Z WAS ACCOMPANIED BY AN UNUSUALLY OUTSTANDING SET OF DISCRETE RADIO BURSTS (IN- CLUDING A TENFLARE) A MODERATE TYPE II AND A MODERATE TYPE IV. ALTHOUGH THE CORRESPONDING OPTICAL PHENOMENA COULD NOT BE UN- AMBIGOUSLY IDENTIFIED, AN EPL WAS NOTED ON THE WEST LIMB AT S13 OUT TO .11 RADII IT APPEARS TO BE THE MOST LIKELY SOURCE FOR THE EVENT.

sections.text: LOW. THE MOST LIKELY SOURCES FOR FLARES ARE REGIONS 6694, 6695, AND 6697.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 27/2100Z
sections.text: TO 28/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. A VERY LONG DURATION M6 FLARE WAS OBSERVED AT 28/0626UT IN CONCERT WITH A LOOP PROMINENCE SYSTEM AT N30E90. THIS IS IN THE AREA WHERE OLD REGION 6659 IS EXPECTED TO APPEAR IN OVER TWO DAYS. A MODERATE INTENSITY TYPE II WAS ALSO REPORTED LATE IN THIS FLARE. STRONG CA XV EMISSION IS VISIBLE OVER THIS AREA (NUMBERED AS REGION 6703 EVEN THOUGH NO SPOTS ARE VISIBLE YET).  ANOTHER ERUPTIVE EVENT WAS OBSERVED IN H-ALPHA NEAR N35E90 AROUND 1500UT WITH LITTLE X-RAY EMISSION AND A STRONG TYPE II. REGION 6693 (S07W03) GREW RAPIDLY DURING THE PERIOD AND PRODUCED AN M1/1N AT 28/1048UT WITH MINOR RADIO BURSTS.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY SHOULD BE AT A
sections.text: MODERATE TO HIGH LEVEL DURING THE NEXT THREE DAYS. THE M6 FLARE MENTIONED ABOVE WOULD HAVE BEEN MUCH LARGER HAD REGION 6703 NOT BEEN ALMOST 3 DAYS BEHIND THE EAST LIMB.  CLASS M AND LARGER FLARES ARE EXPECTED FROM THIS AREA. REGION 6693 SHOULD PRODUCE SMALL CLASS M FLARES DURING ITS GROWTH PHASE AND AN ISOLATED CLASS M FLARE IS POSSIBLE FROM REGION 6694.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 29/2100Z
sections.text: TO 30/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION 6693 (S06W32) PRODUCED AN M5/1N TENFLARE WITH TYPE IV SWEEP AT 0302Z. THE WHOLE SUN X-RAY FLUX MAY HAVE BEEN AUGMENTED BY AN ERUPTIVE PROMINENCE NEAR REGION 6703 (N30E75) AT THE SAME TIME. REGION 6699 (N12E34) CONTRIBUTED AN M1/1N WITH TYPE II SWEEP AT 1549Z. THIS REGION HAS BECOME INCREASINGLY MORE COMPLEX OVER THE INTERVAL. REGION 6703 IS STILL DIFFICULT TO SEE, BUT CERTAINLY MUST BE CONSIDERED A POTENT FLARE SITE. REGION 6693 RETAINS ITS POTENTIAL FOR ADDITIONAL FLARES AS WELL. THREE NEW REGIONS WERE ASSIGNED: 6707 (S12E69), 6708 (N24W03), AND 6709 (N15E66).

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE TO HIGH. REGION 6703, NEE 6659, IS A PROVEN M-CLASS OR HIGHER ACTIVE REGION. RECENT CORONAL DATA - CALCIUM XV - INDICATE IT STILL HAS STRONG ASSOCIATED MAGNETIC FIELDS. REGIONS 6693 AND 6699 MAY ALSO GENERATE OCCASIONAL M-CLASS FLARES.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 29/2100Z TO 30/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT QUIET TO ACTIVE LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS. A SUDDEN IMPULSE, MEASURING 33 NANO- TESLAS AT BOULDER, OCCURRED AT 0116Z. A SATELLITE PROTON EVENT AT GREATER THAN 10 MEV BEGAN AT 0755Z. THIS EVENT IS THOUGHT TO HAVE BEEN SPAWNED BY THE LONG-DURATION M6 FLARE FROM BEHIND EAST LIMB ON 28 JUNE. THE SLOWLY INCREASING FLUX, TYPICAL FOR EAST LIMB PARENT FLARES, IS NOW NEAR 25 PFU.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 30/2100Z
sections.text: TO 01/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH.  REGION 6703 (N30E65) PRODUCED AN M5/1N LONG-DURATION FLARE AT 01/0240Z.  THIS REGION ALSO PRODUCED SEVERAL OTHER SMALLER FLARES INCLUDING AN M1/SF AT 01/1952Z.  THE SUNSPOTS IN THIS REGION ARE NOW MOSTLY IN VIEW.  OVERALL, THE GROUP APPEARS SMALLER AND MORE FRAGMENTED THAN DURING ITS LAST DISK TRANSIT (OLD 6659).  HOWEVER, ADDITIONAL SPOTS ARE NEAR THE EAST LIMB A FEW DEGREES TO THE NORTH OF 6703 AND MAY ALSO BE REMNANTS OF OLD 6659.  THE OTHER DISK REGIONS WERE FAIRLY QUIET.  NEW REGIONS NUMBERED INCLUDE 6710 (S32W16), 6711 (N21E65), AND 6712 (S15E61).

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE TO HIGH.  REGION 6703 IS EXPECTED TO BE THE PRIMARY FLARE PRODUCER.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 30/2100Z TO 01/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS QUIET TO UNSETTLED AT MIDDLE LATITUDE STATIONS AND ACTIVE TO UNSETTLED AT HIGH LATITUDE STATIONS. A SATELLITE PROTON EVENT AT GREATER THAN 10 MEV CONTINUES IN PROGRESS (BEGIN 30/0755Z).  SO FAR THE PEAK FLUX AT GREATER THAN 10 MEV WAS 88 PFU AT 01/2100Z.  A MINOR PCA BEGAN AT 01/1750Z IN ASSOCIATION WITH THE PROTON EVENT.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE QUIET TO UNSETTLED AT MIDDLE LATITUDES AND UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE AT HIGH LATITUDES.  THE PROTON EVENT IS EXPECTED TO CONTINUE IN PROGRESS FOR THE NEXT TWO DAYS OR SO.

sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE AT ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS DURING THE FIRST TWO DAYS DUE TO THE X1/2B FLARE MENTIONED ABOVE (EXPECTED SHOCK ARRIVAL NEAR 08/1800Z). MOSTLY ACTIVE CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED ON THE THIRD DAY AS FLARE EFFECTS SUBSIDE. THE PROTON EVENT IS EXPECTED TO CONTINUE.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 07/2100Z TO 08/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT UNSETTLED TO MAJOR STORM LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS. PERIODS OF SEVERE STORMING OCCURRED AT HIGH LATITUDES. THE STORMING FOLLOWED A SUDDEN IMPULSE OF 24 NANOTESLA AT 08/1635Z (AS MEASURED BY THE BOULDER USGS MAGNETOMETER). THE STORMING IS THE RESULT OF THE X1/2B FLARE PRODUCED BY REGION 6703 AT 07/0223Z. THE GREATER THAN 10 MEV PROTON EVENT THAT BEGAN AT 07/0455Z (ALSO A RESULT OF THE X1/2B FLARE) CONTINUED WITH A PRELIMINARY MAXIMUM OF 2300 PFU AT 08/1645Z.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE AT MINOR TO MAJOR STORM LEVELS DURING THE FIRST DAY AS FLARE EFFECTS PERSIST. PERIODS OF SEVERE STORMING MAY ALSO OCCUR UNTIL 09/1200Z. CONDITIONS SHOULD DECLINE TO MOSTLY ACTIVE LEVELS ON THE SECOND DAY WITH A FURTHER DECREASE TO UNSETTLED LEVELS ON THE FINAL DAY AS FLARE EFFECTS SUBSIDE. THE PROTON EVENT IS EXPECTED TO CONTINUE.

sections.text: TO 09/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 6718 (S23E39) DISPLAYED GRADUAL GROWTH AND PRODUCED AN M1/1N FLARE AT 09/1505Z. A TYPE IV RADIO SWEEP ACCOMPANIED THE FLARE. REGION 6703 (N27W37) CONTINUED TO GRADUALLY DECAY AND PRODUCED FOUR SMALL FLARES WITH THE LARGEST BEING A C2/1F AT 09/0206Z. THE PROTON EVENT AT GREATER THAN 10 MEV CONTINUED. THE FLUX WAS HOVERING NEAR 30 PFU AT THE END OF THE PERIOD.

sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE ACTIVE DURING THE FIRST DAY, THOUGH GRADUALLY DECLINING, AS FLARE EFFECTS SUBSIDE. THE FIELD IS EXPECTED TO BE AT UNSETTLED LEVELS FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE PERIOD. THE PROTON EVENT IS EXPECTED TO CONTINUE THROUGH 11 JULY.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 11/2100Z
sections.text: TO 12/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 6713 (N35W55) PRODUCED AN M1/2N FLARE WITH A SIGNIFICANT TYPE II SWEEP BURST AT 11/2222Z. THIS REGION HAS EXPERIENCED RAPID GROWTH FOR THE LAST FEW DAYS WHILE CONTRIBUTING A HOST OF C-CLASS EVENTS. REGION 6718 (S23E01) DISPLAYED GROWTH IN ITS LARGE TRAILER SPOT. A C6/1N FLARE ERUPTED IN THIS AREA AT 12/1738Z. REGION 6722 (S13E26) DISPLAYED NOTABLE OVERNIGHT GROWTH AND MAY HAVE FORMED A WEAK DELTA CONFIGURATION IN ITS TRAILING SPOT AREA. OCASSIONAL C-CLASS FLARING WAS OBSERVED IN THIS REGION. NEW REGIONS 6726 (S17W42) AND 6727 (S03E59) WERE ASSIGNED DURING THE LAST 24 HOURS.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE. REGION 6713, 6718, OR 6722 MAY PRODUCE AN ISOLATED M-CLASS EVENT.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 11/2100Z TO 12/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS. A SUDDEN IMPULSE OF 52 NANOTESLAS WAS MEASURED ON THE BOULDER MAGNETOMETER AT 12/0923Z. SATELLITE LEVEL PROTONS AT GREATER THAN 10MEV BECAME ELEVATED JUST ABOVE THE 10 PFU THRESHOLD AGAIN BETWEEN 11/2255Z TO 12/0935Z.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE AT THE START OF THE PERIOD WITH QUIET TO UNSETTLED CONDITIONS LIKELY BY THE 15TH. SATELLITE LEVEL PROTONS SHOULD CONTINUE TO DECLINE TO BACKGROUND LEVELS.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 12/2100Z
sections.text: TO 13/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. AN M4 X-RAY EVENT WAS OBSERVED AT 13/1851Z. A 400 SFU 10CM BURST ACCOMPANIED THIS ACTIVITY WHICH APPEARS TO HAVE EMANATED FROM THE EAST LIMB FROM NEW REGION 6729 (S20E90). A LOOP PROMINENCE SYSTEM WAS OBSERVED IN THIS AREA SHORTLY AFTER THE EVENT MAXIMUM. REGION 6718 (S24W12) CONTINUED TO GROW WHILE PRODUCING ISOLATED C-CLASS SUBFLARES. REGION 6722 (S14E13) ALSO DISPLAYED GROWTH WHILE SPAWNING OCASSIONAL C-CLASS EVENTS. ISOLATED SUBFLARING WAS OBSERVED FROM DEPARTING REGION 6703 (N28W88) WHICH HAS BEEN VOID OF SPOTS FOR SEVERAL DAYS NOW. A 10 DEGREE CIRCULAR RIBBON OF FILAMENT LOCATED NEAR S25 E60 DISAPPEARED BETWEEN 12/1734Z-13/0111Z. NEW REGION 6729 WAS ASSIGNED.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE. AN ISOLATED M-CLASS FLARE IS POSSIBLE FROM REGION 6718, DEPARTING REGION 6703, OR NEWLY EMERGING REGION 6729.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 12/2100Z TO 13/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT UNSETTLED TO MAJOR STORM LEVELS WITH PERIODS OF SEVERE STORMING OBSERVED AT HIGH LATITUDES. STORM CONDITIONS BEGAN NEAR 13/0600Z AND ARE LIKELY DUE TO EFFECTS FROM THE M7/3B FLARE NOTED ON THE 11TH. MAGNETOPAUSE CROSSINGS WERE OBSERVED ON THE GOES 7 MAGNETOMETER BETWEEN 13/1621-1638Z AND 1730-1740Z.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE AT STORM LEVELS FOR THE NEXT 24 HOURS WITH THE FIELD BECOMING UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE BY THE 15TH AS FLARE EFFECTS SUBSIDE.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 13/2100Z
sections.text: TO 14/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 6718 (S24W26) DISPLAYED LITTLE CHANGE DURING THE PERIOD. IT REMAINS SOMEWHAT COMPLEX WITH ITS DELTA MAGNETIC CONFIGURATION. TWO M-CLASS EVENTS WERE ASSOCIATED WITH THIS AREA: AN M1/1N FLARE AT 0330Z AND AN M1/SN FLARE AT 0736Z. BOTH EVENTS WERE ACCOMPANIED BY WEAK RADIO EMISSIONS. SEVERAL C-CLASS EVENTS WERE ALSO OBSERVED FROM THIS REGION. AN M1/1N FLARE OCCURRED IN REGION 6722 (S15E01) AT 0350Z. THIS REGION SHOWED SLIGHT DECAY BUT REMAINS FAIRLY COMPLEX. OTHER ACTIVITY OF NOTE INCLUDES ISOLATED FLARING IN REGIONS 6713 (N35W80) AND 6728 (S26E50) AND AN ERUPTIVE PROMINENCE NOTED FROM REGION 6729 (S21E72) AT 0657Z. NO NEW REGIONS WERE ASSIGNED TODAY.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE. ISOLATED M-CLASS FLARING IS POSSIBLE FROM REGIONS 6718 AND 6722.

sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT ACTIVE TO MAJOR STORM LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS. STORM CONDITIONS BEGAN NEAR 13/0600Z AND CONTINUED THROUGH 14/1500Z. A MAGNETOPAUSE CROSSING WAS OBSERVED ON THE GOES 6 MAGNETOMETER FROM 13/2045Z THROUGH 13/2115Z.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 14/2100Z
sections.text: TO 15/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. AN M2 X-RAY EVENT THAT MAXED AT 1333 UT WAS ASSOCIATED WITH FLARE LOOPS NEAR DEPARTING REGION 6713 (N35W90).  C-CLASS X-RAY FLARES OCCURRED IN REGIONS 6716 (N11W85), 6718 (S23W38), 6728 (S26E38), AND 6729 (S22E60).  NEW REGION 6730 (N21E74) WAS NUMBERED; IT IS THE APPARENT RETURN OF OLD REGION 6685. sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW TO MODERATE.  ONLY ISOLATED SIGNIFICANT FLARE ACTIVITY APPEARS LIKELY FROM REGIONS PRESENTLY ON THE VISIBLE DISK.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 14/2100Z TO 15/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT ACTIVE TO QUIET LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS, FOLLOWING THE STORM CONDITIONS OF THE PREVIOUS TWO DAYS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE MOSTLY UNSETTLED FOR THE NEXT TWO DAYS, INCREASING TOWARD ACTIVE TO OCCASIONAL MINOR STORM LEVELS ON THE THIRD DAY.  INDICATORS FOR INCREASED ACTIVITY INCLUDE RECURRENCE, A WELL-POSITIONED CORONAL HOLE, AND ELEVATED SOLAR WIND SPEED AS MEASURED BY THE PIONEER VENUS ORBITER.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 16/2100Z
sections.text: TO 17/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. CONTRARY TO EXPECTATIONS, REGION 6729 (S23E34) PRODUCED AN X1/2B PARALLEL RIBBON FLARE THAT MAXED AT 0637Z.  IT WAS ACCOMPANIED BY TYPE II AND IV RADIO SWEEPS AND A BURST INTENSITY OF 600 FLUX UNITS AT 2695 MHZ (A TENFLARE). REGION 6729 CONTINUES TO BE UNIMPRESSIVE IN H-ALPHA AND WHITE LIGHT, AND HAS LOST THE WEAK DELTA MAGNETIC CONFIGURATION IT CONTAINED YESTERDAY.  C-CLASS X-RAY FLARES WERE OBSERVED IN REGION 6728 (S26E12), BUT IT TOO IS NO LONGER MAGNETICALLY COMPLEX. SURGING WAS REPORTED ON BOTH LIMBS.  SURGING NEAR S06W90 MARKS THE DEPARTURE OF PLAGE REGION 6724. SURGING NEAR S07E90 MAY SIGNAL THE RETURN OF OLD REGIONS 6697 AND 6693.  OLD REGION 6693 PRODUCED SIGNIFICANT FLARES LAST ROTATION.  ACTIVE SURGING AND A BRIGHT SURGE ON THE LIMB WERE SEEN NEAR S21E90 AT ABOUT 1900Z.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW.  REGIONS PRESENTLY ON THE DISK DO NOT EXHIBIT THE COMPLEXITY EXPECTED FOR SUSTAINED SIGNIFICANT FLARES.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 16/2100Z TO 17/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT MOSTLY ACTIVE LEVELS AT MIDDLE LATITUDES FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS. MINOR TO MAJOR STORM LEVELS WERE OBSERVED AT HIGH GEOMAGNETIC LATITUDES. THIS RECURRENT ACTIVITY IS PRESUMED TO BE DUE TO THE EARLY ARRIVAL OF EXPECTED CORONAL HOLE EFFECTS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE AT ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS THROUGHOUT THE FORECAST PERIOD.  THE MOST INTENSE ACTIVITY WILL LIKELY OCCUR ON THE 19TH, WHEN POSSIBLE EFFECTS FROM TODAY'S X1 FLARE COULD ENHANCE THE CORONAL HOLE DISTURBANCE ALREADY IN PROGRESS.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 17/2100Z
sections.text: TO 18/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. AN X1 LIMB FLARE MAXED AT 1441Z BEHIND N06E90.  STRONG FLARE LOOPS ROSE ABOVE THE LIMB, AND MATERIAL SPRAYED OUT TO .54 SOLAR RADII.  ASSOCIATED RADIO SWEEPS AND BURSTS WERE NOT SIGNIFICANT.  THE FLARE REGION, NUMBERED AS 6734, IS THE PROBABLE RETURN OF OLD REGION 6694 WHICH PRODUCED FIVE C-CLASS FLARES LAST ROTATION.  ON THE DISK, REGION 6728 (S26W01) PRODUCED AN M3/1F TENFLARE (290 FLUX UNITS) AT 2132Z.  IT WAS ASSOCIATED WITH A MODERATE TYPE IV SWEEP. REGION 6729 (S21E21) HAS BEEN THE SITE OF SEVERAL C-CLASS FLARES TODAY.  THREE OTHER NEW REGIONS WERE NUMBERED. REGIONS 6732 (S30W40) AND 6735 (S08E49) DEVELOPED ON THE DISK. NEITHER ARE ERUPTIVE AT THIS TIME.  REGION 6733 (S07E76) ROTATED OVER THE EAST LIMB.  ANOTHER REGION MAY BE JUST BEHIND THIS ONE, AND BOTH ARE NEAR THE LOCATION OF OLD REGION 6693 WHICH PRODUCED M-CLASS FLARES LAST ROTATION. OTHER LIMB AND DISK ACTIVITY INCLUDED SURGING NEAR S22E90, S13E90, AND AN ACTIVE PROMINENCE NEAR S28W90.  THERE WERE TWO FILAMENT DISAPPEARANCES:  A DARK FILAMENT NEAR N20E10 (17/1400Z-18/1400Z), AND PART OF AN ACTIVE DARK FILAMENT ASSOCIATED WITH REGION 6728 (18/1606Z-1754Z).

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE.  NEW REGION 6734 APPARENTLY THREATENS SIGNIFICANT FLARES, AND REGIONS 6728 AND 6729 CONTINUE TO ERUPT DESPITE THEIR LACK OF MAGNETIC COMPLEXITY.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 17/2100Z TO 18/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS RANGED FROM QUIET TO MINOR STORM LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS.  THE MOST DISTURBED PERIOD OBSERVED BY NORTH AMERICAN MAGNETOMETERS OCCURRED BETWEEN 00-03Z TODAY.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE AT MINOR STORM LEVELS THROUGHOUT THE FORECAST PERIOD.  THIS ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED IN RESPONSE TO HIGH SPEED SOLAR WIND FROM CORONAL HOLES, THE MAJOR FLARES OF THE PAST 2 DAYS, AND THE FILAMENT DISAPPEARANCE FROM N20E10 OBSERVED TODAY.

THIS REGION ROTATED OVER THE EAST LIMB AS E-TYPE GROUP.  REGION 6734 (N08E74) PRODUCED C-CLASS FLARE LOOPS AT 0502Z AND OTHER LIMB SURGES THROUGH THE DAY. sections.text: MODERATE TO HIGH.  THE COMPLEX OF REGIONS ON THE EAST LIMB HAVE SHOWN THE CAPABILITY FOR SIGNIFICANT FLARES.

A SUDDEN IMPULSE OCCURRED AT 1902Z, WHICH IS THE PROBABLE ARRIVAL OF A SHOCK FROM THE X1/1N FLARE (REGION 6729, S23E34) THAT MAXED JUL 17/0637Z.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 19/2100Z
sections.text: TO 20/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION 6734 (N07E62) PRO- DUCED AN X1/2B FLARE AT 0149Z WHICH WAS ACCOMPANIED BY WEAK TO MODERATE RADIO BURSTS, AND WEAK TYPE II AND TYPE IV RADIO SWEEPS. THE REGION APPEARS TO HAVE A DELTA CONFIGURATION, BUT WAS SHOWING FAIRLY STABLE QUIET PLAGE DURING THE LATER PART OF THE DAY. REGION 6729 (S22W06) PRODUCED ONE 1N FLARE TODAY (DUR- ING THE DECAY OF THE X-CLASS FLARE) AND SHOWS SIGNS OF DECAY. THE MAJORITY OF THE REMAINDER OF TODAY'S FLARES (ALL C-CLASS) CAME FROM REGION 6737 (S15E61). THIS GROUP SHOWED FREQUENT FLUCTUATIONS IN A HIGHLY MIXED MAGNETIC CONFIGURATION, WHICH INCLUDES A POSSIBLE DELTA CONFIGURATION. TWO NEW REGIONS WERE ASSIGNED TODAY: REGION 6739 NEAR N09E90, A MATURE GROUP WITH ACTIVE PLAGE, AND REGION 6740 NEAR S24E77, A SIMPLE B-TYPE GROUP.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE TO HIGH. REGIONS 6734 AND 6737 SHOW THE GREATEST PO- TENTIAL FOR MAJOR FLARES, GIVEN THEIR SIZE, MAGNETIC COMPLEXITY, AND FLARE HISTORY.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 19/2100Z TO 20/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD BEGAN THE DAY AT ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS, FOLLOWED BY A PERIOD OF MINOR TO MAJOR STORMING AT 0730-1200Z. CONDITIONS WERE UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE DAY. NOTE: DUE TO POWER OUTAGE TODAY'S OBSERVED FREDERICKSBURG A-INDEX WAS NOT AVAILABLE AND WAS ESTIMATED TO BE 25.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO PERSIST AT MINOR STORM LEVELS FOR THE NEXT TWO DAYS AS A RESPONSE TO RECENT SOLAR ACTIVITY INCLUDING POSSIBLE CON- TRIBUTIONS FROM TODAY'S X-CLASS FLARE. CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED TO SUBSIDE TO MOSTLY ACTIVE LEVELS BY THE THIRD DAY.

sections.text: TO 21/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. REGION 6737 (S15E49) PRO- DUCED THE LARGEST OF TODAY'S MINIMAL FLARE ACTIVITY: A C4/SF AT 0037Z. THIS GROUP SHOWED MAGNETIC SIMPLIFICATION AND BECAME LESS ACTIVE DURING THE DAY. REGION 6734 (N08E48) CONTINUES TO DOMINATE THE DISK IN SIZE AND COMPLEXITY WITH A CONTINUED DELTA CONFIGURATION AND CONTINUED GROWTH. NEVERTHELESS THE REGION ONLY PRODUCED A COUPLE SUBFLARES. A NEW MATURE GROUP ROTATED INTO VIEW TODAY AS 6741 (N10E67) BUT WAS FLARE QUIET.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MOSTLY MODERATE WITH A FAIR CHANCE FOR ISOLATED MAJOR FLARE ACTIVITY. REGION 6734 IN PARTICULAR SHOWS POTENTIAL FOR MAJOR FLARES DUE TO ITS STRONG MAGNETIC FIELDS AND GRADIENTS. REGIONS 6737 AND 6741 MAY ALSO CONTRIBUTE TO M-CLASS LEVEL ACTIVITY.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 20/2100Z TO 21/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS MOSTLY UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE. A PERIOD OF ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS WITH SOME HIGH LATITUDE MAJOR STORMING OCCURRED FROM 0000-0730Z.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE ACTIVE WITH OCCASIONAL MINOR STORM PERIODS TO- MORROW, DECLINING TO MOSTLY ACTIVE ON THE SECOND DAY, AND TO UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE LEVELS BY THE THIRD DAY. THE FORECAST IS BASED ON A COMBINATION OF PERSISTENCE AND POSSIBLE EFFECTS FROM THE X-CLASS FLARE OF 20 JULY, WITH THE MAXIMUM EFFECT TOMORROW AND A GRADUAL DECLINE OVER THE FORECAST PERIOD AS THE DISTURBANCE SUBSIDES.

sections.text: TO 22/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION 6734 (N08E37) PRO- DUCED AN X1/2B FLARE AT 1003Z WHICH WAS ACCOMPANIED BY MODERATE TO STRONG RADIO BURSTS, A STRONG TYPE II AND A STRONG TYPE IV SWEEP. THE EVENT WAS FOLLOWED BY A PROLONGED LOOP PROMINENCE SYSTEM BETWEEN 6734 AND NEIGHBORING 6741 (N10E53) DURING WHICH TIME THE X-RAY FLUX WAS ENHANCED (AROUND M-LEVEL) AND THE TYPE IV WAS IN PROGRESS. THIS REGION CONTINUES TO DOMINATE THE DISK WITH CONTINUING GROWTH AND A MAGNETIC DELTA CONFIGURATION. THE REST OF TODAY'S ACTIVITY CONSISTED OF A FEW SMALL C-CLASS FLARES FROM A VARIETY OF REGIONS.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MOSTLY MODERATE WITH A CONTINUED FAIR CHANCE FOR ISOLATED MAJOR FLARES. REGION 6734 IS EXPECTED TO BE THE MAIN SOURCE FOR MAJOR ACTIVITY GIVEN ITS CONTINUED GROWTH AND COMPLEXITY. REGION 6741 MIGHT ALSO CONTRIBUTE AN M-CLASS EVENT.

sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE MOSTLY ACTIVE TOMORROW AND PARTWAY THROUGH THE SECOND DAY. MINOR STORM CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED TO BEGIN LATE ON THE SECOND DAY AND LASTING THROUGH THE THIRD DAY IN RESPONSE TO TODAY'S SOLAR FLARE.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 22/2100Z
sections.text: TO 23/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 6739 (N0WE41) PRODUCED TODAY'S ONLY M-CLASS FLARE: AN M1/SF AT 1759Z. THE GROUP HAS SHOWN GROWTH OVER THE LAST 24 HOURS. REGION 6741 (N10E39) ALMOST PRODUCED AN M-FLARE (ACTUALLY A C9/1F) AT 2027Z. THIS REGION HAS SHOWN REMARKABLE DEVELOPMENT DURING THE DAY AND IT PRODUCED NUMEROUS ADDITIONAL SMALL FLARES DURING THE PERIOD. THERE APPEARS TO BE THE BEGINNING OF A DELTA FORMING IN THE REGION. REGION 6734 (N09E23) CONTINUES TO DOMINATE THE DISK IN SIZE AND COMPLEXITY WITH CONTINUING GROWTH AND STRONG MAGNETIC FIELDS AND GRADIENTS. NONETHELESS IT COULD PRODUCE ONLY SMALL C-CLASS FLARES DURING THE PERIOD. REGIONS 6736 (S10W04) AND 6737 (S15E21) ALSO SHOWED SOME GROWTH TODAY.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE WITH CONTRIBUTIONS POSSIBLE FROM 6734, 6737, 6739 OR 6741. THERE CONTINUES TO BE A FAIR CHANCE FOR ISOLATED MAJOR FLARE ACTIVITY FROM REGION 6734.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 22/2100Z TO 23/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS QUIET TO UNSETTLED WITH OCCASIONAL PERIODS OF ACTIVE CONDITIONS AT HIGH LATITUDES.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE PARTWAY THROUGH TOMORROW, AFTER WHICH ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED TO BEGIN. THIS INCREASE IS EXPECTED AS A RESPONSE TO THE MAJOR FLARE OF 22 JULY, AND IS EXPECTED TO LAST THROUGH THE SECOND DAY. CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED TO SUBSIDE TO MOSTLY ACTIVE LEVELS BY DAY THREE.

sections.text: TO 24/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. REGION 6734 (N08E13) PRO- DUCED TODAY'S LARGEST FLARE: A C7/1F AT 1729Z. THE REGION PRO- DUCED SEVERAL ADDITIONAL SMALL FLARES DURING THE DAY BUT AP- PEARS TO HAVE PEAKED FROM ITS INITIAL GROWTH PHASE. IT CONTINUES TO POSSESS STRONG MAGNETIC FIELDS AND GRADIENTS IN A DELTA CON- FIGURATION. REGION 6741 (N09E29) CONTINUES TO GROW AND PRODUCED A C5/SF AT 0918Z AS WELL AS ADDITIONAL OCCASIONAL FLARES. THE ENTIRE NORTHEAST PART OF THE SUN IN THE VICINITY OF THESE GROUPS SHOWS THE EMERGENCE OF SEVERAL CLOSELY CLUSTERED BIPOLES AND GENERALLY INCREASING MAGNETIC FLUX (5 HAVE BEEN ASSIGNED SESC REGION NUMBERS). BOTH CONTAIN SMALL DELTA CONFIGURATIONS BUT DO NOT HAVE EXCESSIVE MAGNETIC COMPLEXITY.  POST FLARE LOOPS WERE OBSERVED NEAR THE EQUATOR ON THE EAST LIMB AT ABOUT 26/1515Z.  A SMALL INCREASE IN X-RAYS WAS ASSOCIATED WITH THE LOOPS BUT NOT ENOUGH TO CLEARLY CLASSIFY AS A X-RAY FLARE.  SPOTS OR PLAGE ARE NOT YET VISIBLE AT THE LIMB.  NEW REGION 6750 (N12E64) WAS NUMBERED.

sections.text: LOW TO MODERATE.  REGIONS 6734 AND 6741 ARE THE MOST LIKELY SOURCES OF ACTIVITY.  THE POSSIBILITY OF EAST LIMB FLARES WILL INCREASE AS THE SOURCE OF THE LOOPS MENTIONED IN PART IA DRAWS CLOSER TO THE VISIBLE DISK.

sections.text: MODERATE. REGION 6734 IS EXPECTED TO PRODUCE ISOLATED M-CLASS FLARES. THERE IS ALSO A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR AN ISOLATED MAJOR FLARE FROM THIS REGION. REGIONS 6741, 6749, AND 6757 ARE ALSO CAPABLE OF ISOLATED M-CLASS FLARING.

THE ACTIVE PERIOD WAS PRECEDED BY A SUDDEN IMPULSE OF 23 NANOTESLA (MEASURED BY THE BOULDER USGS MAGNETOMETER) AT 30/0558Z.

sections.text: TO 31/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION 6749 (S17W04) PRODUCED AN X2/2B FLARE AT 31/0052Z WHICH WAS ASSOCIATED WITH A 590 SFU TENFLARE AND WEAK TYPES II AND IV SWEEPS. THE REGION SHOWED GRADUAL GROWTH AND MAY HAVE DEVELOPED A DELTA MAGNETIC CONFIGURATION. REGION 6739 (N01W67) PRODUCED AN M1/SN FLARE AT 31/0822Z. REGION 6757 (N22E29) SHOWED SIGNIFICANT GROWTH WHILE PRODUCING SEVERAL SUBFLARES, A FEW OF WHICH REACHED C-CLASS. THIS REGION MAY ALSO HAVE DEVELOPED A DELTA MAGNETIC CONFIGURATION. REGIONS 6734 (N11W82) AND 6741 (N11W66) CONTINUED TO GRADUALLY DECAY. A LARGE, QUIESCENT HEDGEROW PROMINENCE WAS VISIBLE ON THE NORTHEAST LIMB EXTENDING FROM N13 TO N42. NO NEW REGIONS WERE ASSIGNED.

sections.text: MODERATE TO HIGH. REGIONS 6749 AND 6757 ARE CAPABLE OF PRODUCING M-CLASS FLARES. BOTH REGIONS ALSO POSE A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR X-CLASS FLARING. REGION 6734 MAY ALSO PRODUCE AN ISOLATED M-CLASS FLARE AND POSES A VERY SLIGHT CHANCE FOR MAJOR FLARE ACTIVITY AS IT BEGINS TO CROSS THE WEST LIMB.

sections.text: TO 01/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 6749 (S16W16) PRODUCED THE LARGEST EVENT OF THE DAY: AN M4/2B PARALLEL RIBBON FLARE AT 01/1521Z. A 300 SFU TENFLARE WAS ASSOCIATED WITH THE FLARE. REGION 6757 (S23E14) CONTINUED TO GROW AT A MODERATE PACE AND PRODUCED AN M1/1N AT 31/2258Z AND AN M2/SF AT 01/1453Z. BOTH FLARES WERE ACCOMPANIED BY MINOR DISCRETE RADIO BURSTS. THE LARGE HEDGEROW PROMINENCE MENTIONED IN SDF 212 ERUPTED AT 01/1530Z AND REACHED OUT TO .32 SOLAR RADII. REGION 6734 (N11W96) QUIETLY CROSSED THE LIMB. A LOOP PROMINENCE SYSTEM WAS OBSERVED IN REGION 6737 (S13W96) AT 01/0035-0316Z AS IT CROSSED THE LIMB. NO NEW REGIONS WERE ASSIGNED.

sections.text: MODERATE TO HIGH. REGION 6757 IS LIKELY TO PRODUCE M-CLASS FLARES AND MAY ALSO PRODUCE AN ISOLATED MAJOR FLARE. REGION 6749 IS ALSO CAPABLE OF M-CLASS FLARE PRODUCTION.

sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS BEEN QUIET TO UNSETTLED LEVELS UNTIL 01/1500Z. THEREAFTER, THE FIELD INCREASED TO ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS POSSIBLY IN RESPONSE TO THE X2/2B FLARE OF 31/0052Z.

UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE LEVELS AT MIDDLE LATITUDES AND ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS AT HIGH LATITUDES ARE EXPECTED FOR THE REST OF THE PERIOD DUE TO CORONAL HOLE EFFECTS.

sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT ACTIVE TO MAJOR STORM LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS. THE STORMING BEGAN TO SUBSIDE SHORTLY AFTER 02/1800Z. THIS STORMING WAS PROBABLY IN RESPONSE TO THE X2/2B OF 31/0052Z.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE MOSTLY ACTIVE TOMORROW WITH PERIODS OF MINOR STORMING POSSIBLE AT HIGH LATITUDES. UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE LEVELS WITH SOME HIGH LATITUDE MINOR STORMING IS EXPECTED ON THE SECOND DAY. ACTIVE TO MINOR STORMING IS EXPECTED ON THE FINAL DAY. sections.text: TO 15/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. TODAY'S LARGEST FLARE WAS A C6/SN AT 1802Z PRODUCED BY NEWLY ASSIGNED REGION 6784(S19E31). THIS REGION HAS SHOWN VERY RAPID GROWTH AND DEVELOPMENT IN THE LAST 24 HOURS. THE SOUTHEAST PORTION OF THE DISK CONTINUES TO PROLIFERATE WITH NEW FLUX AS A TOTAL OF 6 NEW REGIONS WERE AS- SIGNED TODAY. REGIONS 6781 (S19E46), 6782 (S10E49), AND 6783 (S14E46) COMPRISE A COMPLICATED SET OF STACKED BIPOLES WITH A COMMON INVERSION LINE AND OVERLAPPING PLAGE AREAS. THIS COMPLEX SHOWED DEVELOPMENT TODAY BUT PRODUCED ONLY SMALL FLARES. THREE FILAMENT DISAPPEARENCES WERE NOTED: 18 DEGREES AT S37E59- S37E41, 14 DEGREES AT S20W17-S22W28, AND 8 DEGREES AT S08W63. TODAY'S 10.7 CM FLUX JUMPED MARKEDLY IN RESPONSE TO THE SUDDEN EMERGENCE AND GROWTH OF NEW SOLAR REGIONS.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 15/2100Z
sections.text: TO 16/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION 6786 (N09E49) PRO- DUCED AN M6/1B FLARE AT 0621Z. IN ADDITION THIS REGION PRODUCED AM M1/2B AT 0051Z, A C9/SF AT 1811Z, AND A C7/SN AT 1905Z, THUS SHOWING ITSELF THE MOST FLARE PRODUCTIVE REGION ON THE DISK. THIS GROUP IS THE LARGEST ON THE DISK AT 440 MILLIONTHS, AND SITS TOWARD THE EASTERN END OF A LONG STRING OF SPOT GROUPS AND PLAGE AREAS EXTENDING FROM REGION 6784 (S19E18) TO NEW REGION 6790 (N02E69). THE WHOLE AREA IS MARKED BY GROWTH AND FREQUENT SUBFLARE ACTIVITY. REGION 6784 (S19E18) CONTINUED TO GROW TODAY PRODUCING OCCASIONAL SUBFLARES. THE COMPLEX OF REGIONS 6781 (S18E33), 6782 (S09E35), AND 6783 (S14E31) ALSO SHOWED GROWTH BUT PRODUCED MINIMAL FLARE ACTIVITY. THE DEVELOPMENT IN THE SOUTHEAST WAS ALSO NOTICEABLE IN THE ENHANCED BACKGROUND X-RAY FLUX LEVELS AND IN TODAY'S DRAMATIC 49 SFU INCREASE IN 10.7 CM FLUX. REGION 6772 (S23W41) ALSO CONTRIBUTED TO TODAY'S ACTIVITY WITH A C9/1N AT 1947Z.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE WITH A GOOD CHANCE FOR AN M-EVENT FROM ANY OF REGIONS 6786, 6784, 6781, 6782, OR 6783. THERE IS A POSSIBILITY FOR ADDITIONAL MAJOR FLARE ACTIVITY AS WELL, GIVEN THE CONTINUED GROWTH AND DEVELOPMENT OF THESE REGIONS.

sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE. CONDITIONS APPEARED TO BE SUBSIDING SLIGHTLY FROM YESTERDAY'S ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVEL ACTIVITY.

sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE GENERALLY ACTIVE OVER THE NEXT TWO DAYS DUE TO PERSISTENCE AND POSSIBLE EFFECTS FROM RECENT FILAMAMENT DIS- APPEARANCES. ACTIVITY SHOULD RETURN TO UNSETTLED LEVELS BY THE THIRD DAY.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 16/2100Z
sections.text: TO 17/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 6784 (S19E05) PRODUCED TODAY'S ONLY M-CLASS FLARE: AN M1/1N AT 0031Z. THE REGION PRODUCED ADDITIONAL SUBFLARES AND SHOWED CONTINUED GROWTH FROM YESTERDAY IN WHAT APPEARS TO BE A MAGNETIC BETA- GAMMA CONFIGURATION. GROWTH AND OCCASIONAL SUBFLARES WERE ALSO NOTED IN THE 6781/6782/6783 COMPLEX. THE SPOTS OF 6781 AND 6783 HAVE MERGED SO CLOSE TOGETHER THAT IT HAS BEEN NECESSARY TO COM- BINE THOSE GROUPS INTO A SINGLE REGION 6781 (S17E20) WITH REGION 6782 (S09E22) STACKED ON TOP. REGION 6786 (S10E36) CONTINUES TO BE THE LARGEST GROUP BUT PRODUCED ONLY SMALL FLARES. TWO AD- DITIONAL H-TYPE GROUPS ROTATED INTO VIEW TODAY FROM THE EAST EXTENDING A REMARKABLE BAND OF ACTIVE REGIONS FROM THE SOUTH- CENTER OF THE DISK TO THE EAST LIMB.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE. THE PRINCIPAL THREATS FOR M-CLASS FLARES APPEAR TO BE REGIONS 6784 AND 6786. CONTRIBUTIONS ARE ALSO POSSIBLE FROM 6781 OR 6782. THERE CONTINUES TO BE A CHANCE FOR AN ISOLATED MAJOR FLARE.

sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD PERSISTED AT UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE LEVELS WITH SOME PERIODS OF MINOR STORM CONDITIONS. THE ACTIVITY AP- PEARS TO BE A CONTINUATION OF THE RECURRENCE EFFECTS WHICH STARTED TWO DAYS AGO.

sections.text: EXPECTED TO PERSIST AT GENERALLY ACTIVE LEVELS FOR MOST OF THE FIRST DAY. CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED TO SUBSIDE TO MOSTLY UNSET- TLED LEVELS FOR THE SECOND AND THIRD DAYS.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 17/2100Z
sections.text: TO 18/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 6788 (S18E37) PRODUCED TODAY'S ONLY M-CLASS EVENT: AN M1/1F AT 1253Z. THE RE- GION IS SMALL AND UNIMPRESSIVE, ESPECIALLY COMPARED TO SEVERAL OTHER REGIONS IN THE NEARLY CONTINUOUS BAND OF SPOTS AND PLAGE AREAS EXTENDING FROM 6784 (S19W08) TO 6791 (N02E55). TODAY'S ACTIVITY CONSISTED PRIMARILY OF FREQUENT UPPER LEVEL C-CLASS EVENTS FROM A VARIETY OF REGIONS SUPERPOSED ON AN ENHANCED BACKGROUND. AMONG THE MORE PROLIFIC REGIONS: 6786 (S10E24), A REGION THAT CONTINUES TO GROW AND IS SHOWING THE BEGINNINGS OF A DELTA CONFIGURATION; 6784 (S19W08), WHICH SHOWS A DELTA FORMED IN THE TRAILER SPOTS; AND 6791 (N12E57) A TIGHTLY CLUSTERED GROUP SHOWING STEADY GROWTH.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE. POSSIBLE SOURCES FOR M-FLARES ARE 6784 DUE TO THE TRAILER'S MAGNETIC COMPLEXITY, 6786 DUE TO THE DELTA NEAR REGION CENTER, 6788 BASED ON PERSISTENCE, AND THE STACKED PAIR OF REGIONS 6781(S18E07)/6782(S10E08) DUE TO POSSIBLE INTERACTION BETWEEN STRONG PAIRS OF SPOTS. IN ADDITION OLD REGION 6749 (S18, L-274), WHICH PRODUCED 1 X-CLASS EVENT ON ITS PREVIOUS DISK TRANSIT, IS DUE TO RETURN ON DAY THREE AND MAY INCREASE ACTIVITY AT THAT TIME.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 17/2100Z TO 18/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS QUIET TO SLIGHTLY ACTIVE FROM THE BEGINNING OF THE PERIOD UNTIL 1834Z WHEN A SUDDEN IMPULSE WAS OBSERVED. SINCE THEN MID-LATITUDES HAVE BEEN ACTIVE AND HIGH LATITUDES HAVE BEEN AT MINOR TO MAJOR STORM LEVELS. THE SI MEASURED 23 GAMMA IN BOULDER AND MAY HAVE BEEN CAUSED BY ONE OF THE MANY DISAPPEARING FILAMENTS OF THE LAST FEW DAYS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE GENERALLY ACTIVE FOR THE NEXT 12 HOURS AS THE CURRENT DISTURBANCE CONTINUES. MOSTLY UNSETTLED CONDITIONS WITH OCCASIONAL ACTIVE PERIODS AT HIGH LATITUDES ARE EXPECTED TO FOLLOW AND CONTINUE THROUGH THE THIRD DAY

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 25/2100Z
sections.text: TO 26/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. FIVE M-CLASS X-RAY BURSTS WERE OBSERVED, ONLY TWO OF WHICH WERE ASSOCIATED WITH FLARES. THE FIRST WAS AN M2/2N AT 25/2337Z AND THE SECOND AN M1/SF AT 26/0538Z BOTH OF WHICH WERE PRODUCED IN REGION 6805 (N23E47) (REGIONS 6805 AND 6810 WERE COMBINED TO FORM 6805). THIS REGION WAS STABLE IN TERMS OF GROWTH, BUT WAS MODERATELY COMPLEX IN MAGNETIC ASPECTS. THE REMAINING THREE M1 X-RAY BURSTS OCCURRED AT 26/0346Z, 26/1016Z, AND 26/1203Z. NONE OF THE FIVE X-RAY BURSTS WERE IMPRESSIVE IN RADIO OUTPUT. REGION 6781 (S17W99) WAS QUIET AS IT CROSSED THE WEST LIMB. NEW REGION 6810 (S19E81) WAS NUMBERED.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE TO HIGH. REGION 6805 IS EXPECTED TO PRODUCE M-CLASS FLARES AND IS ALSO CAPABLE OF MAJOR FLARE PRODUCTION.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 25/2100Z TO 26/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT QUIET TO UNSETTLED LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS. THE GREATER THAN 10 MEV PROTON ENHANCEMENT THAT BEGAN NEAR 25/1600Z CROSSED EVENT THRESHOLD AT 26/1740Z AND WAS IN PROGRESS AT THE END OF THE PERIOD. THE FLUX WAS 018 PFU AT THE END OF THE PERIOD AND RISING SLOWLY.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE MOSTLY UNSETTLED DURING THE FIRST DAY FOLLOWED BY TWO DAYS OF ACTIVE LEVELS (WITH PERIODS OF MINOR STORMING POSSIBLE AT HIGH LATITUDES). THE ACTIVE LEVELS ARE EXPECTED IN RESPONSE TO THE X2/2B FLARE THAT OCCURRED ON 25 AUGUST. THE 27 DAY RECURRENT PATTERN ALSO SUPPORTS AN INCREASE TO COMMENCE ON THE SECOND DAY. THE GREATER THAN 10 MEV PROTON EVENT IS EXPECTED TO END LATE ON 27 AUGUST.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 26/2100Z
sections.text: TO 27/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. SEVERAL C-CLASS FLARES WERE OBSERVED. THE LARGEST WAS A C8/SF AT 27/1922Z FROM REGION 6805 (N24E37). THIS REGION REMAINED MODERATELY COMPLEX IN MAGNETIC STRUCTURE, BUT WAS FAIRLY STABLE. NO NEW REGIONS WERE NUMBERED.

sections.text: MODERATE. REGION 6805 IS LIKELY TO PRODUCE M-CLASS ACTIVITY AND ALSO POSES A SLIGHT THREAT FOR AN ISOLATED MAJOR FLARE.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 26/2100Z TO 27/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS. THE BOULDER USGS MAGNETOMETER RECORDED A SUDDEN IMPULSE OF 17 NANOTESLA AT 27/1515Z. THE GREATER THAN 10 MEV PROTON EVENT THAT BEGAN AT 26/1740Z REACHED A PRELIMINARY MAXIMUM OF 240 PFU AT 27/1830Z AND WAS IN PROGRESS AS THE PERIOD ENDED. AN ASSOCIATED POLAR CAP ABSORPTION EVENT COMMENCED AT 27/0646Z, REACHED AN ESTIMATED PRELIMINARY MAXIMUM OF 4.7 DB (DAYTIME) AT 27/1830Z, AND WAS IN PROGRESS AT THE END OF THE PERIOD. ALL OF THE ABOVE ACTIVITY WAS PROBABLY IN RESPONSE TO THE X2/2B FLARE THAT OCCURRED AT 25/0115Z.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE ACTIVE WITH MINOR TO MAJOR STORM LEVELS POSSIBLE AT HIGH LATITUDES. THE PROTON AND POLAR CAP ABSORPTION EVENTS ARE EXPECTED TO PERSIST, POSSIBLY THROUGH 29 AUGUST.
