sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 27/2100Z
sections.text: TO 28/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 6785 (N11W94) PRODUCED TWO M-CLASS FLARES WHILE CROSSING THE LIMB. THE FIRST WAS AN M1/SF AT 27/2321Z AND THE SECOND AN M4/SF AT 28/1603Z. A BRIGHT SURGE EXTENDING TO 0.53 SOLAR RADII WAS ASSOCIATED WITH THE M4 FLARE. REGION 6805 (N24E24) DISPLAYED MODERATE GROWTH IN ITS TRAILER, BUT ALSO DISPLAYED MINOR DECAY IN ITS LEADER. HOWEVER, ITS INTERIOR PENUMBRAL MASS, WHEREIN THE DELTA MAGNETIC STRUCTURE LIES, SHOWED NO SIGNIFICANT CHANGE DURING THE PERIOD. THE REGION PRODUCED SIX FLARES DURING THE PERIOD, THE LARGEST OF WHICH WAS A C6/1B AT 28/1951Z. REGION 6807 (S08E20) DISPLAYED A SIGNIFICANT INCREASE IN SPOT COUNT. NEW REGION 6811 (S19E65) WAS NUMBERED.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE. REGION 6805 IS LIKELY TO PRODUCE M-CLASS ACTIVITY AND ALSO POSES A SLIGHT THREAT FOR AN ISOLATED MAJOR FLARE.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 27/2100Z TO 28/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT QUIET TO MINOR STORM LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS. THE PERIOD BEGAN WITH MINOR STORMING, BUT DECLINED TO MOSTLY UNSETTLED LEVELS BY 28/0300Z. ANOTHER INCREASE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS OCCURRED AT HIGH LATITUDES AT 28/1800Z. THE GREATER THAN 10 MEV PROTON EVENT ENDED AT 28/2005Z. THE ASSOCIATED POLAR CAP ABSORPTION EVENT ENDED AT 28/1225Z.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE AT ACTIVE LEVELS WITH MINOR STORMING POSSIBLE AT HIGH LATITUDES BASED UPON THE 27 DAY RECURRENT PATTERN AND A FAVORABLY POSITIONED CORONAL HOLE. THE CORONAL HOLE EFFECTS ARE EXPECTED TO BEGIN ON 30 AUGUST AND CONTINUE FOR ABOUT THREE DAYS.

sections.text: TO 29/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. THE LARGEST EVENT OF THE PERIOD, AN M3 X-RAY EVENT, WAS OBSERVED AT 29/0509Z. SIGNIFICANT SURGING ERUPTED ON THE NORTHWEST LIMB IN CONJUNCTION WITH THIS ACTIVITY SUGGESTING DEPARTED REGION 6785 (N11, L-358) AS THE LIKELY SOURCE. SUBFLARING OBSERVED IN REGION 6793 (N16, L-344) MAY HAVE CONTRIBUTED TO THE FLUX LEVEL ACHIEVED WITH THIS EVENT. REGION 6805 (N24E14) DISPLAYED MINOR GROWTH WHILE PRODUCING ISOLATED SUBFLARING. REGIONS 6807 (S08E06) AND 6811 (S19E52) ALSO DISPLAYED GROWTH AND CONTRIBUTED SEVERAL C-CLASS FLARES EACH. NEW REGION 6812 (N12E23) WAS ASSIGNED.

sections.text: TO 30/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 6811 (S20E38) PRODUCED AN M2/1B FLARE AT 30/0119Z. OCCASIONAL C-CLASS EVENTS WERE ALSO OBSERVED FROM THIS AREA WHICH HAS SHOWN SIGNIFICANT GROWTH IN SPOT AREA COUPLED WITH INCREASED MAGNETIC COMPLEXITY. sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 30/2100Z
sections.text: TO 31/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. ABUTTED REGIONS 6810 (S20E11) AND 6811 (S20E26) COMBINED TO PRODUCE AN M2/1N EVENT AT 31/0203Z. '1N' FLARES WERE CONTRIBUTED BY EACH REGION DURING THIS EVENT. FLARING WAS OBSERVED TO HAVE STARTED IN REGION 6810, BUT QUICKLY SPREAD INTO 6811 WHERE A LARGER MORE INTENSE FLARE AREA WAS ACHIEVED. BOTH REGIONS SHOWED LITTLE CHANGE IN AREA DURING THE PERIOD, HOWEVER 6811 HAS DEVELOPED ADDITIONAL SPOTS IN ITS EXTREME TRAILER. REGION 6807 (S07W21) PRODUCED ISOLATED C-CLASS SUBFLARING WHILE SHOWING SIGNS OF SLIGHT DECAY. REGION 6805 (N23W14) CONTINUED TO DECAY. NEW REGION 6813 (N11E06) WAS ASSIGNED.

sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT MOSTLY UNSETTLED LEVELS. AN ENHANCEMENT IN THE GREATER THAN 10 MEV PROTON FLUX BEGAN AROUND 0800Z. THE CURRENT VALUE IS 2 PFU. THE SOURCE OF THE ENHANCEMENT DOES NOT SEEM TO BE FLARE-RELATED.

sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE. THERE IS A CHANCE FOR EVEN HIGHER LEVELS OF ACTIVITY NEAR THE END OF THE PERIOD DUE TO EFFECTS FROM THE FILAMENT DISAPPEARANCES OF 04-05 SEPT. THE CURRENT PROTON ENHANCEMENT IS LIKELY TO WANE IN THE NEXT 24 HOURS.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 06/2100Z
sections.text: TO 07/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION 6818 (S12W52) CONTINUED ITS RAPID GROWTH DURING THE DAY AND PRODUCED A NUMBER OF ENERGETIC FLARES. IN CONJUNCTION WITH REGION 6811 (S21W67), IT GENERATED AN X3/2B TENFLARE WITH TYPE II SWEEP AT 1927Z, WHILE 6811 HAD A SIMULTANEOUS 1N FLARE. REGION 6818 ALSO WAS RESPONSIBLE FOR; AN M4/2N AT 1007Z, AN M2/2B AT 1250Z, AN M2/1B AT 0751Z, AND AN M1/0F AT 1833Z. THE REGION MORE THAN DOUBLED IN SPOT AREA AND IS COMPLEX MAGNETICALLY. ELSEWHERE, TWO NEW REGIONS WERE ASSIGNED, 6821 (S11E05) AND 6822 (S06E71).

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE TO HIGH. REGION 6818, NOW A MATURE ACTIVE REGION, IS LIKELY TO CONTINUE ENERGETIC ACTIVITY.

sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS MOSTLY UNSETTLED. THE GREATER THAN 10 MEV PROTON ENHANCEMENT ENDED AROUND 1200Z.

sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE EARLY, THEN AT ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS THROUGH THE END OF THE INTERVAL. FILAMENT DISAPPEARANCES ON 4-5 SEPT., TODAY'S X3 FLARE, AND A FAVORABLY POSITIONED CORONAL HOLE MAY ALL CONTRIBUTE TO THE ELEVATED ACTIVITY.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 07/2100Z
sections.text: TO 08/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION 6818 (S12W65) PRO- DUCED AN X1/2N FLARE AT 0912Z WHICH WAS ACCOMPANIED BY MODEST DISCRETE RADIO BURSTS, A FAST TYPE II (1000 KM/S) AND A WEAK TYPE IV RADIO SWEEP. THE EVENT WAS FAIRLY IMPULSIVE WITH A DURATION OF 30 MINUTES. THIS GROUP SHOWS CONTINUED GROWTH AND MAGNETIC COMPLEXITY IN A DELTA CONFIGURATION NEAR THE LEADING SPOTS WHERE THE HOTTEST PLAGE AREAS WERE OBSERVED. THERE WAS SOME INDICATION OF POSSIBLE STABILIZATION SETTING IN NEAR THE END OF THE PERIOD. THE GROUP PRODUCED SOME AD- DITIONAL M-CLASS LEVEL ACTIVITY: AN M2/SF AT 0154Z, AND AN M1/SF AT 2044Z. AN ADDITIONAL UNCORRELATED M-CLASS FLARE (AN M1) OCCURRED AT 0818Z. TWO NEW MATURE REGIONS WERE NUMBERED TODAY: REGION 6823 (N03E17), A RAPIDLY EMERGING REGION OF BRIGHT PLAGE WHICH PRODUCED SOME UPPER LEVEL C-CLASS ACTIVITY, AND REGION 6824 (S21E71) WHICH SHOWED MODERATE PLAGE AND SURGE ACTIVITY. ALSO SHOWING GOOD GROWTH AND BRIGHT PLAGE TODAY WAS REGION 6820 (S12E02) WHICH ALSO PRODUCED OCCASIONAL UPPER LEVEL C-CLASS EVENTS.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE TO HIGH. REGION 6818 POSES THE GREATEST THREAT FOR MODERATE OR POSSIBLY MAJOR FLARE ACTIVITY. NEW REGIONS 6823 AND 6824 MAY ALSO CONTRIBUTE TO MODERATE LEVELS OF ACTIVITY AS THEY CONTINUE TO DEVELOP. A STEADY UPWARD TREND IN BACKGROUND FLUX LEVELS IS EXPECTED WITH CONTINUED REGION GROWTH AND WITH THE RETURN OF SEVERAL OLD REGIONS OVER THE NEXT FEW DAYS. THE MOST NOTABLE OF THESE IS OLD REGION 6786 (S09, L=013) WHICH PRO- DUCED 5 M-CLASS EVENTS ON ITS PREVIOUS TRANSIT.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 07/2100Z TO 08/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS MOSTLY ACTIVE DURING THE DAY. CONDITIONS APPEARED TO BE DECLINING SLIGHTLY TO UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE LEVELS NEAR THE END OF THE PERIOD.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE AT ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS TOMORROW, IN- CREASING TO MOSTLY MINOR TO MAJOR STORM LEVELS FOR THE SECOND AND THIRD DAYS. THE INCREASE IS PREDICTED DUE TO POSSIBLE EFFECTS FROM SEVERAL SOLAR SOURCES OF THE LAST FEW DAYS. THESE ARE THE DISAPPEARING FILAMENTS OF 05 SEPTEMBER, YESTER- DAY'S X3/2B FLARE, TODAY'S X1/2N FLARE, AND A CORONAL HOLE WHICH WILL SOON BE MOVING INTO A FAVORABLE POSITION FOR TERRESTRIAL EFFECTS.

sections.text: TO 09/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE.  ONE SMALL M FLARE WAS OBSERVED, AN M2/2B FROM REGION 6818 (S13W78) AT 0608UT. THIS REGION REMAINS COMPLEX AS IT BEGINS ITS WEST LIMB TRANSIT. DEVELOPMENT APPEARS TO HAVE SLOWED IN REGION 6823 (N04E03) AND ONLY SMALL FLARES ARE BEING OBSERVED.  TWO SMALL REGIONS WERE NUMBERED TODAY, REGION 6825 (N18W76) AND REGION 6826 (N20W10). SEVERAL REGIONS WHICH PRODUCED M FLARES LAST ROTATION ARE DUE TO RETURN TO THE EAST LIMB DURING THE PERIOD.

sections.text: MODERATE TO HIGH.  THERE IS A GOOD CHANCE THAT REGION 6818 WILL PRODUCE ADDITIONAL MAJOR FLARES AS IT TRANSITS THE WEST LIMB. THE REGIONS ASSOCIATED WITH THE ACTIVE LONGITUDES NOW ROTATING ONTO THE DISK MAY BE A SOURCE OF ADDITIONAL EVENTS.

sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE AT ACTIVE TO STORM LEVELS FOR THE NEXT THREE DAYS.  PERIODS OF SEVERE STORMING ARE POSSIBLE AT HIGH LATITUDES.

sections.text: TO 10/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. AN M1 X-RAY FLARE WAS OBSERVED AT 2057Z. OPTICAL OBSERVATIONS WERE QUITE LIMITED DUR- ING THE PERIOD AND WERE NOT AVAILABLE FOR THIS FLARE. A LONG DURATION C6 FLARE WAS OBSERVED FROM 0634Z TO 0923Z, AND MAY HAVE BEEN ASSOCIATED WITH A LOOP PROMINENCE SYSTEM OBSERVED ON EAST LIMB AT N02 FROM 0858-0912Z. A FEW ADDITIONAL C-CLASS EVENTS WERE OBSERVED DURING THE DAY, ALMOST ALL OF WHICH WERE NOT SEEN OPTICALLY. SURGING WAS OBSERVED WITH THE DEPARTURE OF REGION 6818 (S13W88). A NEW MATURE REGION 6827 (S19E65) ROTATED INTO VIEW TODAY. REGIONS 6820 (S11W25) AND 6823 (N02W10) SHOWED SOME MODERATION OF PLAGE AND POSSIBLE STABILIZATION FROM THEIR INITIAL RAPID GROWTH PHASES.

sections.text: LOW TO MODERATE. REGION 6818 MAY CONTRIBUTE TO M-LEVEL ACTIVITY FOR PERHAPS ONE MORE DAY. IN ADDITION REGIONS 6820, 6823, AND 6824 MAY ALSO PRODUCE ISOLATED M-CLASS EVENTS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 09/2100Z TO 10/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS INITIALLY AT MINOR TO MAJOR STORM LEVELS FROM THE BEGINNING OF THE PERIOD THROUGH ABOUT 0900Z. THE DISTURBANCE HAS SUBSIDED SINCE THEN WITH PREDOMINANTLY UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE CONDITIONS BEING OBSERVED.

sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE AT ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS OVER THE NEXT THREE DAYS. THE EFFECTS ARE EXPECTED AS A POSSIBLE CONSEQUENCE OF THE X1 FLARE OF 08 SEPTEMBER AND AS A RESULT OF RECURRENT CORONAL HOLE EFFECTS.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 26/2100Z
sections.text: TO 27/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. THE CLUSTER OF ACTIVE REGIONS IN THE SOUTHEAST CONTINIUE TO DOMINATE PROVIDING THE SOURCE FOR MOST OF THE DAY'S ACTIVITY. REGION 6848 (S07E27) CONTINUED TO GROW WITH ADDITIONAL SPOTS FORMING IN THE TRAILING PORTION OF THE REGION. THESE NEW SPOTS HOWEVER, MAY BE A NEW REGION EMERGING IN THIS ALREADY COMPLEX AREA. REGION 6850 (S11E44) ALSO DISPLAYED GROWTH WHILE REMAINING THE LARGEST, MOST COMPLEX AREA ON THE DISK. REGION 6853 (S20E56) GENERATED MOST OF THE DAY'S FLARE ACTIVITY WITH SEVERAL SUBFLARES, A C8/SF TENFLARE (210 SFU) AT 0355Z, AND A LONG DURATION C7/SF FLARE AT 1623Z. TWO SEGMENTS OF FILAMENT, ONE LOCATED NEAR N15E48, THE OTHER NEAR S20E12, DISAPPEARED DURING THE PERIOD. NO NEW REGIONS WERE ASSIGNED TODAY.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE. THE CLUSTER OF REGIONS IN THE SOUTHEAST (6848, 6850, 6853) PROVIDE THE BEST SOURCE FOR ENERGETIC EVENTS.

sections.text: EXPECTED TO CONTINUE AT ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS FOR THE NEXT 24-36 HOURS, THEREAFTER DECREASING TO UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE LEVELS.

sections.text: TO 29/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION 6853 (S19E28) PRODUCED AN M7/4B TENFLARE WITH A LONG-LIVED TYPE IV SWEEP AT 1533Z. POINT BRIGHTENINGS WERE SEEN IN NEARBY REGION 6850 (S11E19) DURING THE EVENT BUT WERE SECONDARY TO THE CENTER OF ACTIVITY WITHIN 6853. sections.text: TO 01/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGIONS 6850 (S12W02) AND 6853 (S19E02) MONOPOLIZED THE DAY'S FLARE RECORD WITH FREQUENT RADIO-RICH EVENTS OF C AND M-CLASS. THE MOST ENERGETIC FLARES WERE AN M3/0F AT 0616Z FROM 6853, AN M1/0F AT 1044Z FROM 6850, AND AN M1/0N AT 30/2232Z, ALSO FROM 6850. BOTH REGIONS CONTINUE TO IMPRESS IN WHITE LIGHT AND H-ALPHA AND SHOW NO SIGNS OF FATIGUE. WHITE LIGHT GROWTH AND RESTRUCTURING WAS READILY APPARENT IN THE CENTRAL AND TRAILER SPOTS OF 6850. ELSEWHERE, TWO NEW REGIONS, 6860 (S27E20) AND 6861 (N13E51), WERE ASSIGNED.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE. MORE M-CLASS ACTIVITY IS ANTICIPATED TO ORIGINATE IN REGIONS 6850 AND 6853, AND IF FURTHER DEVELOPMENT OCCURS, AN X-CLASS FLARE MAY RESULT.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 30/2100Z TO 01/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS GENERALLY UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE UNTIL 1815Z WHEN A SUDDEN IMPULSE MEASURING 17 NANOTESLA AT BOULDER WAS RECORDED. THE GOES-6 SPACECRAFT EXPERIENCED A BRIEF MAGNETOPAUSE CROSSING SOMEWHAT LATER AT 1943Z. THE FIELD HAS BEEN AT MINOR TO MAJOR STORM LEVELS SINCE. THE SOURCE OF THE SHOCK MAY BE THE DISAPPEARING FILAMENT OF 28 SEPT., OR THE M7 FLARE OF 29 SEPT. THE GREATER THAN 10 MEV PROTON ENHANCEMENT THAT BEGAN ABOUT 30/0700Z SLOWLY INTENS- IFIED, FINALLY CROSSING THE 10 PFU EVENT THRESHOLD AT 1740Z. THE PEAK FLUX TO THIS POINT HAS BEEN JUST ABOVE 10 PFU.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO REMAIN AT MINOR STORM LEVELS FOR THE NEXT FEW DAYS. UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE CONDITIONS SHOULD END THE PERIOD.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 01/2100Z
sections.text: TO 02/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 6850 (S11W21) PRODUCED JUST ONE M-CLASS FLARE, AN M1/1B AT 01/2250Z. ITS NEARBY NEIGHBOR, REGION 6853 (S21E03), ALSO HAD BUT ONE M-CLASS FLARE, AN M1/0N AT 0127Z. BOTH REGIONS ARE LESS IMPRESSIVE THAN YESTERDAY AND THEIR FLARE FREQUENCY HAS SLOWED ALSO. REGION 6850 IS STILL THE LARGEST AND MOST COMPLEX REGION ON THE DISK AS ATTESTED BY ITS AREA OF ABOUT 1500 MILLIONTHS AND ITS BETA- GAMMA DELTA MAGNETIC CLASSIFICATION. REGION 6855 (N18E07) HAS GROWN IN WHITE LIGHT WHILE PRODUCING A FEW SUBFLARES. THE OTHER FIVE DISK REGIONS HAVE NOT BEEN A FACTOR.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE. OCCASIONAL LOW LEVEL M-CLASS EVENTS ARE ANTICIPATED FROM REGIONS 6850 AND 6853.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 01/2100Z TO 02/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT MOSTLY MINOR TO MAJOR STORM LEVELS SINCE THE SUDDEN COMMENCEMENT OF 01/1815Z. DISAPPEARING FILAMENT AND/OR FLARE ACTIVITY OF THE PAST FEW DAYS IS THE PROBABLE CAUSE OF THE STORM. THE MODEST GREATER THAN 10 MEV PROTON EVENT ENDED AT 01/2315Z WITH THE PEAK FLUX A MERE 12 PFU, AT 01/1810Z AND AGAIN AT 01/1850Z.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE AT ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS THE NEXT 24 HOURS. EPISODES OF MAJOR STORMING MAY BE OBSERVED NEAR LOCAL MIDNIGHT. THE DISTURBANCE SHOULD WEAKEN WITH TIME, AND UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE CONDITIONS ARE LIKELY TO CLOSE THE FORE- CAST PERIOD.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 02/2100Z
sections.text: TO 03/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 6853 (S20W25) PRODUCED TODAY'S ONLY M-CLASS FLARE: AN M1/1N AT 0150Z. THIS MATURE GROUP IS LINKED CLOSELY WITH ITS LARGE NEIGHBOR 6850 (S12W32), AND THESE TWO GROUPS CURRENTLY DOMINATE THE DISK IN SIZE, COMPLEXITY AND FLARE ACTIVITY. REGION 6850 CONTINUES TO SPORT SEVERAL DELTA CONFIGURATIONS SHOWING STRONG MAGNETIC FIELDS AND GRADIENTS. THE CLOSE PROXIMITY OF THE GROUPS ALSO RESULTS IN AN ONGOING INTERACTION BETWEEN THEM. THERE WAS SOME INDICATION OF SLIGHT FLUX DECAY IN BOTH OF THESE REGIONS. REGION 6861 (N09E20) GREW TO A MATURE GROUP D-TYPE GROUP TODAY AND PRO- DUCED A C3/SF AT 2028Z. REGION 6855 (N18W06) ALSO SHOWED SOME GROWTH TODAY. A NEW H-TYPE GROUP ROTATED INTO VIEW AT S17E65 AND WAS ASSIGNED 6863.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE TO HIGH. REGIONS 6850 AND 6853 SHOW MANY CHARACTER- ISTICS ASSOCIATED WITH MAJOR FLARE PRODUCING REGIONS AND ARE LIKELY TO PRODUCE SUCH AN EVENT SOMETIME OVER THE NEXT THREE DAYS. IN ADDITION THE GROWTH IN 6861 SHOULD HELP KEEP ACTIVITY UP TO AT LEAST MODERATE LEVELS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 02/2100Z TO 03/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS INITIALLY AT MOSTLY ACTIVE LEVELS WITH OCCASIONAL MINOR STORM PERIODS AT HIGH LATITUDES FROM THE BEGINNING OF THE DAY UNTIL AROUND 1200Z. CONDITIONS SUBSIDED TO UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE LEVELS FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE DAY.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE MOSTLY UNSETTLED FOR THE NEXT DAY OR TWO. AN IN- CREASE IS EXPECTED TO ARRIVE SOMETIME DURING THE SECOND DAY OR PERHAPS THE THIRD DAY AS A CORONAL HOLE ON THE SOLAR DISK RO- TATES INTO A FAVORABLE POSITION. GENERALLY ACTIVE LEVELS WITH OCCASIONAL MINOR STORM PERIODS AT HIGH LATITUDES ARE EXPECTED AT THAT TIME.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 03/2100Z
sections.text: TO 04/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH BY VITRUE OF AN M5/SB FROM REGION 6861 (N09E06) AT 1929UT. THIS REGION HAS SHOWN SOME GROWTH THE PAST 24 HOURS BUT NOTHING SPECTACTULAR. THE FLARE WAS ACCOMPANIED BY MINOR RADIO BURSTS BUT THERE WERE NO TYPE II OR IV RADIO SWEEPS REPORTED. EARLIER IN THE DAY REGION 6853 (S21W37) PRODUCED AN M1/SN AT 0944UT. THIS FLARE WAS ALMOST SIMULTANEOUS WITH ONE OBSERVED IN REGION 5850 (S11W40). THESE TWO REGIONS HAVE BEGUN A SLIGHT DECAY WHICH MAY MAKE THEM MORE UNSTABLE OVER THE NEXT SEVERAL DAYS. REGION 6655 (N17W18) CONTINUED ITS SLOW GROWTH TODAY BUT WAS MOSTLY QUIET.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MOSTLY MODERATE. REGIONS 6850 AND 6853 POSE THE GREATEST THREAT OF MODERATE ACTIVITY AND AS THE BEGIN TO DECAY THEIR INSTABILITY MAY RESULT IN AN ISOLATED MAJOR FLARE. ANOTHER MAJOR FLARE FROM REGION 6861 IN THE NEXT 24 HOURS SEEMS UNLIKELY ALTHOUGH ADDITIONAL MODERATE FLARING IS POSSIBLE.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 03/2100Z TO 04/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS RANGED FROM QUIET TO MINOR STORM LEVELS THE PAST 24 HOURS. ACTIVITY BEGAN THE PERIOD AT MOSTLY QUIET LEVELS, PERIODS OF SUBSTORMING WERE OBSERVED FROM 0900 TO 1200, FOLLOWED BY MOSTLY ACTIVE CONDITIONS THE REMAINDER OF THE PERIOD.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BEGIN THE PERIOD AT MOSTLY ACTIVE CONDITIONS. ACTIVITY LEVELS SHOULD BE ON THE INCREASE AS A CORONAL HOLE COMES MORE IN LINE OVER THE NEXT SEVERAL DAYS.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 04/2100Z
sections.text: TO 05/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 6850 (S12W57) PRODUCED TODAY'S ONLY M-CLASS FLARE: A LONG DURATION M1/SN THAT BEGAN AT 1021Z, ATTAINED MAXIMUM AT 1048Z AND ENDED AT 1213Z. THIS GROUP CONTINUES TO DOMINATE THE DISK IN SIZE AND MAGNETIC COMPLEXITY. THERE WAS SOME INDICATION OF MODEST PENUMBRAL GROWTH AND COALESCENCE. OF INTEREST WAS THE FORMATION OF AN ADDITIONAL DELTA CONFIGURATION WITH AN EAST-WEST INVERSION IN THE REGION'S CENTER. REGION 6853 (S20W52) SHOWED SOME DECAY TODAY AND COULD ONLY PRODUCE ONE C6/1F FLARE AT 0205Z. REGION 6861 (N08W07) SHOWED SLOW GROWTH AND PRODUCED A FEW SMALL FLARES. THERE APPEARS TO BE A SMALL DELTA CONFIGURATION IN THIS GROUP.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE TO HIGH. THE NEW DELTA FORMED IN 6850 IS IN A REASON- ABLE POSITION TO EXPECT THE DEVELOPMENT OF SHEARING. IF THIS CAN REACH A POINT OF INSTABILITY THIS COULD TRIGGER A MAJOR FLARE OUT OF THE GROUP. IN ADDITION REGION 6861 SHOWS A DELTA CONFIGURATION WHICH IS LIKELY TO RESULT IN OCCASIONAL FLARES: MOST OF THESE ARE EXPECTED TO BE SMALL TO POSSIBLY MODERATE SIZED.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 04/2100Z TO 05/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS INITIALLY UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE FROM THE BEGINNING OF THE PERIOD UNTIL ABOUT 1200Z. SINCE THEN CONDITIONS HAVE BEEN MOSTLY QUIET WITH SOME UNSETTLED PERIODS AT HIGH LATITUDES.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO INCREASE TO ACTIVE LEVELS WITH MINOR STORM PERIODS AT HIGH LATITUDES SOMETIME TOMORROW, CONTINUING THROUGH THE SECOND DAY AND GRADUALLY DECLINING BY DAY THREE. THE INCREASE IS EXPECTED DUE TO EFFECTS FROM A CORONAL HOLE.

sections.text: TO 06/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. REGION 6861 (N08W19) PRO- DUCED TODAY'S LARGEST FLARE: A C3/SN AT 0535Z. THIS GROUP PRO- DUCED MOST OF TODAY'S SCANT SUBFLARE ACTIVITY AND WAS SHOWING SOME SIGNS OF DECAY NEAR DAY'S END. REGION 6850 (S12W70) CONTIN- UES TO BE AN IMPRESSIVE LOOKING BUT STABLE REGION. CLEAR INDICA- TIONS OF DECAY WERE EVIDENT TODAY INCLUDING THE DISSIPATION OF THE CENTRAL DELTA SPOT. A DELTA CONTINUES TO BE PRESENT IN THE LARGE LEADER SPOT.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW TO MODERATE. THERE CONTINUES TO BE A FAIRLY GOOD CHANCE FOR ISOLATED M-CLASS FLARES FROM EITHER REGION 6850 OR 6861.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 05/2100Z TO 06/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS INITIALLY QUIET BUT BECAME ACTIVE WITH MINOR STORMING AT HIGH LATITUDES AFTER 0900Z. THE INCREASE WAS PROBABLY CAUSED BY A FAVORABLY POSITIONED CORONAL HOLE.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE AT ACTIVE LEVELS TOMORROW AND FOR THE SECOND DAY AS THE CURRENT DISTURBANCE CONTINUES. A GRADUAL DECLINE TO UN- SETTLED TO ACTIVE LEVELS IS EXPECTED BY DAY THREE.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 06/2100Z
sections.text: TO 07/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. THE LARGEST EVENTS OF THE DAY WERE A C9/SF FROM REGION 6850 (S12W82) AT 1018Z AND A C8/SN FROM REGION 6861 (N07W34) AT 1531Z. OTHER ACTIVITY TODAY INCLUDED A SPRAY FROM NEAR REGION 6850 AROUND 1450Z. MATERIAL FROM THIS SPRAY WAS SEEN OUT TO .13 SOLAR RADII. NEW REGIONS 6867 (N19W04) AND 6868 (S33W57) WERE ASSIGNED TODAY.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW TO MODERATE. THE 6850/6853 COMPLEX CONTINUES TO PROVIDE THE GREATEST POSSIBILITY OF MODERATE ACTIVITY. ANALYSIS OF MAGNETIC DATA FROM REGION 6861 SHOWS INCREASING SHEAR DEVELOPING IN THE TRAILER PORTION, SUGGESTION THAT ADDITIONAL M-CLASS ACTIVITY MAY BE FORTHCOMING FROM THIS REGION.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 06/2100Z TO 07/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS. THIS ACTIVITY IS MOST LIKELY DUE TO THE FAVORABLY POSITIONED CORONAL HOLE NOW IN THE SOUTHWEST QUADRANT.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE MOSTLY ACTIVE THE NEXT 24 HOURS AS EFFECTS FROM THE CORONAL HOLE CONTINUE. BY DAY TWO CONDITIONS SHOULD BECOME MOSTLY UNSETTLED.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 07/2100Z
sections.text: TO 08/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW.  HOWEVER, 9 C-CLASS EVENTS OCCURRED AND SUBFAINT FLARES WERE OBSERVED IN 7 SEPARATE REGIONS.  FIVE NEW REGIONS WERE NUMBERED.  THESE WERE REGIONS 6869 (S09E13), 6870 (N12E18), 6871 (S11E64), 6872 (N07E74), AND 6873 (S23E75).  OF THESE NEW REGIONS, THE MOST SIGNIFICANT IS 6873 WHICH IS THE RETURN OF OLD REGION 6835.  EXTREMELY INTENSE CALCIUM XV EMISSION WAS REPORTED OVER THE SOUTHEAST LIMB ABOVE REGION 6873, AND SURGING WAS SEEN ON THE SOUTHEAST LIMB NEAR S12 AND S24. SURGING WAS ALSO OBSERVED ON THE SOUTHWEST LIMB NEAR DEPARTING REGION 6850 (S12W90).  THE MOST ACTIVE REGION ON THE DISK WAS REGION 6861 (N07W47) WHICH PRODUCED A C9/SF FLARE AT 1522 UT.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW.  HOWEVER, DEVELOPMENT IN REGIONS 6861 AND 6873 COULD LEAD TO INCREASED FLARE POTENTIAL IN THE NEXT FEW DAYS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 07/2100Z TO 08/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT UNSETTLED TO MINOR STORM LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS.  THIS PERSISTENT ACTIVITY IS ATTRIBUTED TO THE EFFECTS OF A NEGATIVE POLARITY CORONAL HOLE THAT CROSSED CENTRAL MERIDIAN ON 5 OCTOBER.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  GEOMAGNETIC ACTIVITY
sections.text: IS EXPECTED TO DECREASE FROM PRESENT ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS TOWARD GENERALLY UNSETTLED CONDITIONS DURING THE NEXT THREE DAYS.  ISOLATED PERIODS AT ACTIVE OR MINOR STORM LEVELS ESPECIALLY AT HIGH GEOMAGNETIC LATITUDES ARE LIKELY DURING THE NEXT 24-36 HOURS.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 08/2100Z
sections.text: TO 09/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. AN M1 X-RAY EVENT MAXED AT 0552 UT, BUT NO OPTICAL FLARE WAS REPORTED.  C-CLASS FLARES WERE OBSERVED IN REGION 6861 (N08W60), WHICH REMAINED MOSTLY STABLE IN WHITE-LIGHT AND H-ALPHA.  THREE NEW REGIONS WERE NUMBERED.  REGIONS 6874 (N01E67) AND 6875 (N15E68) ROTATED OVER THE EAST LIMB, AND 6876 (S14W56) GREW RAPIDLY ON THE DISK. AN 18 DEGREE-LONG FILAMENT APPEARED NEAR N05, CENTER DISK, BETWEEN 1640 UT YESTERDAY AND 1445 UT TODAY.  SEVERAL ACTIVE FILAMENTS PROVIDED EVIDENCE OF GENERAL RESTRUCTURING OF LARGE- SCALE HELIOMAGNETIC FIELDS.  SURGING WAS REPORTED AT THE WEST LIMB AS REGION 6850 (S12W94) DEPARTED THE VISIBLE DISK.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW. THE ONLY REGIONS THAT PRESENTLY APPEAR CAPABLE OF EVEN ISOLATED SIGNIFICANT FLARES ARE 6861 AND 6873 (S24E62).

sections.text: GEOMAGNETIC ACTIVITY HAS DECLINED FROM ACTIVE LEVELS AT THE BEGINNING OF THE 24 HOUR PERIOD, TO QUIET LEVELS FOR THE PAST 9 HOURS.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 13/2100Z
sections.text: TO 14/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION 6878 (S21E29) PRODUCED AN M6/3N FLARE AT 14/1738Z WHICH WAS ASSOCIATED WITH WEAK RADIO EMISSIONS. THE REGION PRODUCED FOUR SUBFLARES INCLUDING A C8/SF PRIOR TO THE MAJOR FLARE, BUT DISPLAYED NO SIGNIFICANT GROWTH OR CHANGES DURING THE PERIOD. REGION 6879 (N22E63) PRODUCED TWO M-CLASS FLARES INCLUDING AN M1/SF AT 14/2106Z AND AN M1/SF AT 14/0322Z, NEITHER OF WHICH WERE ASSOCIATED WITH SIGNIFICANT RADIO EMISSIONS. THIS REGION ALSO DISPLAYED NO NOTABLE CHANGES. REGION 6873 (S23W06) SHOWED SIGNS OF SLIGHT DECAY, BUT REMAINED THE MOST COMPLEX SPOT GROUPING (DKC/BETA-GAMMA-DELTA) ON THE VISIBLE DISK. IT PRODUCED TWO SUBFLARES DURING THE PERIOD. NO NEW REGIONS WERE NUMBERED.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE TO HIGH. REGIONS 6878 AND 6879 ARE EXPECTED TO PRODUCE M-CLASS FLARES. ISOLATED MAJOR FLARE ACTIVITY MAY OCCUR AS WELL GIVEN THEIR RECENT FLARE HISTORIES. REGION 6873 ALSO APPEARS CAPABLE OF PRODUCING M-CLASS FLARES AND CANNOT BE RULED OUT FOR AN ISOLATED MAJOR FLARE GIVEN ITS MAGNETIC COMPLEXITY.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 21/2100Z
sections.text: TO 22/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. A SIGNIFICANT INCREASE IN ENERGETIC ACTIVITY AND 10.7CM FLUX HAILED THE ARRIVAL OF NEW REGION 6891 (S10E73). ALTHOUGH THE LARGE, COMPLEX SPOT AREA ASSOCIATED WITH THIS ACTIVE CENTER HAS BARELY ROTATED INTO VIEW, IT HAS ALREADY PRODUCED A PAIR OF M-CLASS EVENTS: AN M1/1F FLARE AT 0644Z AND AN M1/1N FLARE AT 1902Z. THIS REGION MARKS THE RETURN OF OLD REGION 6850 (S12, L-179) WHICH PRODUCED A HOST OF FLARES DURING ITS LAST TRANSIT. ALSO ASSIGNED TODAY WAS NEW REGION 6892 (S17E74). THIS APPEARS TO BE THE REMNANTS OF RETURNING OLD REGION 6853 (S20, L-174), AN AREA WHICH ALSO HAS A HISTORY OF SIGNIFICANT FLARE PRODUCTION. OTHER ACTIVITY OF NOTE INCLUDED AN ISOLATED SUBFLARE FROM REGION 6879 (N23W39).

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE. NEW REGION 6891 POSES THE GREATEST THREAT FOR M-CLASS FLARE PRODUCTION.

HOWEVER, ITS FLARE OUTPUT TODAY WAS MINIMAL, CONSISTING OF JUST OCCASIONAL C-CLASS FLARES. REGION 6886 (N09E02) GREW SUBSTANTIALLY IN WHITE LIGHT AND H-ALPHA. THE OTHER FIVE SPOT GROUPS WERE UNIMPRESSIVE.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 23/2100Z
sections.text: TO 24/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION 6891 (S12E48) GENERATED A NUMBER OF ENERGETIC FLARES, AMONG THEM AN X2/2N AT 0240Z. ITS OTHER SIGNIFICANT ACTIVITY CONSISTED OF AN M3/1N AT 1716Z, AN M1/1F AT 0631Z, AN M1/0N AT 0948Z, AN M1/0F AT 1124Z, AND VERY LIKELY, AS A PREDECESSOR TO THE X-CLASS FLARE, AN M1 AT 0055Z. REGION 6891 ALSO COMBINED WITH NEARBY NEIGHBOR 6892 (S21E48) TO PRODUCE AN M2 AT 1657Z. TODAY'S CLASS M AND X OUTPUT FROM REGION 6891 EXCEEDED ITS ENTIRE M AND X OUTPUT FROM ALL OF LAST ROTATION WHEN THE REGION WAS KNOWN AS 6850. THE REGION IS STILL VERY LARGE AND MAGNETICALLY COMPLEX, AND SHOWS NO SIGNS OF QUIETING. THE LARGE INCREASE IN TODAY'S 10.7 CM FLUX FURTHER ATTESTS TO THE VOLATILITY OF REGION 6891. ELSE- WHERE, REGION 6886 (N09W13) CONTINUES ITS RAPID GROWTH, BUT PRODUCED LITTLE IN THE WAY OF FLARES. NEWLY ASSIGNED REGION 6893 (N16E69) ROTATED FULLY INTO VIEW.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE TO HIGH. REGION 6891 WILL REMAIN THE PREMIER FLARE SITE, WITH MORE M-CLASS AND A POSSIBLE X-CLASS FLARE OCCURRING. REGIONS 6886 AND 6892 (S21E48) MAY ALSO HAVE M-CLASS FLARES AT SOME POINT IN THE NEXT THREE DAYS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 23/2100Z TO 24/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS PREDOMINANTLY UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE THE PAST 24 HOURS. A WELL-LOCATED NARROW CORONAL HOLE IS THE LIKELY SOURCE OF THE ENHANCED SOLAR WIND.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 24/2100Z
sections.text: TO 25/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION 6891 (S11E34) PRODUCED ANOTHER MAJOR FLARE, THIS ONE AN M9/1N AT 24/2241Z. IT ALSO HAD AN M1/1B AT 1124Z AND AN M1/0F AT 1736Z. THE REGION CONTINUES TO DOMINATE THE VISIBLE DISK, WITH ITS LARGE NAKED- EYE SUNSPOT SURROUNDED BY A FIELD OF BRIGHT PLAGE. REGION 6892 (S20E35), POSITIONED JUST TO THE SOUTH, GREW SUBSTANTIALLY IN ALL OBSERVABLES AND YIELDED AN M1/0F OF ITS OWN AT 0755Z. ONE NEW REGION WAS BORN ON THE DISK, 6894 (N11E26).

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE TO HIGH. LOOK FOR MORE M-CLASS FLARES FROM REGION 6891 AND PERHAPS AN ISOLATED X-CLASS EVENT. REGION 6892 MAY ALSO CONTRIBUTE AN OCCASIONAL M-CLASS FLARE.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 24/2100Z TO 25/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE AT MID- LATITUDES. AN EPISODE OF MINOR STORM CONDITIONS OCCURRED AT HIGH LATITUDES.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE THE NEXT THREE DAYS. EFFECTS OF A SMALL CORONAL HOLE ARE LIKELY 27-28 OCT. FLARE ACTIVITY OF THE PAST TWO DAYS IS EXPECTED TO HAVE NO EFFECT ON THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 25/2100Z
sections.text: TO 26/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION 6891 (S20E21) JUST GENERATED AN X1/2N TENFLARE WITH MAXIMUM AT 2047Z. THIS EVENT WAS SLOW TO DEVELOP, HAVING BEGUN AT 1846Z AND REACHING WHAT SEEMED TO BE A LENGTHY MAXIMUM AT THE M1 LEVEL BEFORE THE SECOND INCREASE BEGAN ABOUT 2020Z. PRELIMINARY REPORTS OF RADIO BURSTS INCLUDE 1200 FLUX UNITS AT 2695 MHZ. NO SWEEPS HAVE BEEN REPORTED AS YET. OTHER SIGNIFICANT ACTIVITY FROM THIS REGION INCLUDED A LONG-DURATION M1/0F AT 0015Z. THIS EVENT LASTED ABOUT 4 HOURS AND INCLUDED A TYPE IV OF DURATION 203 MINUTES. ITS OTHER ENERGETIC FLARE WAS AN M1/1F AT 1301Z. REGION 6891 EXPERIENCED CONSIDERABLE FRAGMENTATION OF ITS LARGE LEADER PENUMBRA OVER THE PAST 24 HOURS, BUT CLEARLY REMAINS POTENT. ELSEWHERE, TWO NEW REGIONS WERE ASSIGNED, 6895 (N24W31) AND 6896 (S03E63).

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE TO HIGH. REGION 6891 SHOWS NO SIGNS OF ABATING ITS PRODUCTION OF M AND X CLASS FLARES.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 25/2100Z TO 26/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS AT MOSTLY ACTIVE LEVELS THE PAST 24 HOURS. A SUDDEN IMPULSE MEASURING APPROXIMATELY 43 NANO- TELA AT BOULDER OCCURRED AT 0635Z.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE THROUGHOUT THE FORECAST PERIOD.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 26/2100Z
sections.text: TO 27/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY PERSISTED AT THE HIGH LEVEL. REGION 6891 (S11E07) CONTINUED ITS BARRAGE OF MAJOR FLARES WITH AN X6/3B TENFLARE (3800 SFU) WITH TYPES II AND IV AT 0548Z THE MOST DRAMATIC. THE TYPE IV SWEEP LASTED NEARLY 5 HOURS. THE REGION ALSO PRODUCED AN X1/2B AT 0212Z, AN M2/1N WITH TYPE IV AT 0035Z, AND AN M3/1N TENFLARE (410 SFU) AT 1301Z. RELATIVE QUIET HAS PREVAILED SINCE THIS LAST FLARE, BUT THE REGION IS STILL HOT AND LARGE. ITS NEUTRAL LINE FILAMENTS SEEM TO BE EVEN MORE TWISTED AND FRAYED TODAY, GIVING THE REGION A GNARLY LOOK. NEARBY NEIGHBOR REGION 6892 (S20E08), SHARING A COMMON NEUTRAL LINE WITH 6891, GREW WHILE YIELDING AN OCCASIONAL FLARE. REGION 6893 (N17E31) HAD A C9/1N AT1738Z. ONE NEW REGION WAS BORN ON THE DISK, 6897 (S18W21).

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE TO HIGH. IT IS JUST A MATTER OF TIME BEFORE REGION 6891 HAS ITS NEXT MAJOR FLARE.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 26/2100Z TO 27/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT UNSETTLED TO MAJOR STORM LEVELS AT ALL LATITUDES DURING THE PAST TWENTY FOUR HOURS. THE SOURCE OF THIS DISTURBANCE MAY BE A COMBINATION OF FLARE AND CORONAL HOLE EFFECTS. THE GREATER THAN 10 MEV PROTON FLUXES HAVE BEEN UNAFFECTED BY THE RECENT MAJOR SOLAR FLARES. PROTON PREDICTION MODELS HAD FORECAST LARGE FLUX ENHANCEMENTS FROM THE LAST THREE X-CLASS FLARES.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE AT MINOR STORM LEVELS THROUGHOUT THE FORECAST PERIOD. YESTERDAY'S X1/2N FLARE AND TODAY'S X6/3B FLARE, BOTH WITH TYPES II AND IV, ARE LIKELY TO PROLONG THE CURRENT DIST- URBANCE. EPISODES OF MAJOR STORMING ARE PROBABLE DURING LOCAL NIGHTTIMES.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 27/2100Z
sections.text: TO 28/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION 6891 (S12W06) DISSIPATED ITS ENERGY BY WAY OF FREQUENT LOW-LEVEL M-CLASS FLARES OVER THE PAST 24 HOURS. THE EVENTS INCLUDED AN M1/0F AT 0112Z, AN M1/0N AT 0742Z, AN M1/0F AT 1530Z, AN M1/0B AT 1620Z, AN M2/1N AT 1749Z, AND AN M1/0F AT 2030Z. AN UNCORRELATED M2 TENFLARE (260 SFU) ALSO OCCURRED. THE REGION IS STILL AN IMPOSING SIGHT NEAR SUN CENTER, LARGE AND OMINOUS. REGION 6892 (S20W06) HAD OCCASIONAL FLARES IN CONCERT WITH ACTIVITY IN 6891. ELSEWHERE, TWO NEW REGIONS WERE ASSIGNED, 6898 (S07W26) AND 6899 (S12E39).

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE TO HIGH. REGION 6891 SHOULD CONTINUE M AND/OR X CLASS ACTIVITY.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 27/2100Z TO 28/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT MAJOR TO SEVERE STORM LEVELS SINCE A 54 NANOTESLA SUDDEN IMPULSE WAS RECORDED AT BOULDER AT 1054Z. PRESUMABLY THE SHOCK ORIGINATED IN EARLIER ENERGETIC FLARE ACTIVITY FROM REGION 6891, PERHAPS THE LONG- DURATION M1 WITH LENGTHY TYPE IV SWEEP EARLY ON 26 OCTOBER. AT APPROXIMATELY 1537Z THE FIELD EXPERIENCED ANOTHER JOLT, THIS A CHANGE OF ABOUT 400 NANOTESLA AT MID-LATITUDES IN JUST A FEW MINUTES. A STRONG FORBUSH DECREASE MEASURING ABOUT 10 PERCENT BEGAN ABOUT 0900Z. A SMALL PROTON EVENT AT GREATER THAN 10 MEV CROSSED THE THRESHOLD AT 1300Z, ATTAINED A 40 PFU MAXIMUM AT 1440Z, AND IS DECAYING TO BACKGROUND LEVELS AT THIS WRITING. THESE SLOW TO ARRIVE PARTICLES ARE THOUGHT TO BE FROM THE X-CLASS FLARES OF 27 OCT. A SMALL POLAR CAP ABSORPTION OF 2.2 DB OCCURRED AT 1530Z AND ALSO HAS ABATED.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE MINOR TO MAJOR STORM LEVELS THE DURATION OF THE FORECAST PERIOD. ADDITIONAL FLARE-INDUCED SHOCKS FROM THE MAJOR FLARES OF 27 OCT MAY PASS AND FUEL THE CURRENT STORM.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 28/2100Z
sections.text: TO 29/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 6891 (S11W19) PRODUCED TODAY'S LARGEST FLARE: AN M4/2N WHICH BEGAN AT 1809Z AND ENDED AT 1938Z WITH A MAXIMUM AT 1912Z. THE EVENT WAS AC- COMPANIED BY WEAK DISCRETE RADIO BURSTS. THIS REGION PRODUCED ADDITIONAL OCCASIONAL C-CLASS FLARES DURING THE DAY. ALTHOUGH THE REGION CONTINUES TO BE LARGE AND IMPRESSIVE MAGNETICALLY THERE WAS SOME INDICATION OF DECAY AND FRAGMENTATION IN THE GROUP. ONE OTHER M-CLASS EVENT WAS OBSERVED DURING THE PERIOD, AN UNCORRELATED M1 AT 1000Z. TWO NEW REGIONS WERE ASSIGNED TODAY: 6900 (S10E53) AND 6901 (S14E01), BOTH OF WHICH PRO- DUCED OCCASIONAL SUBFLARES.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE TO HIGH. REGION 6891 IS THE MAIN THREAT FOR CONTINUED MODERATE TO MAJOR FLARE ACTIVITY. M-FLARES ARE POSSIBLE FROM REGIONS 6892 AND PERHAPS 6893.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 28/2100Z TO 29/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD RANGED FROM ACTIVE TO SEVERE STORM LEVELS. A SEVERE STORM WAS OBSERVED FROM 29/0000Z THROUGH 1200UT AT ALL LATITUDES. K-INDICES OF 7 AND 8 WERE TYPICAL DURING THE DISTURBANCE. SINCE 1200UT CONDITIONS HAVE BEEN AT ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS. THE SOURCE OF THE DIS- TURBANCE IS UNCERTAIN: THE MOST LIKELY SOURCES APPEAR TO BE EITHER THE LONG DURATION M1 FLARE OR THE X1 FLARE, BOTH OF WHICH OCCURRED ON THE 26TH.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE AT MOSTLY MAJOR STORM LEVELS FOR THE NEXT 24 HOURS, WITH A POSSIBLITY FOR OCCASIONAL SEVERE CONDITIONS AT HIGH LATITUDES, PARTICULARLY IF INCREASED EFFECTS RESULT FROM AN X6 MAJOR FLARE WHICH OCCURRED ON THE 27TH. A GRADUAL DECLINE TOWARD MINOR TO MAJOR STORM LEVELS IS EXPECTED ON THE SECOND DAY, AND ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED BY DAY THREE.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 29/2100Z
sections.text: TO 30/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION 6891 (S12W32) PRODUCED A LONG DURATION X2/3B TENFLARE AT 0634Z. STRONG RADIO BURSTS ACROSS THE SPECTRUM, TYPE II AND IV RADIO SWEEPS AND A 5200 SFU TENFLARE WERE REPORTED WITH THIS FLARE. THE SHOCK SPEED FROM THE TYPE II SWEEP WAS ESTIMATED AT 1600 KM/SEC. PRIOR TO THIS X FLARE REGION 6891 PRODUCED AN M1/SN AT 2142Z. AN IMPULSIVE M4/1B AT 1916Z ROUNDED OUT TODAYS ACTIVITY FROM 6891. THE REGION APPEARS TO HAVE BEGUN A FRAGMENTATION OF THE LARGE TRAILER SPOT, PERHAPS SIGNALING THE BEGINNING OF ITS DECAY PROCESS. OTHER ACTIVITY TODAY INCLUDED A C9/2F FROM REGION 6892 (S19W33) AT 0435Z.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE TO HIGH. REGION 6891 REMAINS THE MAIN THREAT FOR CONTINUED ACTIVITY. REGION 6893 (N71W11) MAY ADD ADDITIONAL MODERATE ACTIVITY IF THE GROWTH REPORTED OVERNIGHT CONTINUES.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 29/2100Z TO 30/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT QUIET TO ACTIVE LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS. THE STORMING REPORTED YESTERDAY STOPPED ABRUPTLY AT THE BEGINNING OF THE UT DAY, WITH PERIODS OF QUIET CONDITIONS AT MID-LATITUDES BEING REPORTED. BY 1200Z CONDITIONS WERE MOSTLY ACTIVE AGAIN. A SATELLITE LEVEL PROTON EVENT BEGAN AT 0745Z IN RESPONSE TO THE EARLIER X2. THE EVENT REACHED A MAXIMUM OF 94 PFU AT THE GREATER THAN 10MEV LEVEL AT 0810Z AND IS AT THE EVENT THRESHOLD OF 10 PFU AT GREATER THAN 10 MEV AT THE TIME OF THIS WRITING. A PCA EVENT WAS ENDED AT 1600Z.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BEGIN THE PERIOD AT MOSTLY ACTIVE CONDITIONS. A SHOCK FROM THE X2 IS ANTICIPATED BETWEEN 1200 AND 1800Z ON 31 OCTOBER. IF THIS SHOCK MATERIALIZES, MINOR TO MAJOR STORMING CAN BE EXPECTED FOR 24 TO 36 HOURS THEREAFTER. THE PROTON EVENT NOW IN PROGRESS IS EXPECTED TO END SHORTLY BUT MAY CROSS BACK ABOVE THE EVENT THRESHOLD IF AND WHEN THE ANTICIPATED SHOCK ARRIVES.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 30/2100Z
sections.text: TO 31/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. AN UNCORRELATED M1 FLARE WAS OBSERVED AT 0912Z. THE REMAINDER OF TODAY'S ACTIVITY CONSISTED OF A HANDFUL OF MID TO UPPER LEVEL C-CLASS EVENTS, MOSTLY FROM REGION 6891 (S12W43), ALTHOUGH REGIONS 6892 (S19W44) AND 6893 (N17W28) ALSO MADE SOME CONTRIBUTIONS. REGION 6891 CONTINUES TO BE THE MOST IMPRESSIVE GROUP ON THE DISK BUT IT SHOWED CONTINUING DECAY AND FRAGMENTATION DURING THE PERIOD. REGION 6893 HAS SHOWN STEADY GROWTH OVER THE LAST TWO DAYS.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MOSTLY MODERATE. REGIONS 6891 AND 6892 ARE EXPECTED TO BE THE MAIN CENTERS FOR FLARE ACTIVITY, ALTHOUGH REGION 6893 MAY ALSO MAKE A CONTRIBUTION. THERE CONTINUES TO BE A THREAT FOR AN ISOLATED MAJOR FLARE FROM REGION 6891.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 30/2100Z TO 31/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS WITH AN ISOLATED PERIOD OF MAJOR TO SEVERE STORM LEVELS AT HIGH LATITUDES BETWEEN 0600-1200UT. A SUDDEN IMPULSE WAS OBSERVED IN BOULDER AT 1655UT OF 15 GAMMA. THE MOST PROBABLE SOURCE FOR THE IMPULSE WAS YESTERDAY'S X2 SOLAR FLARE. THE PROTON EVENT WHICH BEGAN AT 30/0745Z SHOWED STEADY DECAY TO- DAY. A BRIEF ENHANCEMENT IN PROTON FLUX LEVELS WAS OBSERVED AT THE TIME OF THE IMPULSE, BUT LEVELS PROMPTLY DROPPED BELOW THRESHOLD THEREAFTER AT 1715UT.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE AT MINOR STORM LEVELS TOMORROW DUE TO THE X2 FLARE OF 30 OCTOBER. CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED TO GRADUALLY SUBSIDE TO ACTIVE WITH MINOR STORM PERIODS AT HIGH LATITUDES FOR THE SECOND AND THIRD DAYS.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 31/2100Z
sections.text: TO 01/2100Z: SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. NUMEROUS C-CLASS FLARES WERE GENERATED DURING THE PERIOD. REGION 6891 (S11W60) PRODUCED THE BULK OF THIS ACTIVITY, TO INCLUDE AN M1/SF FLARE AT 2029Z, WHILE CONTINUING TO DISPLAY SLIGHT DECAY IN ITS SPOTS CONFIGURATION. THE AREA REMAINS POTENT MAGNETICALLY HOWEVER. REGIONS 6892 (S18W59) AND 6893 (N17W38) ALSO CONTRIBUTED TO THE NUMBER OF EVENTS OBSERVED. THESE AREAS ALSO SHOWED SIGNS OF SOME DECAY IN PROGRESS. STRONG CALCIUM XV EMISSIONS WERE NOTED ON THE SOUTHEAST LIMB IN THE VICINITY OF NEW REGION 6905 (S08E75). THESE EMISSIONS WERE ALSO NOTED ON THE SOUTHWEST LIMB WHERE 6891 IS APPROACHING.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE WITH REGIONS 6891, 6892, AND 6893 PROVIDING THE SOURCE FOR FLARING AT THIS LEVEL. AN ISOLATED MAJOR FLARE IS STILL POSSIBLE FROM 6891.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 31/2100Z TO 01/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS RANGED FROM UNSETTLED TO SEVERE STORM LEVELS. SEVERE STORMING WAS ISOLATED TO THE HIGH LATITUDES WHILE MID-LATITUDES EXPERIENCED FREQUENT PERIODS OF MAJOR STORMING. MAGNETOPAUSE CROSSINGS WERE OBSERVED BY THE GOES 7 VEHICLE BETWEEN 01/1527-1617Z. CROSSING WERE ALSO NOTED STARTING AT 2002Z. THIS TIME HOWEVER, THEY WERE OBSERVED ON BOTH GOES VEHICLES. THE CURRENT ROUND OF STORMING MAY BE ASSOCIATED WITH THE X2 X-RAY EVENT OF 30 OCTOBER WITH SOME CONTRIBUTION FROM A WELL POSITIONED CORONAL HOLE.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO CONTINUE AT MINOR TO MAJOR STORM LEVELS FOR THE NEXT 24 HOURS. GENERALLY ACTIVE CONDITIONS WITH ISOLATED MINOR STORMING AT HIGH LATITUDES SHOULD CHARACTERIZE THE REMAINDER OF THE PERIOD.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 01/2100Z
sections.text: TO 02/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION 6891 (S12W72) PRODUCED AN M9/1B FLARE AT 02/0652Z. THIS FLARE WAS ACCOMPANIED BY A DISCRETE RADIO BURST OF 1400 SFU AT 2695 MHZ, BUT NO EVENT LEVEL SWEEP ACTIVITY WAS OBSERVED. THIS REGION ALSO PRODUCED A LONG DURATION M4/1B FLARE AT 02/1702Z. FURTHER DECAY IS APPARENT SINCE YESTERDAY, CHARACTERIZED BY ADDITIONAL FRAGMENTATION OF THE LARGE SPOT COMPLEX AND A SLIGHTLY REDUCED SPOT COUNT. REGION 6893 (N15W51) IS THE NEXT MOST SIGNIFICANT REGION ON THE DISK. IT IS ALSO DECAYING SLOWLY AND PRODUCED AN M3/1B AT 02/1152Z. NEW REGION 6907 (S21E13) WAS NUMBERED.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE TO HIGH. ANOTHER MAJOR FLARE IS EXPECTED IN REGION 6891 BEFORE IT ROTATES AROUND THE WEST LIMB. M-CLASS ACTIVITY IS POSSIBLE IN REGION 6893.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 01/2100Z TO 02/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD REMAINED AT STORM LEVELS AT MOST STATIONS UNTIL 02/0600Z. AFTERWARD THE MIDDLE LATITUDE FIELD WAS QUIET TO UNSETTLED AND THE HIGH LATITUDE FIELD WAS QUIET TO ACTIVE.

sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE MOSTLY UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE. ISOLATED STORM CONDITIONS ARE POSSIBLE DURING LOCAL NIGHTTIME.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 02/2100Z
sections.text: TO 03/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. REGION 6891 (S12W83) CONTINUED TO DECAY AS IT APPROACHED THE WEST LIMB. THE LARGEST FLARE OBSERVED IN THIS REGION DURING THE PAST DAY WAS A C6/1N AT 02/2234Z. REGION 6893 (N16W65) ALSO CONTINUED TO DECAY. IT PRODUCED A FEW SUBFLARES DURING THE PAST DAY BUT NONE OF THEM HAD SIGNIFICANT X-RAY OUTPUT. NEW REGIONS 6908 (N22E73) AND 6909 (N06E78) WERE NUMBERED.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 04/2100Z
sections.text: TO 05/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE DUE TO AN M3 X-RAY FLARE AT 04/2323Z. REGION 6906 (S16W16) IS EMERGING RAPIDLY, SHOWING CONSIDERABLE PENUMBRAL DEVELOPMENT SINCE YESTERDAY. THIS REGION HAS PRODUCED SEVERAL C-CLASS SUBFLARES. ACTIVITY AT THE EAST LIMB NEAR NE24 DURING THE PAST 36 HOURS HAS INCLUDED AN EPL AT 04/1150Z, AN EPL AT 04/2346Z AND A SPRAY AT 05/1547Z, SUGGESTING THAT A SIGNIFICANT NEW ACTIVE REGION MAY SOON ROTATE INTO VIEW. THE EPL AT 04/2346Z MAY HAVE CONTRIBUTED TO THE M3 FLARE MENTIONED ABOVE. THE FOLLOWING NEW REGIONS WERE NUMBERED - 6913 (S32W18), 6914 (S17W05), 6915 (N16E64), AND 6916 (S23E66).

sections.text: TO 06/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. FOUR M-CLASS FLARES OCCURRED DURING THIS REPORTING PERIOD. THREE OF THE FOUR M-FLARES OCCURRED IN REGION 6906 (S16W30). THE LARGEST OF THESE WAS A M4/SB FLARE AT 0450Z. REGION 6906 CONTINUES TO SHOW GROWTH IN BOTH LEADER AND TRAILER SPOTS, BUT REMAINS MAGNETICALLY SIMPLE. REMAINING SPOT GROUPS ARE SMALL AND UNIMPRESSIVE. A 24 DEGREE LONG FILAMENT DISAPPEARED OVERNIGHT IN THE SE QUADRANT. IT WAS LAST SEEN AT 2022Z AND CENTERED AT S32E32.

THE REGION DISPLAYED GRADUAL DECAY DURING THE PERIOD AND WAS RELATIVELY QUIET AFTER PRODUCING THE M2. REGIONS 6908 (N21E26) AND 6914 (S18W31) DISPLAYED GROWTH, BUT PRODUCED ONLY ISOLATED SUBFLARE ACTIVITY. AN ERUPTIVE PROMINENCE REACHING 0.32 SOLAR RADII OCCURRED NEAR N22E90 AT 07/0728Z. NO NEW REGIONS WERE ASSIGNED.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 07/2100Z
sections.text: TO 08/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 6906 (S16W57) PRODUCED AN M4/1B AT 08/1712Z. THE FLARE WAS CLOSE TO THE AREA WHERE THIS REGION AND REGION 6914 (S18W44) ARE ABUTTED. A LOOP PROMINENCE SYSTEM AND TENFLARE OF 330 SFU WERE ASSOCIATED WITH THE FLARE. 6906 ALSO PRODUCED 5 C-CLASS FLARES. REGION 6914 HAS BEEN SYMPATHETICALLY FLARING WITH 6906 AND PRODUCED NUMEROUS FLARES DURING THE PERIOD INCLUDING 7 C-CLASS EVENTS. IN TERMS OF GROWTH, REGION 6906 HAS BEEN SLOWLY DECLINING WHILE 6914 HAS BEEN GROWING. REGION 6915 (N19E30) DISPLAYED GROWTH AND BEGAN PRODUCING SUBFLARES LATE IN THE PERIOD. NEW REGIONS 6918 (N21E06) AND 6919 (S11E76) WERE NUMBERED. REGION 6918 WAS FORMERLY THE LEADER PORTION OF REGION 6908 (N21E17).

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE. THE REGION 6906/6914 COMPLEX IS EXPECTED TO PRODUCE M-CLASS FLARES. C-CLASS FLARES ARE EXPECTED FROM REGIONS 6915 AND 6919.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 07/2100Z TO 08/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT UNSETTLED TO MAJOR STORM LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS. A SUDDEN IMPULSE OF 17 GAMMAS WAS RECORDED BY THE BOULDER USGS MAGNETOMETER AT 08/0647Z. THIS WAS FOLLOWED BY A JUMP TO ACTIVE LEVELS FOLLOWED BY AN INCREASE TO MINOR TO MAJOR STORM LEVELS BETWEEN 08/1200-1500Z. THE GOES 7 MAGNETOMETER INDICATED MAGNETOPAUSE CROSSINGS NEAR 08/1400Z, 1600Z, 1700Z, AND 2030Z. THE SOURCE OF THIS ACTIVITY MAY HAVE BEEN THE DISAPPEARANCE OF A 24 DEGREE FILAMENT FROM THE SOUTHEAST QUADRANT ON 5 NOVEMBER.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE AT STORM LEVELS THROUGH MIDDAY TOMORROW. THE FIELD IS THEN EXPECTED TO DECLINE TO UNSETTLED LEVELS AND REMAIN SO FOR THE BALANCE OF THE PERIOD.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 08/2100Z
sections.text: TO 09/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION 6906 (S16W67) PRODUCED AN X1/1B PARALLEL RIBBON FLARE AT 09/1544Z. A 540 SFU TENFLARE, AND WEAK TYPES II AND IV SWEEPS WERE ASSOCIATED WITH THE FLARE. THE ONLY REMAINING SPOT IN OLD REGION 6914 MERGED WITH THE TRAILER SPOTS IN REGION 6906 AND IS NOW CONSIDERED PART OF THAT REGION. REGION 6906 WAS GENERALLY STABLE IN TERMS OF GROWTH. REGION 6918 (N22W08) PRODUCED AN M1/SN FLARE AT 09/0320Z, THEN DECAYED DURING THE REMAINDER OF THE PERIOD. REGION 6915 (N20E17) PRODUCED FOUR C-CLASS SUBFLARES WHILE DISPLAYING SIGNIFICANT GROWTH. MINOR GROWTH WAS NOTED IN REGION 6919 (S12E61). NEW REGION 6920 (S20W31) WAS NUMBERED.

sections.text: MODERATE TO HIGH. REGION 6906 IS CAPABALE OF PRODUCING AN ISOLATED MAJOR FLARE. REGION 6915 MAY PRODUCE ISOLATED M-CLASS ACTIVITY.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 08/2100Z TO 09/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT MINOR TO SEVERE STORM LEVELS. SEVERE STORM LEVELS OCCURRED AT MIDDLE LATITUDES UNTIL 09/0900Z, THEN DECLINED TO MINOR STORM LEVELS. HIGH LATITUDE SEVERE STORMING PERSISTED THROUGH THE PERIOD.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE AT ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS TOMORROW WITH A DECREASING TREND AS STORMING SUBSIDES. THE MAJOR FLARE MENTIONED ABOVE SHOULD CAUSE MOSTLY ACTIVE LEVELS DURING THE REMAINING TWO DAYS.

sections.text: TO 10/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION 6919 (S12E50) PRODUCED THREE M-CLASS FLARES, TWO OF WHICH REACHED THE MAJOR CATEGORY. THE FIRST WAS AN M6/1N AT 10/0135Z AND WAS ASSOCIATED WITH A MINOR TYPE II SWEEP. THE SECOND WAS AN M7/1N AT 10/2013Z WHICH WAS ASSOCIATED WITH A 550 SFU TENFLARE AND A MAJOR TYPE II SWEEP. IT ALSO PRODUCED AN M2/2B FLARE AT 10/0654Z ACCOMPANIED BY MINOR RADIO EMISSIONS. THIS REGION WAS MODERATE IN SIZE AND MAGNETIC COMPLEXITY AND SHOWED NO SIGNIFICANT CHANGES IN APPEARANCE DURING THE PERIOD. REGION 6906 (S17W81) WAS STABLE IN TERMS OF APPEARANCE AND FLARE PRODUCTION AS IT APPROACHED THE LIMB. REGION 6915 (N20E05) GREW AT A REDUCED RATE, COMPARED TO YESTERDAY, AND PRODUCED NO FLARES. NEW REGIONS 6921 (N09E27) AND 6922 (S18E32) WERE NUMBERED.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 15/2100Z
sections.text: TO 16/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION 6919 (S12W27), AFTERS DAYS OF ISOLATED SUBFLARING, GENERATED AN X1/3B TENFLARE AT 15/2239Z. THE EVENT BOASTED A FULL SPECTRAL BURST OF MODEST INTENSITY WITH 1100 SFU ACHIEVED AT 2695MHZ. A STRONG TYPE 2 SWEEP BURST ALSO ACCOMPANIED THIS ACTIVITY. THE REGION HAS SINCE PRODUCED ISOLATED C-CLASS FLARING WHILE CONTINUING TO DECAY IN AREA. A LONE SUBFLARE FROM REGION 6921 (N10W56) WAS OBSERVED. EVENT LEVEL BRIGHT SURGING WAS NOTED ON THE SOUTHEAST LIMB AT 0415Z, POSSIBLY HAILING THE RETURN OF OLD REGION 6891 (S11, L-186). NEW REGION 6927 (N07E62) WAS ASSIGNED.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW TO MODERATE. REGION 6919 CURRENTLY POSES THE GREATEST THREAT FOR MODERATE ACTIVITY.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 15/2100Z TO 16/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT MOSTLY UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE MOSTLY ACTIVE. EFFECTS FROM THE MAJOR FLARING NOTED ABOVE ARE POSSIBLE LATE ON THE 17TH, EXTENDING INTO THE 18TH. PERIODS OF MINOR STORMING AT HIGH LATITUDES MAY BE NOTED. UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE CONDITIONS SHOULD CLOSE OUT THE PERIOD.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 16/2100Z
sections.text: TO 17/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. NEWLY NUMBERED REGION 6929 (S10E74) - FORMERLY 6891 - PRODUCED TWO M CLASS EVENTS, AN M1/0F AT 0716Z AND A VERY IMPULSIVE M1/2B TENFLARE AT 1834Z. THE SECOND FLARE WAS ACCOMPANIED BY AN IMPRESSIVE SPRAY VISIBLE TO AT LEAST .56 SOLAR RADII. LIMB PROXIMITY PROHIBITS A THOROUGH ANALYSIS OF THE REGION, BUT IT CLEARLY POSSESSES AT LEAST SOME DEGREE OF POTENCY. REGION 6919 (S12W44) YIELDED AN M1/2B TENFLARE OF ITS OWN WITH TYPE II SWEEP AT 0201Z. SLOW DECAY HAS BEEN REPORTED THERE. NEW REGION 6928 (S16E36) WAS BORN ON THE DISK. TWO FILAMENTS DISAPPEARED IN THE LAST 24 HOURS, ONE 12 DEGREE-LONG FROM S10E36, AND ANOTHER 21 DEGREES IN LENGTH FROM N43E61.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE. REGION 6929 SHOULD CONTINUE ITS M CLASS FLARES AND REGION 6919 MAY CONTRIBUTE ACTIVITY ALSO.

sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE ACTIVE THE NEXT 24 HOURS WHEN EFFECTS FROM THE MAJOR FLARE OF 15 NOV ARE DUE. UNSETTLED TO MILDLY ACTIVE CONDITIONS SHOULD END THE PERIOD.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 17/2100Z
sections.text: TO 18/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 6919 (S12W58) GENERATED THE ONLY M-CLASS EVENT OF THE DAY, AN M1/1B AT 1058Z. REGION 6929 (S11E62), THE SITE OF TWO M-CLASS FLARES YESTERDAY, COULD MUSTER BUT TWO C-CLASS SUBFLARES IN THE PAST 24 HOURS. NEITHER OF THESE REGIONS IS PARTICULARLY IMPRESSIVE IN WHITE LIGHT OR H-ALPHA. REGION 6929, NEE 6981, SEEMS TO HAVE DECAYED SUBSTANTIALLY SINCE IT WAS LAST SEEN AT WEST LIMB PASSAGE TWO WEEKS AGO. ELSEWHERE, THE OTHER 4 SPOTTED REGIONS WERE QUIET AND UNREMARKABLE.

sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE GENERALLY UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE THE NEXT THREE DAYS. MINOR STORM LEVELS MAY BE REACHED MIDWAY THROUGH THE INTERVAL WHEN A TRANS-EQUATORIAL CORONAL HOLE ROTATES TO A FAVORABLE LOCATION.

sections.text: TO 19/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. REGION 6919 (S11W74) HAD THE DAY'S LARGEST EVENT, THAT A C8/1F AT 0932Z. REGION 6929 (S11E50) COULD MANAGE ONLY OCCASIONAL SMALLER C-CLASS EVENTS. THESE TWO REGIONS ARE THE MOST IMPRESSIVE OF THE NINE NOW VISIBLE ON AN OTHERWISE DULL SUN. sections.text: TO 21/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 6919, NOW A DAY PAST WEST LIMB NEAR S12, WAS RESPONSIBLE FOR AN M1 X-RAY EVENT WITH TYPE II SWEEP AT 1903Z. SURGING AND LOOPS WERE SEEN IN THIS LOCATION AT THE TIME OF THE X-RAY BURST. OTHERWISE, VERY LITTLE OF CONSEQUENCE OCCURRED FROM THE VISIBLE DISK AS THE EIGHT SPOTTED REGIONS WERE VERY ORDINARY. sections.text: TO 02/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE.  THE LARGEST EVENT OF THE PERIOD WAS A M3/SF AT 0501UT FROM REGION 6952 (N18E78). THIS REGION IS IN THE AREA OF RETURNING REGION 6915 (N19 L002) AND IS A SIMPLE H-TYPE SPOT AT THIS TIME.  AN OPTICALLY UNCORRELATED M1 EVENT OCCURRED AT 0116UT. sections.text: LOW TO MODERATE.  REGIONS 6952 AND 6946 ARE THE MOST LIKELY SOURCES OF ENERGETIC ACTIVITY.  OLD REGION 6919 (S11 L317), WHICH PRODUCED SEVEN M FLARES AND ONE X FLARE DURING ITS PREVIOUS ROTATION, IS DUE BACK ON 5 DEC AND MAY PRODUCE ADDITIONAL ACTIVITY.

sections.text: TO 04/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 6952 (N18E55) PRODUCED AN M4/SF FLARE AT 04/1757Z AND AN M1/1N AT 04/1138Z. MINOR RADIO EMISSIONS WERE ASSOCIATED WITH THESE FLARES. AN ERUPTIVE PROMINENCE REACHING AT LEAST 0.30 SOLAR RADII WAS OBSERVED AT 04/1928Z NEAR N18E90. ACTIVE SURGING OCCURRED NEAR S09E90 MIDWAY THROUGH THE PERIOD, PROBABLY ASSOCIATED WITH THE RETURN OF OLD ACTIVE REGION 6919 WHICH IS DUE BACK EARLY ON 05 DECEMBER. NEW REGION 6957 (S14W59) WAS NUMBERED.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 07/2100Z
sections.text: TO 08/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. FLARE ACTIVITY INCREASED SIGNIFICANTLY TODAY WITH REGION 6961 (N10E50) LEADING THE WAY. CONTINUED RAPID GROWTH WAS NOTED IN THIS AREA WHICH PRODUCED SEVERAL M-CLASS EVENTS TO INCLUDE THE LARGEST: AN M3/1B FLARE AT 1707Z. REGION 6952 (N19E02) ALSO PRODUCED M-CLASS ACTIVITY WHILE SHOWING SOME DECAY AND LOSS OF MAGNETIC COMPLEXITY. AN M1/1N FLARE WAS NOTED AT 0555Z IN REGION 6955 (N11E03). OTHER ACTIVITY OF NOTE INCLUDES OCCASIONAL FLARING IN REGION 6958 (S17E17) AND A LOOP PROMINENCE SYSTEM OBSERVED ON THE SOUTHEAST LIMB WHERE X-RAY IMAGERY SUGGESTS AN ACTIVE CENTER MAY BE EMERGING. NEW REGIONS 6964 (S22E50) AND 6965 (S06E70) WERE ASSIGNED.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE TO HIGH. REGIONS 6952 AND 6961 SHOULD CONTINUE TO GENERATE M-CLASS FLARES. BOTH ARE ALSO CAPABLE OF AN ISOLATED MAJOR EVENT.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 08/2100Z
sections.text: TO 09/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. FREQUENT M-CLASS FLARING CONTINUED THROUGHOUT THE PERIOD. REGION 6961 (N10E39) GENERATED THE MAJORITY OF THESE FLARES TO INCLUDE THE TWO LARGEST: AN M5/SF EVENT AT 08/2316Z AND AN M7/SN EVENT AT 1354Z. BOTH FLARES DISPLAYED ONLY WEAK RADIO EMISSIONS AND WERE OF SHORT DURATION. THIS REGION CONTINUES TO GROW IN SPOT AREA AND MAGNETIC COMPLEXITY. REGION 6952 (N18W11) PRODUCED ISOLATED SUBFLARES WHILE DECAYING IN SIZE. REGIONS 6963 (S11W18) AND 6958 (S18E05) CONTRIBUTED OCCASIONAL FLARING WHILE DISPLAYING SIGNIFICANT GROWTH. SEVERAL UNCORRELATED M-CLASS X-RAY EVENTS WERE NOTED DURING THE PERIOD AND MAY HAVE ORIGINATED FROM NEW REGION 6966 (S03E76) WHICH HAS JUST ROTATED INTO VIEW. NEW REGION 6967 (S27E13) WAS ALSO ASSIGNED TODAY.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 11/2100Z
sections.text: TO 12/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 6958 (S18W32) PRODUCED AN M2/1B FLARE WITH TYPE II SWEEP AT 11/2105Z, AND LATER, AN M1/1N AT 1708Z. REGION 6966 (S05E38) HAD AN M1/0N AT 0312Z. BOTH REGIONS EXHIBIT A MODERATE DEGREE OF MAGNETIC COMPLEXITY AND HAVE ACTIVE NEUTRAL LINE FILAMENTS. AN UNUSUAL TENFLARE OF 290 SFU WITH TYPES II AND IV SWEEP WAS RECORDED AT 0955Z. NO OPTICAL FLARE WAS SEEN THEN AND THE X-RAYS REGISTERED JUST A SLOW-RISING C-CLASS ENHANCEMENT. ABOUT ONE HOUR LATER A PROTON ENHANCEMENT BEGAN AT GOES (SEE BELOW).

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE THROUGHOUT THE FORECAST PERIOD.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 11/2100Z TO 12/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS QUIET TO UNSETTLED. AN ENHANCEMENT IN THE GREATER THAN 10 MEV PROTON FLUX BEGAN JUST AFTER 1100Z. THE SPECTRAL PROFILE SUGGESTS A WESTERN HEMISPHERE PARENT FLARE, PERHAPS BEYOND WEST LIMB. THE PEAK FLUX BARELY EXCEEDED 1 PFU, AND IS NOW SLOWLY RETURNING TO BACKGROUND.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE GENERALLY UNSETTLED. SOME ACTIVE PERIODS MAY OCCUR IN THE NEXT 24 HOURS WHEN WHAT SEEMS TO BE A SMALL CORONAL HOLE, VISIBLE IN X-RAYS, ROTATES TO A FAVORABLE SITE.

FIVE OF THE NINE SPOTTED REGIONS NOW VISIBLE HAD SOME FLARE ACTIVITY, BUT THE OVERALL LEVEL OF ACTIVITY DECLINED FROM THAT OF THE PAST FEW DAYS.

sections.text: MODERATE. REGIONS 6958 (S18W49) AND 6961 (N09W15) ARE BOTH CAPABLE OF M-CLASS ACTIVITY AT SOME POINT IN THE NEXT THREE DAYS.

sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT PREDOMINANTLY QUIET TO UNSETTLED LEVELS. EPISODES OF ACTIVE CONDITIONS, THOUGHT TO BE DUE TO CORONAL HOLE EFFECTS, WERE OBSERVED THE LATTER PART OF THE INTERVAL.

sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE. OCCASIONAL MINOR STORM CONDITIONS MAY OCCUR ON 16 DECEMBER WHEN ANOTHER CORONAL HOLE MOVES INTO A WELL-CONNECTED POSITION.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 13/2100Z
sections.text: TO 14/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 6958 (S18W61) GENERATED AN M1/2N FLARE AT 0717Z, ITS ONLY FLARE OF THE PERIOD. THE OTHER M-CLASS EVENTS WERE BOTH UNSEEN; AN M1 AT 1451Z AND AN M2 AT 2058Z. FURTHER INFORMATION MAY BE FORTHCOMING ON THIS VERY RECENT M2. REGION 6961 (N09W28) WAS THE MOST PRODUCTIVE REGION IN THE PAST 24 HOURS. ALTHOUGH IT FAILED TO ATTAIN M-CLASS WITH ITS EFFORTS, IT DID YIELD A C9/0N WITH IMPORTANCE 3 TYPE II SWEEP AT 0106Z, AND A C8/1N WITH IMPORTANCE 2 TYPE II AT 0553Z. ELSEWHERE, FREQUENT SURGING AND SMALL LIMB EVENTS WERE OBSERVED NEAR SE10. TWO NEW REGIONS WERE ASSIGNED, 6970 (S12W54) AND 6971 (S27W05).

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO
sections.text: CONTINUE AT MODERATE LEVELS. REGIONS 6958 AND 6961 ARE THE BEST CANDIDATES FOR OCCASIONAL M-CLASS ACTIVITY.

sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE. SOMEWHAT ELEVATED ACTIVITY IS ANTICIPATED 16 DECEMBER WHEN CORONAL HOLE EFFECTS ARE DUE.

sections.text: TO 15/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 6961 (N09W41) PRODUCED ONE M-CLASS FLARE, AN M1/0F AT 1425Z. NEWLY ASSIGNED REGION 6972 (S11E68) GENERATED AN M1/1F FLARE AT 1834Z. sections.text: PERSIST AT THE MODERATE LEVEL. REGION 6961 SHOULD CONTINUE ITS OUTPUT OF PERIODIC LOW-LEVEL M-CLASS FLARES. NEW REGION 6972, SEEMINGLY SIMPLE IN WHITE LIGHT AND H-ALPHA, HAS SHOWN ITSELF TO BE POTENT, AND IS LIKELY TO PRODUCE AN OCCASIONAL M-CLASS EVENT.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 15/2100Z
sections.text: TO 16/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION 6961 (N09W54) PRODUCED A VERY IMPULSIVE M6/0N TENFLARE AT 1927Z. MODERATE BURSTS ACROSS THE RADIO SPECTRUM WERE OBSERVED, INCLUDING 740 FLUX UNITS AT 2695 MHZ. EARLIER IN THE INTERVAL THIS REGION HAD AN M2/0F AT 0459Z. SIMILAR TO THE PAST FEW DAYS, SOME OF THE DAY'S M-LEVEL FLARES WERE NOT OBSERVED. THESE WERE A LONG DURATION M3 AT 1312Z, AN M1 AT 0641Z, AND ANOTHER M1, THIS AT 1204Z. STRONG RADIO EMISSION, SEEN AT EAST LIMB IN THE 10 CM. EAST-WEST SCAN, ARGUES FOR A HOT ACTIVE REGION SOON TO APPEAR AND A POSSIBLE SOURCE OF THESE OPTICALLY UNASSOCIATED EVENTS.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE. REGIONS 6961 AND 6972 (S11E58) ARE THE MOST LIKELY DISK REGIONS TO YIELD M-CLASS EVENTS, AND WATCH EAST LIMB FOR PERHAPS ANOTHER VOLATILE REGION.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 15/2100Z TO 16/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS QUIET UNTIL MIDWAY THROUGH THE PERIOD. CORONAL HOLE EFFECTS WERE ANTICIPATED AND ARE THOUGHT RESPONSIBLE FOR THE ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS NOW BEING OBSERVED.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO RANGE FROM UNSETTLED TO MINOR STORM LEVELS OVER THE NEXT THREE DAYS. ADDITIONAL EFFECTS FROM ANOTHER CORONAL HOLE ARE DUE 18 DECEMBER.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 16/2100Z
sections.text: TO 17/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE.  A SINGLE M CLASS FLARE OCCURRED IN THE PAST 24 HOURS, AN M2/1B FROM REGION 6961 (N08W66) AT 0629UT.  THIS REGION APPEARS TO BE DECLINING. REGION 6972 (S10E44) PRODUCED SEVERAL C FLARES, THE LARGEST A C7/SF AT 16/2207UT.  AN AFS WAS REPORTED IN THE TRAILER PORTION OF THIS REGION.  THE SHARP INCREASE IN 10.7CM RADIO FLUX OBSERVED YESTERDAY, DID NOT CONTINUE TODAY.  THE FLUX DROPPED 35 SFU TO 198.  THE SOURCE OF THE LARGE INCREASE ON 16 DEC IS NOT KNOWN.  NO ACTIVE REGIONS HAVE ROTATED OVER THE EAST LIMB, HOWEVER, REGION 6977 (S33W72) EMERGED ON THE DISK.

sections.text: LOW TO MODERATE.  REGIONS 6961 AND 6972 CONTINUE TO BE THE MOST LIKELY SOURCES OF ENERGETIC EVENTS.  REGION 6961 WILL BEGIN WEST LIMB TRANSIT ON 19 DEC AND CHANCES FOR ENERGETIC SHOULD DECREASE ACCORDINGLY.

sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS, WITH PERIODS OF MINOR STORMING AT HIGH LATITUDES.  A POSITIVE POLARITY CORONAL HOLE IN THE NORTHERN SOLAR HEMISPHERE IS THE MOST LIKELY SOURCE OF THE ACTIVITY.

sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE UNSETTLED EARLY IN THE PERIOD AND MOSTLY ACTIVE LATER IN THE PERIOD, DUE TO ANOTHER FAVORABLY LOCATED EXTENSION OF THE NORTHERN CORONAL HOLE.  HIGH LATITUDES MAY EXPERIENCE SOME PERIODS OF MINOR STORMING DURING THIS TIME.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 19/2100Z
sections.text: TO 20/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION 6982 (S14E55) PRO- DUCED AN X3/2B FLARE AT 1411UT. THE EVENT WAS ACCOMPANIED BY STRONG RADIO BURSTS, A STRONG TYPE II AND A WEAK TYPE IV RADIO EVENT. THE REGION SHOWED INCREASED AREA TODAY (680 MILLIONTHS) AND APPEARS TO POSSESS A DELTA CONFIGURATION, ALTHOUGH ITS PROXIMITY TO THE LIMB LIMITED MAGNETIC OBSERVATIONS. THIS GROUP WAS NOT OBSERVED TO PRODUCE ANY OTHER FLARES DURING THE PERIOD. REGION 6972 (S10E09) PRODUCED THE ONLY OTHER FLARE WORTHY OF NOTE: A C7/SN AT 1101Z. THE REMAINDER OF THE REGIONS DID NOT FLARE. NEW REGION 6983 (S09W14) EMERGED TODAY AS A SMALL D-TYPE GROUP.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE. REGIONS 6972 AND 6982 ARE THE ONLY GROUPS THAT APPEAR TO BE CAPABLE OF PRODUCING M-CLASS LEVEL ACTIVITY. THERE IS A SLIGHT TO FAIR CHANCE FOR ANOTHER ISOLATED MAJOR FLARE FROM REGION 6982.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 19/2100Z TO 20/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS PREDOMINANTLY QUIET TO UNSETTLED. A BRIEF ACTIVE PEROD WAS OBSERVED AT HIGH LATITUDES FROM 1500-1800UT.

sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE ACTIVE FOR THE NEXT TWO DAYS. THE INCREASE FOR THE FIRST DAY IS EXPECTED FROM CORONAL HOLE EFFECTS AND FOR THE SECOND DAY FROM TODAY'S MAJOR FLARE. CONDITIONS SHOULD SUBSIDE TO MOSTLY UNSETTLED BY THE THIRD DAY.

sections.text: TO 21/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. TWO OPTICALLY UN- CORRELATED M-CLASS EVENTS OCCURRED TODAY: AN M1 AT 1208Z AND AN M1 AT 1822Z. AN ADDITIONAL UNCORRELATED C9.8 OCCURRED AT 0425Z. REGION 6972 (S08W04) SHOWED SLOW DECAY AND PRODUCED A C7/SF AT 1526Z. REGION 6966 (S03W87) COULD ONLY PRODUCE A C5/SF AT 0820Z AS IT CROSSED THE WEST LIMB. sections.text: MODERATE. ALTHOUGH THE CURRENT SOURCE OF M-FLARES IS UNKNOWN, REGION 6982 SHOWS CLEAR CAPABILITY FOR PRODUCING M-FLARES AND POSSIBLY AN ISOLATED MAJOR FLARE. REGION 6972 CONTINUES TO BE RESPECTABLE AND MIGHT PRODUCE AN M-CLASS EVENT AS WELL.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 20/2100Z TO 21/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE. SOME PERIODS OF ISOLATED MINOR STORMING WERE REPORTED AT HIGH LATITUDES. THE INCREASE IS PROBABLY A RESULT OF CORONAL HOLE EFFECTS.

THIS REGION REMAINS LARGE IN SUNSPOT AREA WITH MODERATE MAGNETIC COMPLEXITY. REGION 6985 (S16E66) IS THE LARGEST REGION ON THE DISK AND APPEARS TO BE MORE COMPLEX THAN 6982. sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 23/2100Z
sections.text: TO 24/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION 6982 (S13E03) PRODUCED AN X1/2B FLARE AT 24/1024Z. THIS FLARE WAS ACCOMPANIED BY A 2695 MHZ RADIO BURST OF 460 SFU. THIS REGION REMAINS LARGE AND MAGNETICALLY COMPLEX. REGION 6985 (S16E50) IS THE LARGEST AND POSSIBLY THE MOST COMPLEX REGION ON THE DISK, BUT HAS NOT PRODUCED SIGNIFICANT ACTIVITY DURING THE PAST DAY. NEW REGION 6988 (S14E67) ROTATED INTO VIEW DIRECTLY EAST OF 6985. THIS REGION IS ALSO LARGE AND IS POSITIONED WELL FOR INTERACTION WITH 6985.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE TO HIGH. MAJOR FLARES ARE EXPECTED IN REGIONS 6982, 6985, AND 6988.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 24/2100Z
sections.text: TO 25/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGIONS 6982 (S14W09) AND 6985 (S17E36) BOTH PRODUCED LOW-LEVEL M-CLASS FLARES DURING THE PAST DAY. AN M1/1N OCCURRED IN 6985 AT 25/1306Z AND AN M1/SN WAS OBSERVED IN 6982 AT 25/1459Z. REGION 6982 REMAINS LARGE AND QUITE COMPLEX. REGION 6985 IS SHOWING SIGNS OF DECAY; NEVERTHELESS, IT IS STILL A LARGE, COMPLEX SUNSPOT GROUP. REGION 6988 (S14E56) IS ABUTTED TO 6985, INCREASING THE LIKELIHOOD OF INTERACTIONS THAT MAY RESULT IN MAJOR FLARES. SMALL, NEW REGIONS 6989 (N14E13) AND 6990 (S05E77) WERE NUMBERED.

sections.text: MODERATE TO HIGH. MAJOR FLARES ARE EXPECTED IN REGION 6982 AND IN THE 6985/6988 COMPLEX.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 25/2100Z
sections.text: TO 26/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGIONS 6982 (S13W21) AND 6985 (S15E23) CONTINUED TO PRODUCE LOW-LEVEL M-CLASS FLARES. BOTH REGIONS REMAIN LARGE AND COMPLEX, WITH 6982 POSSIBLY THE MOST SIGNIFICANT REGION. THE DELTA CONFIGURATION PERSISTS IN 6982 AND THE SHEAR NEAR THE DELTA APPEARS TO BE INCREASING. REGION 6985 NO LONGER HAS A DELTA AND THE OVERALL APPEARANCE OF THE REGION SUGGESTS THAT IT IS SIMPLIFYING.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 26/2100Z
sections.text: TO 27/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. FIVE M-CLASS EVENTS WERE OBSERVED. THE FIRST WAS AN M4/1B AT 26/2145Z FROM REGION 6985 (S18E09) WHICH HAD AN ASSOCIATED 300 SFU TENFLARE. THIS REGION EXHIBITED NO SIGNIFICANT CHANGES IN SIZE AND STRUCTURE, REMAIN- ING MODERATELY COMPLEX IN MAGNETIC ASPECTS. REGION 6982 (S12W35) PRODUCED AN M1/1N FLARE AT 27/0311Z AND AN M2/SN (WITH AN ASSOCIATED 310 SFU TENFLARE) AT 27/1731Z. THIS REGION DISPLAYED SOME PENUMBRAL DECAY IN ITS LEADER, BUT AT THE SAME TIME SHOWED GROWTH IN ITS TRAILER. ALL TOLD, THE REGION RETAINED ITS STRUCTURAL COMPLEXITY WITH A MAGNETIC DELTA CONFIGURATION APPARENT IN ITS CENTRAL PORTION. THE REMAINING TWO M-CLASS X-RAY BURSTS WERE NOT OPTICALLY CORRELATED: AN M2 AT 27/0618Z AND AN M1 AT 27/1113Z WHICH WAS ASSOCIATED WITH A 430 SFU TENFLARE AND A MAJOR TYPE IV SWEEP. NO NEW REGIONS WERE ASSIGNED TODAY.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE TO HIGH. REGIONS 6982 AND 6985 ARE EXPECTED TO PRODUCE M-CLASS ACTIVITY. REGION 6985 MAY ALSO PRODUCE A MAJOR FLARE.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 26/2100Z TO 27/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS AT MIDDLE LATITUDES. THE HIGH LATITUDE FIELD VARIED FROM UNSETTLED TO STORM LEVELS. THE STORMING WAS OBSERVED FROM 27/1200-1500Z.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE MOSTLY UNSETTLED.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 27/2100Z
sections.text: TO 28/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. NEW REGION 6991 (S10E81) PRODUCED AN M3 X-RAY BURST AT 28/1230Z AS IT ROUNDED THE EAST LIMB. ACCOMPANYING THE BURST WAS A BRIGHT SURGE REACHING 0.02 SOLAR RADII AND A 420 SFU TENFLARE. REGION 6982 (S14W48) WAS STABLE IN TERMS OF GROWTH, BUT REMAINED COMPLEX IN MAGNETIC STRUCTURE. IT PRODUCED FOUR FLARES THE LARGEST OF WHICH WAS A C5/SF AT 28/1826Z. REGION 6985 (S17W03) ENTERED A GRADUAL DECAY PHASE. REGION 6988 (S14E17) DISPLAYED MODERATE GROWTH IN SPOT NUMBER AND MAGNETIC COMPLEXITY.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE TO HIGH. REGION 6982 IS EXPECTED TO PRODUCE M-CLASS FLARES AND REMAINS CAPABLE OF ISOLATED MAJOR FLARE ACTIVITY. REGIONS 6988 AND 6991 MAY ALSO PRODUCE M-CLASS ACTIVITY.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 27/2100Z TO 28/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT QUIET TO ACTIVE LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS AT MIDDLE LATITUDES. THE HIGH LATITUDE FIELD VARIED FROM QUIET TO STORM LEVELS WITH THE STORMING OBSERVED FROM 28/1200-2100Z. AT THIS TIME THERE IS NO CLEAR SOURCE FOR THE STORMING.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE MOSTLY UNSETTLED.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 28/2100Z
sections.text: TO 29/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION 6982 (S13W61) PRODUCED BACK TO BACK M-FLARES VERY EARLY IN THE PERIOD. THE FIRST WAS A VERY IMPULSIVE M7/1B AT 29/2111Z THAT HAD AN ASSOCIATED 620 SFU TENFLARE. THIS WAS QUICKLY FOLLOWED BY A LONG DURATION SUBBRIGHT FLARE THAT GRADUALLY REACHED A MAXIMUM OF M2.7 AT 29/2323Z. A LOOP PROMINENCE SYSTEM ACCOMPANIED THIS FLARE. THIS REGION SIMPLIFIED SOMEWHAT IN MAGNETIC STRUCTURE AND PRODUCED TWO C-CLASS SUBFLARES DURING THE REMAINDER OF THE PERIOD. REGION 6985 (S16W17) ALSO DISPLAYED A GRADUAL DECREASE IN COMPLEXITY AND PRODUCED NO FLARES. NEW REGION 6992 (S13E20) WAS ASSIGNED.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE TO HIGH. REGION 6982 IS EXPECTED TO PRODUCE OCCASIONAL M-CLASS FLARES AND MAY ALSO PRODUCE AN ISOLATED MAJOR FLARE. REGIONS 6985 AND 6988 (S15E04) MAY PRODUCE ISOLATED M-CLASS FLARES.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 28/2100Z TO 29/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT MOSTLY UNSETTLED LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS AT MIDDLE LATITUDES. THE HIGH LATITUDES RANGED FROM UNSETTLED TO STORM LEVELS. THE STORMING OCCURRED FROM 29/0900-1200Z AND MAY HAVE BEEN CORONAL HOLE RELATED. AN ENHANCEMENT IN THE SATELLITE LEVEL PROTON FLUX AT GREATER THAN 10 MEV BEGAN NEAR 29/0400Z AND REMAINED IN PROGRESS, THOUGH VERY GRADUALLY DECLINING, DURING THE REMAINDER OF THE PERIOD. THIS ENHANCEMENT PROBABLY RESULTED FROM THE LONG DURATION M2 FLARE MENTIONED ABOVE.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE TOMORROW INCREASING TO MOSTLY ACTIVE LEVELS ON THE SECOND DAY (WITH STORMING POSSIBLE AT HIGH LATITUDES) AS A RESULT OF THE LONG DURATION M2 FLARE. CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED TO GRADUALLY DECLINE TO UNSETTLED LEVELS DURING THE THIRD DAY. THE PROTON ENHANCEMENT IS EXPECTED TO DECLINE TO BACKGROUND LEVELS TOMORROW.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 29/2100Z
sections.text: TO 30/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 6982 (S15W74) CONTINUED TO SLOWLY DECAY, BUT WAS ABLE TO MUSTER AN M4/SF FLARE AT 30/1018Z ASSOCIATED WITH A 500 SFU TENFLARE AND A SIGNIFICANT TYPE IV SWEEP. REGION 6985 (S17W29) ALSO DISPLAYED MINOR DECAY AND PRODUCED AN M2/2F FLARE AT 30/1239Z WITH MINOR RADIO BURSTS. REGION 6988 (S15W09) DISPLAYED AN INCREASE IN MAGNETIC FIELD GRADIENT AND SPOT NUMBER AND PRODUCED AN M2/2N FLARE AT 30/1937Z WHICH WAS ASSOCIATED WITH MINOR RADIO EMISSIONS. AN M3 X-RAY BURST OCCURRED AT 30/1654Z. BRIGHT SURGING WAS VISIBLE FROM BEHIND THE SOUTHEAST LIMB NEAR S14 AT THAT TIME AND WAS PROBABLY THE SOURCE OF THE X-RAY BURST. IT MAY POSSIBLY INDICATE THE RETURN OF OLD REGION 6958 (S17, L=340, CLASS/AREA EKI/540 ON 9 DECEMBER). NO NEW REGIONS WERE ASSIGNED.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE. REGIONS 6982, 6985, AND THE AS YET UNNUMBERED REGION BEHIND THE EAST LIMB MAY PRODUCE M-CLASS ACTIVITY. REGION 6988 IS ALSO EXPECTED TO PRODUCE M-CLASS ACTIVITY AND MAY ALSO PRODUCE A MAJOR FLARE.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 29/2100Z TO 30/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT QUIET TO ACTIVE LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS. THE ACTIVE LEVELS WERE BRIEF AND OCCURRED EARLY IN THE PERIOD. AN ISOLATED PERIOD OF MINOR STORMING OCCURRED AT HIGH LATITUDES NEAR 30/1800Z.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE MOSTLY ACTIVE TOMORROW, WITH MINOR STORMING POSSIBLE AT HIGH LATITUDES, IN RESPONSE TO THE LONG DURATION M2/SB FLARE THAT OCCURRED AT 29/2323Z. CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED TO GRADUALLY DECLINE TO UNSETTLED LEVELS FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE PERIOD.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 30/2100Z
sections.text: TO 31/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. FIVE M-CLASS EVENTS OCCURRED. REGION 6985 (S17W42) PRODUCED AN M4/2B FLARE AT 30/2309Z WHICH WAS ACCOMPANIED BY A MAJOR TYPE II SWEEP (EST. SHOCK VELOCITY 2500 KM/SEC) AND A 280 SFU TENFLARE. THIS REGION DISPLAYED GRADUAL DECAY DURING THE DAY. THERE WERE THREE OPTICALLY UNCORRELATED M-CLASS X-RAY BURSTS: AN M4 AT 31/0325Z, AN M2 AT 31/0753Z, AND AN M1 AT 31/1028Z. REGION 6988 (S16W22) PRODUCED THE FINAL M-CLASS EVENT OF THE PERIOD: AN M2/1N FLARE AT 31/1551Z. THIS REGION SHOWED GROWTH IN MAGNETIC FIELD STRENGTH AND COMPLEXITY. REGION 6982 (S15W86) DISPLAYED MINOR SURGING AS IT BEGAN TO CROSS THE WEST LIMB, BUT PRODUCED NO FLARES DURING THE PERIOD. TWO NEWLY NUMBERED REGIONS CROSSED THE EAST LIMB EARLY IN THE PERIOD: 6993 (S09E68) AND 6994 (S14E73). THESE REGIONS ARE VERTICALLY STACKED AND APPEAR TO BE INTERACTING IN THE FORM OF OCCASIONAL C-CLASS FLARE PRODUCTION. LIMB PROXIMITY PREVENTS A CONCISE ANALYSIS OF THE MORPHOLOGICAL ASPECTS OF THIS REGION COMPLEX. NEW REGION 6995 (N09W31) WAS ALSO NUMBERED.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE TO HIGH. REGIONS 6985, 6988, 6993, AND 6994 MAY PRODUCE M-CLASS FLARES. REGION 6988 MAY ALSO PRODUCE AN ISOLATED MAJOR FLARE.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 30/2100Z TO 31/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT QUIET TO UNSETTLED LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE UNSETTLED DURING THE FIRST DAY. ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO INCREASE TO MOSTLY ACTIVE LEVELS ON THE SECOND DAY IN RESPONSE TO THE M4/2B FLARE OF 30/2309Z. ACTIVITY SHOULD SUBSIDE TO UNSETTLED LEVELS BY THE FINAL DAY.
